Contratto e benefit: offriamo contratto a tempo indeterminato (CCNL Commercio) + ticket restaurant. La retribuzione sar√† commisurata all'effettiva esperienza del candidato.

Per contribuire al tuo sviluppo professionale avrai la possibilit√† di seguire corsi di formazione e di ottenere certificazioni relative al tuo settore.



Il presente annuncio √® rivolto ad entrambi i sessi e a persone di tutte le et√† e tutte le nazionalit√†.

Gli interessati possono inviare curriculum vitae corredato di autorizzazione al trattamento dei dati Informativa ai sensi degli Artt. 13 e 14 del Regolamento UE 2016/679 in materia di protezione dei dati personali. F2Informatica S.r.l., Titolare del trattamento, con sede legale in via Settembrini, 35, 20124, Milano, utilizza i dati che la riguardano esclusivamente per lo svolgimento dell'attivit√† di ricerca, selezione e valutazione del Personale. I Suoi dati saranno condivisi con terzi solo nei limiti di cui all'informativa estesa e saranno conservati presso per un periodo di tempo non superiore a 6 mesi. Per informazioni dettagliate, anche in ordine al Suo diritto di accesso agli altri Suoi diritti, pu√≤ contattare il nostro Referente Privacy all'indirizzo privacy@f2informatica.it o il nostro DPO al seguente indirizzo: dpo-f2informatica@oneseal.eu

4132132037,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-marketing-and-growth-italy-at-glovo-4132132037?position=56&pageNum=0&refId=4wIG1WUhBauNbsiq4WMEyQ%3D%3D&trackingId=%2FbY24egDk2ibp1AcDo%2BiaA%3D%3D,Data Analyst Marketing and Growth - Italy,Glovo,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.
A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.
We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.
ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.
We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.
Understand business needs and create insightful analysis helping your team to make the right decisions to boost Glovo presence and orders

Identify growth opportunities to increase our user base focusing on traffic, conversion and retention rates and leveraging on levers such as pricing, promotions, events, CRM and other marketing levers etc
Drive projects end-to-end translating business challenges into insights and actions
Identify growth opportunities to increase our user base, step change retention rates and maximize profitability
Take ownership of the reporting of KPIs by creating customized tools and using the available ones
Ensure these tools are scalable and up-to-date
Assist your colleagues in gaining access to the right data, and communicate and simplify concepts to the audience's needs
Drive clarity and solve ambiguity using data-driven approaches

Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how our users interact with both our consumer and business products, identify growth opportunities, and execute projects to drive growth and engagement
What You Will Bring To The Ride
1-3 years of work experience on analytical roles leading analysis and turning insights into actions
Bachelor's degree in Math, Engineering, Business, Stats, Quantitative field or Business
SQL proficiency is mandatory / Python is a plus
Ninja expertise with Excel / Google Sheets is a must
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau and Looker
Business acumen and passion for end-to-end project management (from ideation and analysis into implementation)
A hands-on attitude is a must. You‚Äôll have to roll up your sleeves!

Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.
üåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.

Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.
Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).
So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?
Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

  • Understand business needs and create insightful analysis helping your team to make the right decisions to boost Glovo presence and orders
  • Identify growth opportunities to increase our user base focusing on traffic, conversion and retention rates and leveraging on levers such as pricing, promotions, events, CRM and other marketing levers etc
  • Drive projects end-to-end translating business challenges into insights and actions
  • Identify growth opportunities to increase our user base, step change retention rates and maximize profitability
  • Take ownership of the reporting of KPIs by creating customized tools and using the available ones
  • Ensure these tools are scalable and up-to-date
  • Assist your colleagues in gaining access to the right data, and communicate and simplify concepts to the audience's needs
  • Drive clarity and solve ambiguity using data-driven approaches
  • Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how our users interact with both our consumer and business products, identify growth opportunities, and execute projects to drive growth and engagement

What You Will Bring To The Ride

  • 1-3 years of work experience on analytical roles leading analysis and turning insights into actions
  • Bachelor's degree in Math, Engineering, Business, Stats, Quantitative field or Business
  • SQL proficiency is mandatory / Python is a plus
  • Ninja expertise with Excel / Google Sheets is a must
  • Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau and Looker
  • Business acumen and passion for end-to-end project management (from ideation and analysis into implementation)
  • A hands-on attitude is a must. You‚Äôll have to roll up your sleeves!
  • Proficiency in English
  • Strong consumer understanding skills

Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves

  • üåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
  • üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
  • üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
  • üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
  • üë™ Enhanced parental leave.
  • üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.

Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

4193457083,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-milano-it-at-alten-italia-4193457083?position=57&pageNum=0&refId=4wIG1WUhBauNbsiq4WMEyQ%3D%3D&trackingId=9KrNR9jJKV5JBY5TCQrFww%3D%3D,Data Analyst (Milano) - IT,ALTEN Italia,"Settala, Lombardy, Italy","Ruolo: Data Analyst
Luogo: In modalit√† ibrida su Settala (MI)
ALTEN supporta le strategie di sviluppo dei propri clienti nelle aree dell‚Äôinnovazione, della R&D e dei sistemi informativi tecnologici.

Nato pi√π di 30 anni fa e presente in 30 Paesi, il Gruppo ALTEN si √® affermato come leader mondiale nell‚Äôingegneria e nei Servizi IT e leader Europeo per la consulenza nell'industria Life Sciences.

Lavoriamo con attori chiave nei settori: Aeronautico &Spaziale, della Difesa & Navale, della Sicurezza, Automobilistico, Ferroviario, dell‚ÄôEnergia, del Life Sciences, Finanziario, del Retail e dei Servizi.

Con un fatturato di oltre 4.069 miliardi di euro, abbiamo attualmente pi√π di 57.400 collaboratori in tutto il mondo. In Italia siamo presenti in 12 citt√† lungo tutto il territorio nazionale: Torino, Milano, Gallarate, Brescia, Genova, Modena, Maranello, Bologna, Firenze, Roma, Napoli e Bari.
Analizzerai i dati aziendali per fornire insight strategici e supportare il decision-making
Svilupperai e ottimizzerai dashboard interattive e report su Power BI
Estrarrai, pulirai e trasformerai i dati da diverse fonti per garantire qualit√† e coerenza
Collaborerai con team interni per definire KPI e migliorare la reportistica aziendale
Creerai modelli di analisi per individuare trend, anomalie e opportunit√† di miglioramento
Ti occuperai della documentazione e della presentazione dei risultati a stakeholder interni ed esterni.
Almeno 3 anni di esperienza come Data Analyst o in ruoli simili
Ottima conoscenza di Power BI per la creazione di report e dashboard avanzate
Esperienza nell'elaborazione e trasformazione dati con SQL
Familiarit√† con strumenti di ETL e Data Warehousing √® un plus
Conoscenza di Excel avanzato per analisi e modellazione dei dati
Buona comprensione di concetti di business intelligence e analisi dei dati
Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese (orale e scritta) per interfacciarsi con team internazionali.

Crediamo che la tecnologia abbia un grande potenziale per migliorare il nostro futuro, per questo ricerchiamo talenti che siano motivati a costruire oggi il mondo di domani. Con il nostro portfolio clienti e i diversi progetti di R&D attivi, in ALTEN avrai modo di lavorare su progetti all'avanguardia. La nostra Technical Direction ti accompagner√† e indirizzer√† durante il tuo percorso. Avrai la possibilit√† di metterti alla prova in contesti progettuali diversi e di confrontarti con esperti del settore per ampliare sempre pi√π le tue conoscenze. Potrai unire le tue passioni e metterti in gioco professionalmente. Accetti la sfida?

Ci impegniamo a favorire un ambiente di lavoro sereno e collaborativo organizzando attivit√† di team building, iniziative di aggregazione, eventi sportivi, per conoscerci meglio e condividere momenti insieme. Il successo di un gruppo si fonda sulla cooperazione e condivisione reciproca del sapere e degli interessi.

In ALTEN troverai corsi formativi all‚Äôavanguardia per accrescere le tue competenze sia tecnologiche, sia linguistiche! Tramite ALTEN Academy potrai ottenere certificazioni con alcuni dei pi√π importanti schemi internazionali come IREB¬Æ, ISTQB¬Æ e altri. Attraverso Aula Streaming, invece, avrai accesso a corsi di formazione pi√π trasversali relativi a soft skills e potrai scegliere tra 12 corsi di lingua straniera.

Crediamo che la tecnologia sia a supporto dello sviluppo sociale e della tutela ambientale. Oltre a collaborare a progetti che mirano alla sostenibilit√†, ci impegniamo a sostenere le cause che pi√π abbiamo a cuore, avendo collaborato e collaborando, tra gli altri, con AISM, AIRC, LILT, Save the Children, Treedom, This Unique. Valorizziamo l'unicit√† e ci impegniamo a garantire che tutte le nostre persone abbiano pari opportunit√† all'interno della nostra azienda, fornendo loro gli strumenti per esprimere al massimo il proprio potenziale. Il nostro approccio alla diversit√† e all'inclusione si fonda sui principi di etica e integrit√† e rappresenta il fattore determinante per lo sviluppo di orizzonti di crescita personale e aziendale pi√π ampi. Promuoviamo l'inserimento e l'integrazione lavorativa delle persone appartenenti alle categorie protette - in base a quanto disciplinato dalla legge 68/99.
Una volta ricevuto il tuo cv, ci prenderemo il tempo necessario per valutarlo attentamente.
Se sar√† in linea con questa o con altre posizioni aperte all‚Äôinterno del Gruppo, il nostro team Talent Acquisition ti contatter√† telefonicamente.

L‚Äôiter di selezione proseguir√† con un colloquio conoscitivo con l'area Business, un successivo colloquio pi√π approfondito, durante il quale potrebbe essere richiesto un test pratico, ed infine un colloquio tecnico.
L‚Äôordine e il numero delle interviste potrebbero variare a seconda delle esigenze di selezione.

In alternativa, saremo felici di conservare il tuo CV nel nostro gestionale per poterlo rivalutare per opportunit√† future. Operando in 12 diverse citt√† e altrettanti settori, potrebbero contattarti pi√π Talent Acquisition Partner e/o pi√π Business Manager, se riterranno che il tuo profilo sia in linea con i progetti e le necessit√† che stanno ricercando in quel momento.
Se dovessi identificare ulteriori offerte di tuo interesse e in linea con il tuo profilo, aspettiamo la tua candidatura per poterla valutare nuovamente.

ALTEN opera nel rispetto dei principi di diversit√†, equit√† ed inclusione, che alimentano i nostri valori. ALTEN ha l‚Äôobiettivo di abbattere ogni barriera e pregiudizio, garantendo un ambiente di lavoro accessibile ed accogliente, valutando candidature indipendentemente da genere, etnia, disabilit√† (artt. 1 e 18, legge 68/99), et√†, orientamento sessuale, religione, stato civile, convinzioni personali e politiche, appartenenza ad organizzazioni sindacali, responsabilit√† familiari e back-ground socio-economico.

4186296351,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-expert-at-hype-4186296351?position=58&pageNum=0&refId=4wIG1WUhBauNbsiq4WMEyQ%3D%3D&trackingId=%2FKwbsNxI0SthYU2Il5PsHA%3D%3D,Business Intelligence Expert,HYPE,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Mollo tutto e vado lavorare in banca.
Siamo la neobank italiana con sede a Milano ‚Äì Biella ‚Äì Torino che dal 2015 reinterpreta il mondo del banking tradizionale in modo accessibile, contemporaneo e intuitivo.
Abbiamo costruito un‚Äôapp per rispondere con semplicit√† e immediatezza ai bisogni finanziari di chiunque, ogni giorno.

4184235900,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-science-analyst-at-generali-4184235900?position=1&pageNum=2&refId=Ag0zMprHlpsH5ARsy9tz8g%3D%3D&trackingId=y%2FnLVfxGkBXvyS9sDc7KeQ%3D%3D,Data Science Analyst,Generali,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","For the Central Team of Generali Global Corporate & Commercial (GC&C), we are looking for a Data Science Analyst to join our Insurance Department. Reporting to the Head of Technical Excellence, this position is key to leveraging data insights for comprehensive technical analysis, pricing strategies, and effective portfolio management. With a dynamic, cross-functional approach, the role includes demanding data integration across key domains such as Underwriting, Risk Engineering, and Claims, thereby contributing significantly to the company's strategic objectives. In addition, you will contribute to the development of the sustainability agenda of GC&C, working on carbon emission, green energy, and climate change initiatives.
Supporting the analysis of the overall GC&C portfolio results, trends and patterns
Designing and deploying the portfolio management discipline
Assisting BU in the target setting and supporting BU in achieving targets
Performing data quality checks at all stages of portfolio management
Preparation and steering of Portfolio review meetings
Assisting UW functions in steering the business accordingly.
Working collaboratively on pioneering new actuarial tools, integrating Machine Learning algorithms to enhance predictive capabilities
Actively participate in defining business requirements to evolve the TechEx technology stack, in partnership with Operations
Facilitate training sessions for the GC&C underwriting community on the TechEx tool suite, promoting skill enhancement and tool.
Driving forward GC&C sustainability initiatives also in collaboration with Group Head Office
Contributing to the development of a technical framework to embed Net Zero targets into GC&C underwriting strategy.
The ideal candidate will meet the following requirements:
Studied Actuarial Science, Mathematics or Statistics or other quantitative disciplines, e.g. Engineering, Physics etc.
Quantitative, analytical mindset, problem solving skills
Insurance business processes knowledge experience is welcome
Familiarity with Python and R is valued
Must be fluent in Italian, English, additional languages are an advantage
Generali is a major player in the global insurance industry ‚Äì a strategic and highly important sector for the growth, development and welfare of modern societies.

Over almost 200 years, we have built a multinational group that is present in more than 50 countries, with 470 companies and nearly 82,000 employees. Our group aims to become the standard bearer and industry leader in the European retail insurance market, building on our existing base of 50 million retail clients, out of an overall total of 72 million.

Global Corporate & Commercial is the Generali Group unit developing P&C business and insurance services for medium and large companies. The unit acts on a global scale and deploys an integrated approach at Group level with a central management team and specialized teams active in individual countries. Through GC&C, Generali aims to become a key world player in the corporate-commercial segment.

Generali is proud to be an inclusive employer that considers applicants regardless of gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, disability, religion, political views, marital status or philosophy of life.
If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation or assistance, we will support you during the selection process.

5+ years experience as an IT data analyst working on software development projects

Are you a talented Data Analyst ready to join Nestl√© Workforce 360 Everyday Digital team in Milan, Italy?

The Data Analyst role that supports Everyday Digital, involves collecting, analyzing, and interpreting complex data sets to provide actionable insights that support business decision-making. The role is essential for driving data-driven strategies and improving organizational performance across Zone/GMBs /functions to support our Everyday Digital program and Winning with People and Teams OMP priority.
A Day in the Life of a Business Analyst ‚Äì Data Analyst for Everyday Digital
Data Collection: Gather data from various sources, including databases, surveys, and external datasets, ensuring accuracy and relevance
Data Cleaning and Preparation: Clean and preprocess data to eliminate inconsistencies, errors, and missing values, making it suitable for analysis.
Data Analysis: Utilize statistical methods and analytical tools to analyze complex data sets, identifying trends, patterns, and correlations.
Reporting and Visualization: Create comprehensive reports and visualizations (e.g., charts, graphs) to present findings clearly and effectively to stakeholders.
Key Performance Indicator (KPI) Tracking: Monitor and evaluate KPIs to assess business performance and identify areas for improvement.
Collaboration: Work closely with Analaytics, Data & Integrration team (ADI) to build operationally sustainable analytic solutions.
Decision Support: Provide actionable insights and recommendations based on data analysis to support strategic decision-making processes.
Documentation: Maintain thorough documentation of data sources, methodologies, and analysis processes for transparency and reproducibility.
Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for enhancing data collection and analysis processes to improve efficiency and effectiveness.
Data Governance: Ensure compliance with data governance policies and standards, safeguarding data integrity and confidentiality.
What else will make you successful?
Data Analysis Tools: Proficiency in tools such as Excel, SQL, Python, or R for data manipulation and analysis.
Data Visualization: Experience with visualization tools like Power BI, or similar to present data insights effectively.
Understanding of statistical concepts and methods to interpret data accurately and draw meaningful conclusions.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically about data and its implications for business decisions.
A keen eye for detail to ensure data accuracy and identify anomalies or inconsistencies in data sets.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills to convey complex findings to non-technical stakeholders clearly and effectively.
Understanding of the industry and business context to provide relevant insights and recommendations that align with organizational goals.
Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide support.
Strong organizational skills to manage multiple projects, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines effectively.
Willingness to learn and adapt to new tools, technologies, and methodologies as the data landscape evolves.
Understanding of data privacy regulations and governance principles to ensure compliance and ethical handling of data
Only cvs submitted in English will be considered.

  • Located in Nestl√© Milan Headquarters
  • Nestl√© welcomes people with disabilities

  • Full-time in the Milan HQ with some flexibility to work remotely

Vogliamo essere la scintilla che d√† vita alle tue ispirazioni e al tuo successo. Per questo motivo ti offriamo tutte le risorse, le competenze tecniche specifiche e le community tematiche, per sviluppare i tuoi interessi e le tue ambizioni.

Cerchiamo Transformation leader in grado di guidare trasformazioni complesse attraverso tecnologia, human e innovation, e capaci di coniugare conoscenze tecnologiche e visione del futuro.

Perch√© dovresti scegliere EY Consulting?

Da subito entrerai a far parte di team e settori diversificati, partecipando attivamente ai processi di trasformazione e di innovazione di aziende, societ√† e Pubbliche Amministrazioni per creare un impatto sul Paese.

Costruirai la carriera che desideri grazie a percorsi di formazione su hard e soft skill, community e hub tecnologici, dove potrai quotidianamente provare, sperimentare e crescere.

Questa √® la tua opportunit√† per sviluppare le tue competenze e per fare qualcosa di eccezionale per te, per noi, per il mondo. The exceptional EY experience, it‚Äôs yours to build.

Qual √® il contesto in cui verrai inserito?

Come Senior Data Analyst farai parte della divisione AI&
column2:
Data, entrerai a far parte del team Data Visualization che √® basato a Milano, Roma, Bari, Cagliari e Trieste.

    Una forte voglia di cambiare il mondo, per il meglio In EY diamo luogo ad una trasformazione, mettendo il nostro purpose - Building a better working world - al centro di tutto ci√≤ che facciamo, e siamo convinti di poter contribuire alla trasformazione del Paese con una forte e precisa idea di futuro e di innovazione.

We want to innovate the financial services offered by commercial/retail banks in Italy in the areas of wealth management, credit lending, risk management and compliance. Building on our consolidated expertise and product offering in the Capital Markets domain, we want to scale our solutions and frameworks to the commercial/retail banking industry. To do so, we start from the quantitative modelling and analysis of the current processes put in place by our customers, so that we can profile opportunities of automation and prioritize client needs on manual/painful workflows. The resource will be involved in business process analyses of Italian commercial/retail financial institutions and is expected to integrate structured information extracted from interviews with the analysis of literature and documentation to build a quantitative picture of the AS-IS. The analysis will then be complemented with a consequent implementation analysis and product roadmap definition to design the TO-BE and drive product evolutions and developments. The project entails modelling complex business contexts, extracting structured information from unstructured sources, performing quantitative analyses, presenting findings and recommendations to external clients and internal stakeholders, contributing to the definition of product backlogs.
What You Will Learn During Your Intern
Codification of customer requirements, needs, activities
Business intelligence with PowerBI/Excel - Packaging high-quality deliverables for external clients ‚Äì
Data manipulation with Pandas or Spark/Hive
Hands-on experience with BI tools (Excel, PowerBI)
Experience with Python data science libraries (pandas, pyspark, sklearn) is nice to have
We Are Looking For Someone Who
is passionate about modelling unknown business contexts with a quantitative approach
can find a good trade-off between quality and speed of delivery
proactively contribute your insights and ideas in a way that fits existing frameworks of the firm
is fond of sharing knowledge with colleagues and documenting your work

At ION

We want to innovate the financial services offered by commercial/retail banks in Italy in the areas of wealth management, credit lending, risk management and compliance. Building on our consolidated expertise and product offering in the Capital Markets domain, we want to scale our solutions and frameworks to the commercial/retail banking industry. To do so, we start from the quantitative modelling and analysis of the current processes put in place by our customers, so that we can profile opportunities of automation and prioritize client needs on manual/painful workflows. The resource will be involved in business process analyses of Italian commercial/retail financial institutions and is expected to integrate structured information extracted from interviews with the analysis of literature and documentation to build a quantitative picture of the AS-IS. The analysis will then be complemented with a consequent implementation analysis and product roadmap definition to design the TO-BE and drive product evolutions and developments. The project entails modelling complex business contexts, extracting structured information from unstructured sources, performing quantitative analyses, presenting findings and recommendations to external clients and internal stakeholders, contributing to the definition of product backlogs.

What You Will Learn During Your Intern

  • Quantitative modelling of business processes
  • Codification of customer requirements, needs, activities
  • Business intelligence with PowerBI/Excel - Packaging high-quality deliverables for external clients ‚Äì
  • Data manipulation with Pandas or Spark/Hive

What You Need To Know

  • Hands-on experience with BI tools (Excel, PowerBI)
  • Experience with Python data science libraries (pandas, pyspark, sklearn) is nice to have
  • Fluent English

We Are Looking For Someone Who

  • is passionate about modelling unknown business contexts with a quantitative approach
  • can find a good trade-off between quality and speed of delivery
  • proactively contribute your insights and ideas in a way that fits existing frameworks of the firm
  • is fond of sharing knowledge with colleagues and documenting your work

4130498632,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-subito-4130498632?position=6&pageNum=2&refId=Ag0zMprHlpsH5ARsy9tz8g%3D%3D&trackingId=n1r6VAzxXDduZhjDcM4btA%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Subito,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","We‚Äôre Adevinta, a global leader in digital marketplaces. Our household name brands, including Marktplaats in the Netherlands, mobile.de in Germany and leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.

We‚Äôre all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever they‚Äôre looking for in their local communities ‚Äì whether it‚Äôs a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.

Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.
What You‚Äôll Do & Who You Are
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Subito‚Äôs team. Our mission is to turn data into insights, and get a clear understanding of the Italian market and marketplace industry.
The Data Analyst will be part of the Business Analytics team mainly supporting the Management Team, Finance, Marketing and Sales departments in the decision making process.
The Data Analyst will study user behaviour, evaluate strategic initiatives and new features. Above all, your work will impact the growth of our business.

Mash up and analyse different data sets to support the business with high-value insights (we have some data engineering heroes, so it‚Äôs more analysing than mashing up!) and structure presentations showing the findings to a variety of stakeholders
Formulate/test hypotheses to explain underlying reasons about business dynamics
Design clear, automated reports to democratise data access to the whole company
Work in a cross functional team, mostly focusing on the business insights generation in collaboration with colleagues of Marketing, Finance and Sales departments
Contribute both on short term analysis and long term initiatives, either local or global
Dig deep in our data lake and build Machine Learning models to make Subito a smarter product and enhance business understanding
4+ years of experience as Data Analyst / Data Scientist
Knowledge of one or more analytics languages, ideally Python
Data visualization and presentation skills to match a wide range of audiences
Prior experience in a digital company
Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP...)
Hands on experience on Data Science projects
Opportunity to shape the way we work. Your feedback and opinions are valued at all levels of the organisation
Benefits including stock purchase plan and annual bonus plans
Flexibility to work when and how you want - flexible hours, autonomy to set your own agenda, choice of phone and computer
Smart Working Policy - work remotely some of the time, balanced with time in the office together with your team - between 5 and 45 days per quarter in the office depending on each team.
‚ÄòWork from anywhere‚Äô weeks - up to four weeks working from anywhere, as long as you have an internet connection!
Career development, including language classes and Adevinta Academies: specialised content built by our experts on Machine Learning, Agile, Leadership and more

For each working day, you will be eligible for a ‚Ç¨8 meal voucher., You can use our local provider Fitprime to maintain physical well-being., You will receive 250 euros on the welfare platform after the birth of your child

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don‚Äôt meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don‚Äôt meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

We‚Äôre all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever they‚Äôre looking for in their local communities ‚Äì whether it‚Äôs a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.

Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.

What You‚Äôll Do &
column2:
Who You Are

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Subito‚Äôs team. Our mission is to turn data into insights, and get a clear understanding of the Italian market and marketplace industry.

The Data Analyst will be part of the Business Analytics team mainly supporting the Management Team, Finance, Marketing and Sales departments in the decision making process.

The Data Analyst will study user behaviour, evaluate strategic initiatives and new features. Above all, your work will impact the growth of our business.

Your Typical Day

  • Mash up and analyse different data sets to support the business with high-value insights (we have some data engineering heroes, so it‚Äôs more analysing than mashing up!) and structure presentations showing the findings to a variety of stakeholders
  • Formulate/test hypotheses to explain underlying reasons about business dynamics
  • Design clear, automated reports to democratise data access to the whole company
  • Work in a cross functional team, mostly focusing on the business insights generation in collaboration with colleagues of Marketing, Finance and Sales departments
  • Contribute both on short term analysis and long term initiatives, either local or global
  • Dig deep in our data lake and build Machine Learning models to make Subito a smarter product and enhance business understanding

Skills Required

  • 4+ years of experience as Data Analyst / Data Scientist
  • Highly proficient with SQL
  • Knowledge of one or more analytics languages, ideally Python
  • Applied knowledge of statistical techniques
  • Data visualization and presentation skills to match a wide range of audiences

Plus

  • Good English proficiency level
  • Prior experience in a digital company
  • Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP...)
  • Hands on experience on Data Science projects

Benefits

  • Competitive compensation package
  • Opportunity to shape the way we work. Your feedback and opinions are valued at all levels of the organisation
  • Benefits including stock purchase plan and annual bonus plans
  • Flexibility to work when and how you want - flexible hours, autonomy to set your own agenda, choice of phone and computer
  • Smart Working Policy - work remotely some of the time, balanced with time in the office together with your team - between 5 and 45 days per quarter in the office depending on each team.
  • ‚ÄòWork from anywhere‚Äô weeks - up to four weeks working from anywhere, as long as you have an internet connection!
  • Career development, including language classes and Adevinta Academies: specialised content built by our experts on Machine Learning, Agile, Leadership and more

For each working day, you will be eligible for a ‚Ç¨8 meal voucher., You can use our local provider Fitprime to maintain physical well-being., You will receive 250 euros on the welfare platform after the birth of your child

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don‚Äôt meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

fifty-five √® una data-company di un nuovo genere che aiuta i brand a sfruttare i dati per migliorare il marketing, i media e l'esperienza del cliente grazie a una combinazione di servizi di consulenza e tecnologia specializzata, pilastro del Brandtech Group nel settore data e marketing, propone un'ampia gamma di servizi che fondono consulenza strategica, services cloud, expertise media e miglioramento della customer experience.

fifty-five conta pi√π di 400 esperti digitali. Consulenti digitali, specialisti di tracking e media, ingegneri e data scientist lavorano in sinergia per fornire consulenze di marketing di alto livello e assistenza tecnica ai brand in tutti i settori, in tutto il mondo.

Come partner fidato degli inserzionisti nella gestione dei dati per la loro raccolta, attivazione e valorizzazione,¬† supportiamo le organizzazioni nel divenire realt√† omnicanale efficaci attraverso la gestione dell'ecosistema digitale e l'integrazione con il mondo fisico.

Con sede a Parigi, operiamo su 3 fusi orari dai nostri 10 uffici situati a Parigi, Londra, Ginevra, Milano, Shanghai, Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Taipei, Singapore e New York. Fifty-five attribuisce particolare importanza al benessere dei suoi collaboratori.

4199463044,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-mainstreaming-4199463044?position=6&pageNum=5&refId=1iN4cMJEgHrCjYeimJ3GLg%3D%3D&trackingId=7IEf8J%2FFjwr%2BtKrVqqPqmA%3D%3D,Data Analyst,MainStreaming,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","MainStreaming¬Æ is an intelligent media delivery company that empowers enterprises, media and gaming companies to ensure the best Quality of Experience to their audience, through its revolutionary AI-powered technology.

It optimizes the viewing experience with its Intelligent Media Deliver Platform (iMDP), the first platform designed to guarantee full governance over the streaming process, the highest Quality of Service and the best Return on Investment

We seek a results-driven Data Analyst to spearhead our company's performance management and analytical initiatives. In this key role, you will define KPIs across the organization, develop comprehensive performance frameworks, and deliver critical insights to our C-Level leadership team through data-driven analyses and quarterly business reviews.
Define and implement Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) across all departments to drive data-informed decision-making.
Develop and maintain a comprehensive performance management framework to monitor company objectives, analyze current operational performance metrics, and track progress against strategic goals.
Perform complex cross-functional analyses by extracting, combining, and interpreting data from multiple sources to uncover actionable insights.
Design and deliver quarterly business review presentations for C-Level executives, highlighting performance trends, identifying areas for improvement, and recommending data-driven solutions.

Extract, transform, and clean data from various sources and databases to ensure data integrity and consistency for analysis. Collaborate with stakeholders across departments to understand business requirements and translate them into analytical frameworks.
Create and maintain interactive dashboards and reports to visualize key metrics and facilitate data-driven discussions.
Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, Computer Science, or related field
column2: Master's degree preferred.

column1: 3+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or similar analytical roles.
Experience in conducting analyses and analyzing performance data within the Content Delivery Network (CDN) or ISP industry is a plus.
Strong analytical skills with demonstrated ability to transform complex data into actionable insights.
Proficient in SQL for data extraction and manipulation from various database systems.
Working knowledge of Python for data cleaning, analysis, and visualization (pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib).
Experience in designing and implementing KPIs and performance-tracking frameworks
Excellent data visualization skills and experience with BI tools (such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker).
Fluent English and outstanding written and verbal communication abilities are required.
Execution & Precision: Strong attention to detail, ability to meet deadlines, and accuracy in financial reporting.
Ownership & Accountability: Taking responsibility for work, following through on commitments, and delivering high-quality results.
Adaptability & Resilience: Thriving in a fast-paced environment, responding well to change, and maintaining professionalism under pressure.
Collaboration & Influence: Working effectively across teams, promoting knowledge sharing, and fostering a culture of transparency.
Continuous Learning: Proactively seeking opportunities to enhance financial expertise and industry knowledge.
A young, dynamic and entrepreneurial environment that promotes self-development and growth.
Breakfast, lunch and snacks in the office.
Salary and benefits will be assessed in relation to the candidate's experience and skills

In MainStreaming you will be part of a dynamic, flexible, young, tight-knit and international environment and will have the chance to work in a company that values innovation, out of the box thinking, its employees and is committed to making the world a better place.

MainStreaming is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

Data Analyst


Job Description:


We seek a results-driven Data Analyst to spearhead our company's performance management and analytical initiatives. In this key role, you will define KPIs across the organization, develop comprehensive performance frameworks, and deliver critical insights to our C-Level leadership team through data-driven analyses and quarterly business reviews.


Key Responsibilities:


  • Define and implement Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) across all departments to drive data-informed decision-making.
  • Develop and maintain a comprehensive performance management framework to monitor company objectives, analyze current operational performance metrics, and track progress against strategic goals.
  • Perform complex cross-functional analyses by extracting, combining, and interpreting data from multiple sources to uncover actionable insights.
  • Design and deliver quarterly business review presentations for C-Level executives, highlighting performance trends, identifying areas for improvement, and recommending data-driven solutions.
  • Extract, transform, and clean data from various sources and databases to ensure data integrity and consistency for analysis. Collaborate with stakeholders across departments to understand business requirements and translate them into analytical frameworks.
  • Create and maintain interactive dashboards and reports to visualize key metrics and facilitate data-driven discussions.


Qualifications:


  • Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, Computer Science, or related field

4191469252,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst%E2%80%94interest-registration-at-bending-spoons-4191469252?position=8&pageNum=5&refId=1iN4cMJEgHrCjYeimJ3GLg%3D%3D&trackingId=gj6Xpr7hYz2K%2BsPtzoZAFg%3D%3D,Data Analyst‚ÄîInterest registration,Bending Spoons,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","‚ö†Ô∏è This position isn‚Äôt open at the moment, but we‚Äôre always on the lookout for exceptional talent. Register your interest today, and you‚Äôll be among the first we consider when recruitment begins.

At Bending Spoons, we‚Äôre striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.

To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform‚Äîwhich comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor‚Äôs attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.

For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That‚Äôs our promise to such a candidate.
A few examples of your responsibilities
Collaborate with Product and Business teams to determine the most pressing questions that big data can help answer, and then figure out how to uncover those insights.
Query and analyze massive sets of usage data to identify product-improvement opportunities and actionable insights to profoundly impact our product strategy and roadmap.
Create brief, high-quality reports to explain your findings and discuss their implications with the relevant team members.
Screen the app stores and study competing products in search of insights and ideas we could learn from.
Help direct the development of our technologies devoted to the acquisition, storage, and manipulation of big data, supporting our efforts to constantly break new ground in this field.

Reasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.

Drive. You‚Äôre extremely ambitious in everything you do‚Äîand your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high‚Äîand rising‚Äîbar.

Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You‚Äôre reliable, honest, and transparent.
Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.
Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You‚Äôll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.

An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential‚Äîthen, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you‚Äôve got what it takes, you‚Äôll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.

Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of ‚Ç¨52,246. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.

All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.

Bending Spoons is a demanding environment: We‚Äôre extremely ambitious and we ask a lot of ourselves and one another. While this tends to lead to fantastic learning, achievements, and career growth, it also requires a significant commitment. So if you like the role and are ready to give your very best, don‚Äôt hesitate to apply.

We welcome applications in English and Italian. If you pass our screening, we‚Äôll ask you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. If you‚Äôre successful with those, we‚Äôll invite you to a series of interviews.

Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and we provide reasonable accommodations for an applicant with disabilities, which can be requested at accommodations-ext@bendingspoons.com.

Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn‚Äôt a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

  • Collaborate with Product and Business teams to determine the most pressing questions that big data can help answer, and then figure out how to uncover those insights.
  • Query and analyze massive sets of usage data to identify product-improvement opportunities and actionable insights to profoundly impact our product strategy and roadmap.
  • Create brief, high-quality reports to explain your findings and discuss their implications with the relevant team members.
  • Screen the app stores and study competing products in search of insights and ideas we could learn from.
  • Help direct the development of our technologies devoted to the acquisition, storage, and manipulation of big data, supporting our efforts to constantly break new ground in this field.


What we look for

  • Reasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.
  • Drive. You‚Äôre extremely ambitious in everything you do‚Äîand your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high‚Äîand rising‚Äîbar.
  • Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You‚Äôre reliable, honest, and transparent.
  • Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.


What we offer

  • Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You‚Äôll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.
  • An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential‚Äîthen, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you‚Äôve got what it takes, you‚Äôll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.
  • Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of ‚Ç¨52,246. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.
  • All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.


Commitment &
column2:
contract

Permanent or fixed-term. Full-time.


Location

Milan (Italy) or fully remote.


Before you apply

Bending Spoons is a demanding environment: We‚Äôre extremely ambitious and we ask a lot of ourselves and one another. While this tends to lead to fantastic learning, achievements, and career growth, it also requires a significant commitment. So if you like the role and are ready to give your very best, don‚Äôt hesitate to apply.


The selection process

We welcome applications in English and Italian. If you pass our screening, we‚Äôll ask you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. If you‚Äôre successful with those, we‚Äôll invite you to a series of interviews.


Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and we provide reasonable accommodations for an applicant with disabilities, which can be requested at accommodations-ext@bendingspoons.com.


Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn‚Äôt a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

NATO‚Äôs Public Diplomacy efforts serve a vital function within the Alliance by communicating its purpose and priorities to audiences worldwide. In fulfilling this role, the Public Diplomacy Division (PDD) actively strengthens NATO‚Äôs public image, thereby fostering trust in and support for the Alliance. The Division also acts as coordinator for strategic communication activities across all NATO civilian and military bodies and commands.

The Data Insights and Information Threats section sits within PDD. It comprises the Information Environment Assessment (IEA) Unit, Audience Research Team, and a team managing strategic communications policy and NATO‚Äôs work on countering information threats. The Information Environment Assessment Unit, comprised of an Analysis and a Data Team, is the engine that provides data and evidence-based analysis of, and insights into, the information environment. The Unit develops action-orientated reporting and alerting to help NATO improve its Strategic Communications, as well as engagement with relevant stakeholders internally and externally.

The incumbent carries out the duties of IEA Data Analyst in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment. They are responsible for applying data analytics to the collection and analysis of multiple publicly and commercially available data sources and services. Additionally, the incumbent produces analytical products with actionable recommendations, supporting data-driven decision making and helping to ensure a strategic approach to PDD‚Äôs multifaceted communications. They also help to shape the acquisition and adoption of cutting-edge analytical tools to help NATO‚Äôs IEA capability evolve.
possess a university degree, from an institute of a recognized standing, in a field relevant for the role (preferably such as data science or international relations)
have 2 years of professional experience in data analytics, and qualitative and quantitative research methods
possess proven experience applying data analytics to the collection and analysis of traditional and social media
possess proven experience in developing reporting products for senior and/or executive audiences
be able to explain data as a convincing story
have excellent communication, drafting and oral presentation skills
have strong interpersonal skills, and the ability to interact within a multicultural team and with diverse stakeholders across the Organization
possess the following minimum levels of NATO‚Äôs official languages (English/French): V (‚ÄúAdvanced‚Äù) in one
column2: I (‚ÄúBeginner‚Äù) in the other.

column1: The following would be considered an advantage:
experience with quantitative methods and their application to trend analysis
basic knowledge of programming languages, such as Python
geographic expertise (Russia, China or/and Middle East North Africa)
experience with methods and techniques to evaluate and assess communications activities, including relevant measurement and assessment frameworks and tools

knowledge of and/or experience in analysing information threats, using publicly and commercially available data sources and services to characterize threat actors‚Äô campaigns, capabilities, and their tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs)
knowledge of and/or experience in implementing best-practice analytical methodologies to structure and scale data models for analysing information threats.

Contribute in an active, timely and well-coordinated manner to PDD‚Äôs work in the area of Information Environment Assessment, by delivering high quality reports including actionable recommendations based on the assessment of the information environment. Glean and share insights with PDD leadership on information threats targeting NATO.

Keep abreast of industry developments relevant to Information Environment Assessment, including emerging best practice analytical methodologies. Provide clear insight and recommendations to civilian and military staffs from multiple disciplines, including those directly responsible for analysing and evaluating information and communications products. Ensure that this expertise is translated into effective Information Environment Assessments reporting. Use sound political judgement when making recommendations on adjusting NATO‚Äôs communications based on regular analysis and assessment.

Apply data analytics to the collection and analysis of traditional and social media. Contribute to improving the quality, scope and operational relevance of the IEA reports delivered by PDD. Identify and analyse trends, and distil actionable insights to brief NATO communicators and decision-makers. Test traditional media, social media and disinformation analysis tools and advise on procurement and contracted services.

Work closely with the IEA Unit, Audience Research Team and StratCom policy team within the section to integrate IEA into the communications planning process and coordinate seamlessly with other sections within PDD. Develop and maintain professional relationships across the civilian and military staff to promote synergies within and between different disciplines, including intelligence, cyber, operations, data policy, logistics, and information management. Work with Allies and partners, including the European External Acton Service and G7 Rapid Response Mechanism, to exchange expertise related to analysing information threats. Coordinate effectively with various stakeholders in order to get useful inputs with actionable recommendations for the delivery of regular IEA reports. Identify, strengthen and build relationships with partners, researchers and other experts to become better informed on IEA.

Plan and deliver reports within tight deadlines on issues of relevance to PDD and senior NATO leadership. Demonstrate political acumen when selecting topics and analysing and assessing trends in the information environment. Work with other divisions at NATO to deliver briefings for senior NATO staff. Use initiative to recommend opportunities for Information Environment Assessment.
Perform any other related duty as assigned.

The incumbent carries out their duties under the overall direction of the Head, Information Environment Assessment Unit, and following day-to-day guidance of the Lead, Data Team . The incumbent maintains a close working relationship with other staff in the Unit, members of PDD, as well as counterparts in other Divisions, other NATO entities and in Allied Delegations and capitals.

Customer Service Orientation: Takes personal responsibility for correcting problems.
Empathy: Is open to others‚Äô perspectives.
Impact and Influence: Takes multiple actions to persuade.
Initiative: Is decisive in a time-sensitive situation.
Teamwork: Solicits inputs and encourages others

column1: In accordance with the contract policy, this is a post in which turnover is desirable for political reasons in order to be able to accommodate the Organisation's need to carry out its tasks as mandated by the Nations in a changing environment, for example by maintaining the flexibility necessary to shape the Organisation's skills profile, and to ensure appropriate international diversity.

The maximum period of service foreseen in this post is 6 years. The successful applicant will be offered a 3-year definite duration contract, which may be renewed for a further period of up to 3 years. However, according to the procedure described in the contract policy the incumbent may apply for conversion to an indefinite contract during the period of renewal and no later than one year before the end of contract.

If the successful applicant is seconded from the national administration of one of NATO‚Äôs member States, a 3-year definite duration contract will be offered, which may be renewed for a further period of up to 3 years subject also to the agreement of the national authority concerned. The maximum period of service in the post as a seconded staff member is six years.
Serving staff will be offered a contract in accordance with the NATO Civilian Personnel R√©gulations.

NATO will not accept any phase of the recruitment and selection prepared, in whole or in part, by means of generative artificial-intelligence (AI) tools, including and without limitation to chatbots, such as Chat Generative Pre-trained Transformer (Chat GPT), or other language generating tools. All applications prepared, in whole or in part, by means of such generative or creative AI applications may be rejected without further consideration at NATO‚Äôs sole discretion, and NATO reserves the right to take further steps in such cases as appropriate.

NATO is committed to diversity and inclusion, and strives to provide equal access to employment, advancement and retention, independent of gender, age, nationality, ethnic origin, religion or belief, cultural background, sexual orientation, and disability. NATO welcomes applications of nationals from all member Nations, and strongly encourages women to apply. NATO is committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible working environment, where all candidates living with disabilities can fully participate in the recruitment and selection process. If you require reasonable accommodation, please inform us during your selection process. Candidates will be required to provide documented medical evidence to support their request for accommodation. Building Integrity is a key element of NATO‚Äôs core tasks. As an employer, NATO values commitment to the principles of integrity, transparency and accountability in accordance with international norms and practices established for the defence and related security sector. Selected candidates are expected to be role models of integrity, and to promote good governance through ongoing efforts in their work. Due to the broad interest in NATO and the large number of potential candidates, telephone or e-mail enquiries cannot be dealt with. Applicants who are not successful in this competition may be offered an appointment to another post of a similar nature, albeit at the same or a lower grade, provided they meet the necessary requirements. The nature of this position may require the staff member at times to be called upon to travel for work and/or to work outside normal office hours. The organization offers several work-life policies including Teleworking and Flexible Working arrangements (Flexitime) subject to business requirements. Please note that the International Staff at NATO Headquarters in Brussels, Belgium is a non-smoking environment. For information about the NATO Single Salary Scale (Grading, Allowances, etc.) please visit our website . Detailed data is available under the Salary and Benefits tab. NATO does not charge any application, processing, training, interviewing, testing or other fee in connection with the application or recruitment process. For more info please click here .

All applications prepared, in whole or in part, by means of such generative or creative AI applications may be rejected without further consideration at NATO‚Äôs sole discretion, and NATO reserves the right to take further steps in such cases as appropriate.

  • ADDITIONAL INFORMATION


NATO is committed to diversity and inclusion, and strives to provide equal access to employment, advancement and retention, independent of gender, age, nationality, ethnic origin, religion or belief, cultural background, sexual orientation, and disability. NATO welcomes applications of nationals from all member Nations, and strongly encourages women to apply. NATO is committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible working environment, where all candidates living with disabilities can fully participate in the recruitment and selection process. If you require reasonable accommodation, please inform us during your selection process. Candidates will be required to provide documented medical evidence to support their request for accommodation. Building Integrity is a key element of NATO‚Äôs core tasks. As an employer, NATO values commitment to the principles of integrity, transparency and accountability in accordance with international norms and practices established for the defence and related security sector. Selected candidates are expected to be role models of integrity, and to promote good governance through ongoing efforts in their work. Due to the broad interest in NATO and the large number of potential candidates, telephone or e-mail enquiries cannot be dealt with. Applicants who are not successful in this competition may be offered an appointment to another post of a similar nature, albeit at the same or a lower grade, provided they meet the necessary requirements. The nature of this position may require the staff member at times to be called upon to travel for work and/or to work outside normal office hours. The organization offers several work-life policies including Teleworking and Flexible Working arrangements (Flexitime) subject to business requirements. Please note that the International Staff at NATO Headquarters in Brussels, Belgium is a non-smoking environment. For information about the NATO Single Salary Scale (Grading, Allowances, etc.) please visit our website . Detailed data is available under the Salary and Benefits tab. NATO does not charge any application, processing, training, interviewing, testing or other fee in connection with the application or recruitment process. For more info please click here .

4167914953,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/client-insights-data-analyst-at-louis-vuitton-4167914953?position=2&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=ArM3IL3eo%2BwrUwDAlJ2Qtw%3D%3D,CLIENT INSIGHTS DATA ANALYST,Louis Vuitton,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","About The Job

Within our Clienteling team, you will play a key role in transforming customer data into in-depth business analyses and strategic recommendations. Your main mission will be to detect opportunities for customer loyalty and engagement thanks to your mastery of data analysis and your sharp understanding of customer behavior.
Your Mission: Transform Data into Levers for Growth and Customer Loyalty
As a Client Insights Data Analyst, your mission will be to inform strategic decisions through your analytical expertise applied to customer data:
Conduct in-depth studies on the profile and behavior of our customers in both retail and e-retail.
Track customer trends and transform demographic, transactional, and engagement data into relevant insights and recommendations for business activations.
Measure commercial performance through precise KPIs and recommend areas for improvement.
Define and monitor precise KPIs to measure the performance of commercial actions and identify areas for improvement
Contribute to the development of targeted Clienteling campaigns, monitor their implementation, and analyze their results
Collaborate closely with business specialists from several departments to meet their needs for customer data analysis and optimize business opportunities
Lead the network of regional correspondents in developing their customer knowledge: train them, provide them with simplified and automated reports, and support them in their ad hoc analyses

Act as a proactive force for the Team Managers in developing the business and be a key contributor for sales, supporting teams on localized clienteling reporting and support with action plan, and regularly present your analyses and recommendations to the management teams

column2: leverage all the clienteling tools to engage and build long term Client relationships

column1: Create and implement specific action plans to pro-actively drive the business
Reporting on client evolution and local clienteling KPIs on weekly/Monthly/quarterly basis for Front and DPCA teams
Audience creation for EMEA wide and local activities for front and DPCA teams
Clienteling Efficiency: collaborate with performance and experts' team to report accurate conversion for all clienteling campaigns
Managing Clienteling time with RTA based on the project and priorities
Develop data visualizations that will allow monitoring performance
Acting as Icons and Power BI project owner
Coaching and training on tools-Icons device distribution and usage
Streamlining internal requests processes and managing incoming Icons requests.
You have at least 3 years of similar experience
Your analytical mind is your strength, combined with a sharp understanding of customer marketing
Proven expertise in the daily use of SQL. Knowledge of Dataiku would be a plus
Ability to present your analyses strategically orally and via PowerPoint
You enjoy working in a team and being in direct contact with business teams. Interpersonal soft skills and ease in working daily with business contacts who are not data specialists

4194918664,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/internship-data-analyst-at-unilever-4194918664?position=3&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=aiGIcH%2FFtpq68ocx9X%2BDQg%3D%3D,Internship Data Analyst,Unilever,"Anderlecht, Brussels Region, Belgium","Internship Data & Analytics
Looking for a challenging internship in the Data & Analytics team, starting in July, August or September 2025? It‚Äôs time to apply!‚ÄØ

At Unilever, we share one simple purpose: To make sustainable living commonplace. Through our powerhouse brands such as Dove, Axe and Lipton, we are creating a bright future for our business and our planet ‚Äì and you can be part of it!

We believe that companies with purpose last, people with purpose thrive and brands with purpose grow. ‚ÄØWe meet every day needs for nutrition, hygiene and personal care with brands that help people feel good, look good and get more out of life.

When joining Unilever in Belgium, you will get the opportunity to have an impact on a leading-edge company and our outstanding brands. During this internship you will get real responsibilities that will provide you with a good insight into the organisation and support your personal development.

Our Data & Analytics team ensures that Unilever makes data-driven decisions to optimize product availability, supply chain efficiency, and consumer insights across global markets. During this internship, you will gain a deep understanding of how advanced analytics supports business operations, identify market trends through data, and learn how to transform raw information into actionable strategies that drive product success in a fast-paced consumer goods environment
Your Key Responsibilities And Accountabilities Could Be (amongst Others)
Collecting and cleaning up data to ensure quality is up to standard
Thinking collectively on how to present the analysis best towards our business colleagues and external stakeholders

You must be enrolled as a Bachelor or Master student from a University, Business School or equivalent during the entire internship. Your studies must have an analytic component. For example: courses on Statistics, Market Assessment, Marketing research or Marketing intelligence.
You are available for a minimum of 3 months and ideally for 6 months (37 hours a week).
You are fluent in English + Dutch or French.
You are a team player with a strong sense of responsibility.
You are a self-starter, able to work autonomously.
You are a pro-active and dynamic person, able to anticipate the needs of your team.
You are curious, eager to learn new things and to explore new ideas and approaches to solving challenges.
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills and feel comfortable with data analysis.
You are able to work with a diversity of people and teams.
You are familiar with MS office tools in particular Excel.
Experience with Power BI / Tableau is a big plus!
You can successfully identify all Unilever iced tea products while blindfolded in a taste test (we won't actually test this, but impressive if true!)
An outstanding chance to bring our unique purpose to life!
An opportunity to take a look behind the scenes at one of the biggest FMCG-corporations in the world.
An opportunity to learn from a variety of concrete projects.
A wealth of experience, where you will be at the heart of the business.
Lots of responsibility, but also good guidance during your internship.
To apply, please send your CV and a motivation letter where your preferred internship topics, internship duration and ideal start date are highlighted.
We look forward to meeting you!‚ÄØ

Unilever is an organisation committed to equity, inclusion and diversity to drive our business results and create a better future, every day, for our diverse employees, global consumers, partners, and communities. We believe a diverse workforce allows us to match our growth ambitions and drive inclusion across the business. At Unilever we are interested in every individual bringing their ‚ÄòWhole Self‚Äô to work and this includes you! Thus if you require any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of your application so that we can support you through your recruitment journey.

4183639369,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-power-bi-at-laco-4183639369?position=4&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=0FSan9%2BUU3F9M0amj%2BcZXg%3D%3D,Data Analyst - Power BI,LACO,"Flemish Region, Belgium","Wij zoeken een Data Analyst / Power BI-expert om ons Microsoft-team te versterken!

LACO is een Belgisch bedrijf dat gespecialiseerd is in business intelligence en data-analyse, met meer dan 35 jaar ervaring. Als Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner hebben we uitgebreide expertise op gebieden zoals Microsoft BI en Data Governance. Met meer dan 120 consultants helpen we bedrijven succesvol te zijn met data. Bij LACO combineren we toewijding met een vleugje plezier in alles wat we doen.

Bij ons staan langetermijnrelaties met klanten en collega‚Äôs centraal. Onlangs hebben we enkele grote projecten binnengehaald bij belangrijke klanten, en daarom willen we ons Microsoft-team versterken om samen met het LACO-team end-to-endprojecten te realiseren.
Als Data Analyst/Power BI-expert bij LACO ben je verantwoordelijk voor:
Het begrijpen en in kaart brengen van de bedrijfsvereisten.
Het verzamelen, opschonen en voorbewerken van gegevens uit diverse bronnen.
Het nauw samenwerken met multifunctionele teams en je expertise in Power BI inzetten om overtuigende visualisaties en rapporten te maken.
Het ontwerpen, optimaliseren en ontwikkelen van Power BI-rapporten en dashboards die voldoen aan de bedrijfsbehoeften en -vereisten.
Het samenwerken met stakeholders om gegevensvereisten te verzamelen en te begrijpen, en zorgen voor nauwkeurige en consistente data.
Het oplossen van problemen met Power BI-rapporten en het omzetten van complexe datasets in bruikbare inzichten door middel van datavisualisaties.
Het up-to-date blijven met de nieuwste Power BI- en Microsoft Fabric-functionaliteiten en best practices om uit te blinken in deze rol.
Je hebt een bachelor- en/of masterdiploma in computerwetenschappen of een gelijkwaardige opleiding.
Je hebt minstens 3 jaar aantoonbare ervaring als Power BI Developer of in een vergelijkbare rol.
Je bent bekend met programmeertalen zoals SQL, DAX en Python.
Je kunt data modelleren met technieken zoals Kimball, Dimensional Modelling en Data Vault.
Je bent bedreven in Power BI, inclusief DAX, datamodellering en custom visuals.
Goede kennis hebt van Azure Synapse, Data Factory en Databricks.
Vertrouwd bent met diverse soorten gegevensopslag voor gestructureerde data.
Een sterke communicator bent en goed in teamverband kunt werken.
Vloeiend bent in Nederlands en Engels.
We werken graag samen met zowel werknemers als freelancers.
Je ontvangt een aantrekkelijk salarispakket en uitstekende extralegale voordelen.
Je krijgt toegang tot opleidingsmogelijkheden om je kennis te vergroten en je carri√®re verder te ontwikkelen.
Je werkt mee aan innovatieve Microsoft-trajecten die je uitdagen en inspireren.
Geniet van een geweldige bedrijfscultuur met ruimte voor leuke evenementen zoals familiedagen, jaarlijkse skireizen, sportevenementen, spelavonden, ‚Ä¶
Laat deze kans niet aan je datavingers voorbijgaan!
Neem contact op met ons Talent Acquisition-team en begin jouw avontuur naar succes.
