4152717081,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-cream-consulting-4152717081?position=5&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=iCS3VYp4BH%2FY3qU2%2BYxboQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Cream Consulting,Brussels Metropolitan Area,"Permanent position only

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency‚Ä¶but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.
And Bonus ingredient: ‚Ä¶ Some passionate colleagues :-)
WHAT IS A DATA ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Benjamin, Data Analyst, you participate in the construction of the data strategy of our clients. You have a key role by helping them to deliver valuable insight based on their data. You are part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team.
You dive into a large amount of data :
Identifying patterns and trends in data sets
Producing strategic data analysis and reporting to the business
You contribute to the selection and implementation of the different data analysis tools
In the end, you help the business to optimize the use of their data
HOW WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT:
You have at least 1-year experience in data analysis
You are passionate about data and you bring out concrete analysis to help the business
You are used to work with different data tools such as SQL, SAS, Python, R, Tableau, QlikView, PowerBI, ‚Ä¶
You have an analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving
You are fluent in French and English
column2: good knowledge of Dutch is an asset

column1: WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOR?
A broad diversity of career options, you‚Äôre not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with and experiment every day
We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!
THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,
CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY""

Permanent position only


WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency‚Ä¶but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business &
column2: Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical &amp
column3:
Transport.


CREAM‚ÄôS SPECIAL RECIPE:

  • 1/3 of Personal development
  • 1/3 of Collective Intelligence
  • 1/3 of Intrapreneurship

And Bonus ingredient: ‚Ä¶ Some passionate colleagues :-)


WHAT IS A DATA ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Benjamin, Data Analyst, you participate in the construction of the data strategy of our clients. You have a key role by helping them to deliver valuable insight based on their data. You are part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team.


YOUR TASKS :

  • You understand the business request
  • You dive into a large amount of data :
  1. Collecting and interpreting data
  2. Analyzing results
  3. Identifying patterns and trends in data sets
  4. Producing strategic data analysis and reporting to the business
  • You contribute to the selection and implementation of the different data analysis tools
  • In the end, you help the business to optimize the use of their data


HOW WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT:

  • You have at least 1-year experience in data analysis
  • You are passionate about data and you bring out concrete analysis to help the business
  • You are used to work with different data tools such as SQL, SAS, Python, R, Tableau, QlikView, PowerBI, ‚Ä¶
  • You have an analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving
  • You pay attention to details
  • You are fluent in French and English
column4:
good knowledge of Dutch is an asset


WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOR?

  • A broad diversity of career options, you‚Äôre not stuck in a box
  • You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
  • You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
  • You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
  • We have values we share, live with and experiment every day


We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!


""THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY""

Politico is looking for an Associate Data Analyst to join the Data Analytics team based in our Brussels office. The team is responsible for understanding and delivering reporting, analyses and other data capabilities that will enable Politico to achieve its strategic goals. This role will support all of Politico‚Äôs business operations, including newsletters, websites, paid-for services and more.
Support Politico‚Äôs commercial operations across European and US markets
Gather requirements from business, technical and editorial stakeholders
Discover, clean and organize data into usable datasets
Produce analyses, build reporting and present to stakeholders
Generate visualizations and dashboards that aid business decision-making
Develop materials to explain project findings
Work with the wider team in Brussels and Washington DC to develop skills and knowledge
The following requirements describe an ideal candidate, so we encourage you to apply even if you don‚Äôt meet every single item:
Passionate about Politico‚Äôs mission to deliver nonpartisan journalism on politics and policy
Experience with BI tools a plus
Familiarity with modern data warehouses (Snowflake) and cloud platforms (AWS)
Ability to translate business requests into workable analytical tasks
Ability to creatively draw upon available resources to respond to business questions and anticipate potential challenges and how to overcome them
Ability to work with data to produce useful and insightful analysis
Ability to communicate complex analysis to a non-technical audience
Ability to work collaboratively and learn from the wider team

POLITICO is a global news and information company at the intersection of politics and policy. It is the essential online, mobile and print destination for the most influential people in the world. With publications based in Washington, D.C., New York, London, and Brussels, POLITICO boasts an enormous roster of the most talented reporters and editors in the world.

It is POLITICO's policy to provide equal employment opportunity to all qualified individuals without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, age or any other characteristic protected by local laws and regulations.
If you are interested in this opportunity, please send a cover letter and CV in English using the Apply button. Please note that we will only consider complete applications.

As a total solution provider of medical devices and pharmaceutical packaging, Nipro Europe Group Companies is continuously committed to improving patient outcomes and quality of life. We are part of a large global network headed by Nipro Corporation Japan, an industry-leading healthcare company with over 38,000 employees worldwide. Our European headquarters in Mechelen, Belgium covers a wide geographical reach (Europe, Africa, India, the Americas) and is home to Nipro Medical EMEA, Nipro PharmaPackaging International, and the Institute for Medical Practice (iMEP) Belgium.

To accommodate our growth, Nipro EMEA is looking for a BI Analyst/Engineer who is dynamic, hands-on, and collaborative to join us in our Data Analytics team, based in our European headquarters office in Mechelen, Belgium.

You will be working in a team that designs, develops, and maintains data warehouses and data lakes. You will integrate various data sources, develop interactive dashboards, and analyse large datasets to provide valuable business insights.
Design, develop, and maintain data warehouses and data lakes.
Integrate various data sources ensuring accuracy and integrity.
Develop interactive dashboards and reports to visualize insights.
Analyse large datasets to identify trends and opportunities.
Collaborate with departments to understand data needs.
Document data processes and support data-related queries.
Bachelor's or master's degree in Computer Science or related field.
5+ years of experience as a BI analyst/engineer.
Experience with Azure, Snowflake, and PowerBI.
Join a global leader in healthcare with a commitment to improving patient outcomes.
Be part of a dynamic and growing team in a supportive work environment.
Opportunity to make a significant impact on data strategies and operations.
Career growth and development opportunities within a global network.

About the company:

As a total solution provider of medical devices and pharmaceutical packaging, Nipro Europe Group Companies is continuously committed to improving patient outcomes and quality of life. We are part of a large global network headed by Nipro Corporation Japan, an industry-leading healthcare company with over 38,000 employees worldwide. Our European headquarters in Mechelen, Belgium covers a wide geographical reach (Europe, Africa, India, the Americas) and is home to Nipro Medical EMEA, Nipro PharmaPackaging International, and the Institute for Medical Practice (iMEP) Belgium.


To accommodate our growth, Nipro EMEA is looking for a BI Analyst/Engineer who is dynamic, hands-on, and collaborative to join us in our Data Analytics team, based in our European headquarters office in Mechelen, Belgium.


About the role

You will be working in a team that designs, develops, and maintains data warehouses and data lakes. You will integrate various data sources, develop interactive dashboards, and analyse large datasets to provide valuable business insights.


What you‚Äôll do

  • Design, develop, and maintain data warehouses and data lakes.
  • Integrate various data sources ensuring accuracy and integrity.
  • Develop interactive dashboards and reports to visualize insights.
  • Analyse large datasets to identify trends and opportunities.
  • Collaborate with departments to understand data needs.
  • Document data processes and support data-related queries.


What you‚Äôll need

  • Bachelor's or master's degree in Computer Science or related field.
  • 5+ years of experience as a BI analyst/engineer.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Knowledge of SQL and/or Python.
  • Experience with Azure, Snowflake, and PowerBI.
  • Hands-on mentality and proactive mindset.


Why you should apply

  • Join a global leader in healthcare with a commitment to improving patient outcomes.
  • Be part of a dynamic and growing team in a supportive work environment.
  • Opportunity to make a significant impact on data strategies and operations.
  • Competitive salary and benefits package.
  • Career growth and development opportunities within a global network.

4180259991,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/marketing-data-analyst-at-innova-solutions-4180259991?position=11&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=lozEAZ2Nl%2F%2BAP73HMm7QWQ%3D%3D,Marketing Data Analyst,Innova Solutions,"Brussels Region, Belgium","üíºJob Title: Data Scientist
üåêLanguage: English: Fluent spoken and written Dutch: Fluent/Good level OR French: Fluent/Good level
üî•Keywords: Predictive Analytics, AI Models, Data Science, Python, Marketing Campaigns

Our client is a is a prominent telecommunications company known for its extensive network infrastructure and comprehensive range of services. It provides innovative solutions in internet, mobile, and television communications, catering to both residential and business customers.

The Predictive Analytics team within the Marketing and Communication department aims to provide predictive AI models to enable impactful and efficient campaigns by optimizing reach and relevance for customers and augmenting employees in the campaigning process.

We are looking for a medior/senior data scientist with a proven track record in building and deploying data science models to support marketing campaigns. You will be part of a data science team and will work on the following:
Tackle various business challenges by creating AI models to enhance client experiences, empower employees, and optimize internal processes.
Utilize a range of analytical methodologies within predictive AI, including large language models, classical statistical/machine learning techniques, and uplift modeling.
Capture business needs, perform data analyses, build models, and identify relevant target groups to achieve business objectives. Set up tests to measure model impact.
Inform, advise, and support Marketing & Communications Managers on the use of predictive models.
Present complex technical concepts as clear, actionable insights for Marketing & Communication Managers.
Follow up on production runs from data preparation, scoring, and validation of AI models. Maintain and monitor model performance to detect quality issues.
Support the creation of new variables (data engineering) and continuous improvement cycles of models.
Demonstrate extensive experience in programming with Python and contribute to deploying AI models in production using a comprehensive stack of tools.
Apply guidelines and best practices for responsible AI.
Collaborate with a team of motivated data scientists eager to learn, share expertise, and work together.

At least a Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative discipline such as statistics, mathematics, or computer science. Candidates with other academic backgrounds with substantial experience in data science are also encouraged to apply.
At least 3 years of relevant experience.
Mandatory: Strong expertise in Python and Python data science environment (e.g., deep learning), Git, bash, SQL.
Preferable: Experience with Domino Data Science Platform, SAS, recommender systems, language models, optimization under constraints, Django.
Preferable: Experience in campaigning, direct marketing, A/B testing.

Innova Solutions is a diverse and award-winning global technology services partner. We provide our clients with strategic technology, talent, and business transformation solutions, enabling them to be leaders in their field.
Founded in 1998, headquartered in Atlanta (Duluth), Georgia.
Employs over 50,000 professionals worldwide, with annual revenue approaching $3.0B.
Delivers strategic technology and business transformation solutions globally.
Operates through global delivery centers across North America, Asia, and Europe.
Provides services for data center migration and workload development for cloud service providers.
Women‚Äôs Choice Awards - Best Companies to Work for Women & Millennials, 2024
Forbes, America‚Äôs Best Temporary Staffing and Best Professional Recruiting Firms, 2023
American Best in Business, Globee Awards, Healthcare Vulnerability Technology Solutions, 2023
Global Health & Pharma, Best Full Service Workforce Lifecycle Management Enterprise, 2023
Received 3 SBU Leadership in Business Awards
Stevie International Business Awards, Denials Remediation Healthcare Technology Solutions, 2023

The responsibility of the Insights Analyst is to analyze in store customer behavior to address customer questions and provide KPIs to customers. They will also address custom questions from customers using video analysis and python to model customer behavior and provide aggregated insights into customer behavior and performance of various areas in store. They will work closely with the AA Lead to ensure solutions and projects are ready to be delivered to customers.
Have a strong ability to visualize how our data represents shoppers moving through spaces, and to use the best methodology to draw out the right answer, or develop new methodologies as needed

Location: Brussels (3 days per week onsite)

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join our team. This role requires a strong technical background, the ability to work with complex data, and experience engaging with multiple stakeholders.
Work within a feature team, analyzing large and complex datasets.
Write and optimize Python and SQL queries to extract, transform, and analyze data.
Utilize ETL processes and work within Azure Databricks.
Collaborate closely with Data Engineers and other technical teams.
Interpret and translate business needs into actionable insights.
Engage with multiple stakeholders across different departments.
Ensure data accuracy and contribute to decision-making processes.
4+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, working with complex datasets.
Strong proficiency in Python, SQL, ETL, and Azure Databricks.
Ability to understand and dive into the technical aspect of data pipelines and code.
Experience working in large teams rather than small teams with a single analyst.
Strong stakeholder management skills, with the ability to explain technical insights in a business-friendly manner.
Retail industry experience or a strong affinity for customer-related data.
Fluency in English and French (spoken and written).
Experience working with cloud platforms and modern data infrastructures.
Familiarity with customer analytics and behavioral data.
First stage: Interview with HR and CTO.
Second stage: Technical interview with team members.

Job Title: Permanent Data Analyst


Location: Brussels (3 days per week onsite)

Languages: English &
column2:
French

Seniority Level: 4+ years of experience

Reports to: Head of Analytics


About the Role

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join our team. This role requires a strong technical background, the ability to work with complex data, and experience engaging with multiple stakeholders.


Key Responsibilities

  • Work within a feature team, analyzing large and complex datasets.
  • Write and optimize Python and SQL queries to extract, transform, and analyze data.
  • Utilize ETL processes and work within Azure Databricks.
  • Collaborate closely with Data Engineers and other technical teams.
  • Interpret and translate business needs into actionable insights.
  • Engage with multiple stakeholders across different departments.
  • Ensure data accuracy and contribute to decision-making processes.


Requirements

  • 4+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, working with complex datasets.
  • Strong proficiency in Python, SQL, ETL, and Azure Databricks.
  • Ability to understand and dive into the technical aspect of data pipelines and code.
  • Experience working in large teams rather than small teams with a single analyst.
  • Strong stakeholder management skills, with the ability to explain technical insights in a business-friendly manner.
  • Retail industry experience or a strong affinity for customer-related data.
  • Fluency in English and French (spoken and written).


Nice-to-Have

  • Experience working with cloud platforms and modern data infrastructures.
  • Familiarity with customer analytics and behavioral data.


Interview Process

  1. First stage: Interview with HR and CTO.
  2. Second stage: Technical interview with team members.

English Fluent & French or Dutch native

4181347734,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/analytics-analyst-at-etex-4181347734?position=15&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=oDgBBSHEU7xr%2FiLpyBaQaA%3D%3D,Analytics Analyst,Etex,"Kapelle-op-den-Bos, Flemish Region, Belgium","At Etex, our purpose is to inspire new ways of living. We are an international leader in sustainable construction, driven by a passion for excellence, but it's our people that are our top priority. We connect, collaborate, and champion the well-being of our employees, forming partnerships and pioneering change in our ever-evolving industry.
At Etex, we seek to make a meaningful impact in the lives of our customers and our communities.

Are you looking for a company where you can learn, grow & lead? Join us as¬†Analytics Analyst¬†and drive digital excellence!You will join the Analytics Operations domain, covering functional domains like Supply Chain, Manufacturing and ESG.
Understand the purpose & goal of the data product and the value it brings to business.
Build a prototype with the support of a BI Developer and/or Data Engineer to get the requirements right.
Design the reporting data model (I.e. star schema) that is fit for the requirements.
Detail & document the requirements coming from the demand intake (discovery phase) to a level of granularity so the BI Developer and/or Data Engineer can start executing their designs and builds.
Interact closely with the BPO areas to clarify requirements and understand value creation.
Work closely together with the IT application owners to align on the source data model and the way data will be provided (data exchange agreement).
Translate and documents requirements into a high-level solution design mapped on the current Data Platform architecture.
Bridge the gap between BPO areas and the technical delivery team (BI Developers / Data Engineers).
Knowledge of data analysis, incl. collecting and elaborating business requirements.
Basic knowledge of the agile way of working.
Experience with creating reports and dashboards.
Knowledge of BI-tools and databases (like Power BI, Databricks, DAX, etc.).

We are named the world's #1 most trustworthy company in the construction sector by Newsweek and Statista in 2023! And one of the top companies to grow your career in Belgium in 2023 according to LinkedIn!

Our culture ‚Äì we connect & care about those around us. We nurture teamwork, communities, partnerships and new ways of working, placing the highest importance on the safety and working environment of our people.

Our ‚ÄòRoad to Sustainability 2030‚Äô is our plan to help build a better, sustainable future. We work towards this vision by caring about our social and environmental impacts and developing innovative solutions

We have a strong conviction that diversity of thinking helps us to deliver a strong and sustainable performance. It is also essential for us that everyone feels part of the team. In this spirit, we are committed to equal opportunities and zero tolerance towards discrimination
Flexibility: For us, hybrid and flexible working is all about trust, and we want you to be able to do your best work.

At Etex, we seek to make a meaningful impact in the lives of our customers and our communities.

4183871626,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-data-consultant-at-capco-4183871626?position=17&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=lQno6ZZ%2BEB4uc5UaHjUMFg%3D%3D,Data Analyst / Data Consultant,Capco,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Data Analyst / Data consultant
Are you interested in expanding your consulting exposure? Do you want to move away from an operations role and make an impact on the business?
Do you often feel like processes and ways of working could be better or more efficient?
Capco is a global management consultancy specialising in driving transformation across investment banking, securities services, and insurance.
We have the people, the vision, and the passion.

We are going through a significant growth journey, and now is a very good time to join us as we expand geographically, increase headcount and disrupt the consulting market across Central Europa with entrepreneurial and agile thinking.
In your role as a Consultant at Capco, you play a key role in the delivery of projects and gain wider exposure to our wider Investment Banking business.
You will work closely with senior clients to deliver large-scale change initiatives for leading global banks.
Fitting that description, you will also need to be a supremely motivated person and able to work in a team where clients become colleagues too.
We Are Looking For Talent With The Following
Leverage your existing analytical skills and expertise to help clients meet their challenges
Take part in strategic data transformation projects and value creation through use of data
Enable data-driven decisions through advanced analytics, visualisation, quality data and dedicated datasets
Engage data using analytical tools and languages to perform data manipulation and analysis
Be involved with managing, cleansing, abstracting and aggregating data
Support the importance of data processes, data integrity and cleanliness, and the strategic use of data
Work with or act as project manager to scope and analyse the area of analysis
Professional experience of minimum 2 years in a data related position, with a preference for roles within the financial industry or a consultancy firm
Bachelor or Master degree in a relevant field
Excellent analytical, reporting and presentation skills
Good knowledge of SQL, Python and preferably one visualisation tool (Tableau, PowerBI...)
Being able to work and liaise with various stakeholders, ranging from business to technical stakeholders
You are a creative problem solver with a hands-on approach
Fluency in French or Dutch AND excellent knowledge of English
The opportunity to join a growing, thought leading, global team of data professionals

An attractive remuneration package, reflecting your experience, including a company car or a mobility budget, net allowances, end-of-year bonuses, health insurance, a mobile phone and subscription, laptop and meal vouchers

Organised individual learning tracks with access to leading online skills development platforms, to onsite and online teachers and to our global experts. Our learning materials cover all areas of data (Governance, Management, Manipulation, Decision science, Engineering)
A shared objective to achieve a good work-life balance
A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work with senior partners and directly with clients

Data Analyst / Data consultant

Are you interested in expanding your consulting exposure? Do you want to move away from an operations role and make an impact on the business?

Do you often feel like processes and ways of working could be better or more efficient?

Capco is a global management consultancy specialising in driving transformation across investment banking, securities services, and insurance.

We have the people, the vision, and the passion.

We are going through a significant growth journey, and now is a very good time to join us as we expand geographically, increase headcount and disrupt the consulting market across Central Europa with entrepreneurial and agile thinking.

In your role as a Consultant at Capco, you play a key role in the delivery of projects and gain wider exposure to our wider Investment Banking business.

You will work closely with senior clients to deliver large-scale change initiatives for leading global banks.

Fitting that description, you will also need to be a supremely motivated person and able to work in a team where clients become colleagues too.

We Are Looking For Talent With The Following

  • Leverage your existing analytical skills and expertise to help clients meet their challenges
  • Take part in strategic data transformation projects and value creation through use of data
  • Enable data-driven decisions through advanced analytics, visualisation, quality data and dedicated datasets
  • Engage data using analytical tools and languages to perform data manipulation and analysis
  • Be involved with managing, cleansing, abstracting and aggregating data
  • Support the importance of data processes, data integrity and cleanliness, and the strategic use of data
  • Work with or act as project manager to scope and analyse the area of analysis

Skills &
column2:
Expertise

  • Professional experience of minimum 2 years in a data related position, with a preference for roles within the financial industry or a consultancy firm
  • Bachelor or Master degree in a relevant field
  • Excellent analytical, reporting and presentation skills
  • Good knowledge of SQL, Python and preferably one visualisation tool (Tableau, PowerBI...)
  • Being able to work and liaise with various stakeholders, ranging from business to technical stakeholders
  • You are a creative problem solver with a hands-on approach
  • Fluency in French or Dutch AND excellent knowledge of English

What We Offer You

  • The opportunity to join a growing, thought leading, global team of data professionals
  • An attractive remuneration package, reflecting your experience, including a company car or a mobility budget, net allowances, end-of-year bonuses, health insurance, a mobile phone and subscription, laptop and meal vouchers
  • Organised individual learning tracks with access to leading online skills development platforms, to onsite and online teachers and to our global experts. Our learning materials cover all areas of data (Governance, Management, Manipulation, Decision science, Engineering)

  • A shared objective to achieve a good work-life balance
  • A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work with senior partners and directly with clients
  • A diverse, inclusive, meritocratic culture

4142330133,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/digital-intelligence-data-analyst-at-ogilvy-social-lab-belgium-4142330133?position=18&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=6SdNzZwVnWf9yxNWFkFPBA%3D%3D,Digital Intelligence & Data Analyst,Ogilvy Social.Lab Belgium,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","About Ogilvy

Ogilvy has been creating impact for brands through iconic, culture-changing, value-driving ideas since the company was founded by David Ogilvy 75 years ago. It builds on that rich legacy through Borderless Creativity ‚Äì innovating at the intersections of its advertising, public relations, relationship design, consulting, and health capabilities with experts collaborating seamlessly across over 120 offices in nearly 90 countries. Ogilvy currently ranks as the #1 global agency network for creative excellence and effectiveness by WARC, signifying its ability to‚ÄØdeliver creative solutions that drive unreasonable impact for clients and communities.‚ÄØOgilvy is a WPP company (NYSE: WPP). For more information, visit‚ÄØOgilvy.com, and follow us on LinkedIn,‚ÄØX,‚ÄØInstagram, and Facebook.

Ogilvy Social.Lab (OSL) is a full-service advertising agency headquartered in Brussels‚Äô WPP Campus. As part of the international Ogilvy network, our operations span four continents with over 15 nationalities on the 130-strong team working in our offices ‚Äì our mindset is borderless.

We proudly collaborate with prominent international and regional clients, including Absolut, Unilever, Mondelez, Ford, IKEA, Lidl, Orange, EU and Belgian institutions, fueling their success locally & internationally.

Entrepreneurship pulses through our veins, embodying our name with a ""lab‚Äù mentality. We constantly innovate and experiment, staying in sync with the ever-evolving digital media landscape we specialize in.

Analyse social and digital data through a set of tools (Social Listening tools like Synthesio, Competitive Analysis tools like RivalIQ, Audience Analysis tools like Profiler or Global Web Index, Trends and Search Analysis tools like Semrush or Social Lab Proprietary Tools, etc.) based on a client briefing. Develop custom approaches leveraging available data sets and technologies to deliver on actionable insights to inform strategic recommendations.
Support planners in developing data-validated strategies bringing data richness to what consumers, communities or creators are ‚Äòsaying‚Äô, ‚Äòsharing‚Äô and ‚Äòsearching‚Äô online.
Design insightful reports and audits with strategic recommendations.
Deliver high-quality service to local and international clients.
Participate in the creation of new, commercially viable data products.
Work with our clients and present the intelligence work.
Collaborate with WPP and external data providers.
A first experience in Social/Digital/Search Data Analytics, Insights and Digital/Social Strategy
Always-on social listening analysis and insights generation.
Cultural tracking (including trends) and insights generation for always-on and campaign use.
A strong understanding of today‚Äôs social media landscape and internet culture (Social 3.0, culture-first, community and creators led, audience-first) and new channels‚Äô codes.
A strong understanding of Social media performance metrics/KPIs for both organic and paid media.
You understand how to apply qualitative and quantitative learnings and turn them into actionable insights
Eye for innovation and the next emerging platform or partner.
Comfortable using social and digital monitoring technologies such as Synthesio, Brandwatch, Meltwater, Semrush, etc.
Expert in the understanding of social media and established understanding of the wider digital communication landscape.
Ability to work effectively, proactively and seamlessly amongst an integrated agency team.
Fulltime opportunity in an ever-growing, trendsetting advertising agency based in the greenest building in Brussels ‚Äì the new WPP Campus.
Work alongside a team of diverse and people-focused individuals, on impactful projects and with an array of local, regional and global clients.
We are committed to keeping our environmental footprint low and ensuring that our work is ethical.
We thrive on transparency ‚Äì Our words and promises produce actions.
As an Ogilvy Social.Lab employee, you will be provided with continuous opportunities to grow through training and career conversations while doing strong work that works.

At Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression.
We believe in building powerful teams with purpose - and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality.

Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve. This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.

Ogilvy is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without discrimination or regard to particular characteristics. We are committed to fostering a culture of respect in which everyone feels they belong and has the same opportunities to progress in their careers.

If you need any assistance seeking a job opportunity, or if you need reasonable accommodation with the application process, please contact us at accommodations@ogilvy.com. Please note that this contact is only for candidates who are requesting accommodation. Emails for other purposes, including application status requests, will not receive a response.

About Ogilvy

Ogilvy has been creating impact for brands through iconic, culture-changing, value-driving ideas since the company was founded by David Ogilvy 75 years ago. It builds on that rich legacy through Borderless Creativity ‚Äì innovating at the intersections of its advertising, public relations, relationship design, consulting, and health capabilities with experts collaborating seamlessly across over 120 offices in nearly 90 countries. Ogilvy currently ranks as the #1 global agency network for creative excellence and effectiveness by WARC, signifying its ability to‚ÄØdeliver creative solutions that drive unreasonable impact for clients and communities.‚ÄØOgilvy is a WPP company (NYSE: WPP). For more information, visit‚ÄØOgilvy.com, and follow us on LinkedIn,‚ÄØX,‚ÄØInstagram, and Facebook.

About Ogilvy Social.lab

Ogilvy Social.Lab (OSL) is a full-service advertising agency headquartered in Brussels‚Äô WPP Campus. As part of the international Ogilvy network, our operations span four continents with over 15 nationalities on the 130-strong team working in our offices ‚Äì our mindset is borderless.

We proudly collaborate with prominent international and regional clients, including Absolut, Unilever, Mondelez, Ford, IKEA, Lidl, Orange, EU and Belgian institutions, fueling their success locally &
column2:
internationally.

Entrepreneurship pulses through our veins, embodying our name with a ""lab‚Äù mentality. We constantly innovate and experiment, staying in sync with the ever-evolving digital media landscape we specialize in.

Responsibilities

  • Analyse social and digital data through a set of tools (Social Listening tools like Synthesio, Competitive Analysis tools like RivalIQ, Audience Analysis tools like Profiler or Global Web Index, Trends and Search Analysis tools like Semrush or Social Lab Proprietary Tools, etc.) based on a client briefing. Develop custom approaches leveraging available data sets and technologies to deliver on actionable insights to inform strategic recommendations.
  • Support planners in developing data-validated strategies bringing data richness to what consumers, communities or creators are ‚Äòsaying‚Äô, ‚Äòsharing‚Äô and ‚Äòsearching‚Äô online.
  • Design insightful reports and audits with strategic recommendations.
  • Deliver high-quality service to local and international clients.
  • Participate in the creation of new, commercially viable data products.
  • Work with our clients and present the intelligence work.
  • Collaborate with WPP and external data providers.

PROFILE

  • A first experience in Social/Digital/Search Data Analytics, Insights and Digital/Social Strategy
  • Always-on social listening analysis and insights generation.
  • Cultural tracking (including trends) and insights generation for always-on and campaign use.
  • A strong understanding of today‚Äôs social media landscape and internet culture (Social 3.0, culture-first, community and creators led, audience-first) and new channels‚Äô codes.
  • A strong understanding of Social media performance metrics/KPIs for both organic and paid media.
  • You understand how to apply qualitative and quantitative learnings and turn them into actionable insights
  • Eye for innovation and the next emerging platform or partner.
  • Comfortable using social and digital monitoring technologies such as Synthesio, Brandwatch, Meltwater, Semrush, etc.
  • Expert in the understanding of social media and established understanding of the wider digital communication landscape.
  • Ability to work effectively, proactively and seamlessly amongst an integrated agency team.
  • Reporting and visualization skills

OFFER

  • We are committed to keeping our environmental footprint low and ensuring that our work is ethical.
  • We thrive on transparency ‚Äì Our words and promises produce actions.
  • Attractive package and benefits
  • Strong flexibility plan
  • Continuous training opportunities
  • As an Ogilvy Social.Lab employee, you will be provided with continuous opportunities to grow through training and career conversations while doing strong work that works.

If you are passionate about Data and want to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity at SII Belgium.

At KPMG, we believe in harnessing the power of data to drive better business decisions. Our team of consultants works alongside clients to help them transform raw data into actionable insights that fuel strategic growth. As a global leader in audit, tax, and advisory services, we combine deep industry expertise with cutting-edge technologies to deliver innovative solutions.

As a Business Intelligence (BI) Consultant, you will play a key role in helping our clients unlock the potential of their data. You will work on a variety of projects across different industries, focusing on improving decision-making processes, enhancing reporting capabilities, and developing data-driven strategies. You will collaborate closely with both internal teams and clients to ensure that data is collected, structured, and visualized in a way that drives value.
Partner with clients to understand their data challenges and business objectives
Design and implement BI solutions, including dashboards and reports
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and optimize data models
Conduct data analysis to identify trends, anomalies, and insights
Provide recommendations to improve data management and reporting processes
Stay updated with the latest BI tools and technologies
Contribute to project management by ensuring timely and quality delivery
Strong experience in data analysis, reporting, and BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Qlik) Proficiency in SQL and data modeling techniques
Ability to translate complex data into clear and actionable insights
Good communication skills to interact effectively with clients and teams
A passion for problem-solving and a detail-oriented approach
Team player with a collaborative mindset
Willingness to learn and adapt to new challenges
A good communication knowledge of Dutch & English
A corporate culture in which personal growth, mutual trust and lifelong learning are being fostered.
An inclusive workspace that encourages diversity and pursues mutual respect for each other‚Äôs beliefs and background.
Professional experiences in an international and dynamic working environment with inspiring colleagues.
Flexible, hybrid work arrangements to enable working on different locations: home office, on-site or on the go.
A wide range of teambuilding activities and social events that enable new joiners to meet colleagues within the wider KPMG community and have some fun along the way.

At Semetis, we turn data into business growth. We are looking for a Business Intelligence & Analytics Lead to bridge the gap between raw data, marketing intelligence, and strategic decision-making. You will be at the heart of our strategic department, ensuring insights drive real marketing and business impact.
Translate complex data into actionable insights for marketing and business decisions.
Scope and optimize analytics, measurement, and dashboarding projects for top clients.
Work closely with consultants and leadership to define and refine key business KPIs.
Ensure data quality, build meaningful reports, and provide strategic recommendations.
Coach and train teams, fostering a strong data-driven culture at Semetis.
4-7 years experience in analytics, data insights, measurement, or BI.
Expertise in web analytics (GA4, Adobe Analytics, Piwik Pro) and dashboarding (Looker, Power BI, Tableau).
Understanding of business KPIs, ensuring analytics drive marketing and revenue growth.
Strong autonomy and ownership, able to take initiative and drive projects forward.
Some SQL knowledge (or willingness to learn) and familiarity with cloud solutions (Google Cloud, AWS, Azure).
Critical thinker, able to assess what analytics services should and shouldn‚Äôt be offered.

At Semetis, we do more than analyse data‚Äîwe turn it into a competitive advantage. As Belgium‚Äôs leading digital agency, we are known for our expertise, innovation, and strong market presence. We are on a mission to push the boundaries of marketing intelligence, shaping the way brands make data-driven decisions.

This is a role with real business impact. You will work closely with leadership, ensuring that analytics isn‚Äôt just a reporting tool but a driver of strategic growth. We operate in a fast-moving, entrepreneurial environment where bold ideas, innovation, and experimentation are encouraged. Unlike traditional agencies, Semetis fosters a culture of autonomy, giving you the space to take ownership and make a tangible difference.
If you are passionate about turning analytics into actionable business impact, we would love to hear from you.

4190173326,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/game-data-analyst-at-gameplay-galaxy-4190173326?position=25&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=xmZmM1hKB4gSH3pK%2FHPBeQ%3D%3D,Game Data Analyst,Gameplay Galaxy,European Economic Area,"Department: Data

We are looking for a talented Game Data Analyst to join our dynamic analytics team. You'll work closely with game teams, using data to drive player retention, improve monetization strategies, and optimize user experience. If you‚Äôre excited by data and games, this is the role for you.
All The Responsibilities We'll Trust You With
You‚Äôll collaborate with game development teams to analyze player behavior, identify trends, and provide actionable insights to drive game performance and player engagement.
You‚Äôll create dashboards and visualizations that support key business decisions by presenting clear and data-driven recommendations to senior stakeholders.
You‚Äôll design, implement, and analyze A/B tests to measure the effectiveness of new game features and mechanics.
You‚Äôll work on projects related to the blockchain, analyzing how players engage with decentralized features and in-game economies.
You‚Äôll contribute to advanced analytics projects, including game economy analysis, to enhance monetization strategies and game progression.
You‚Äôll build out new ways to map in-game events, such as stunts, crashes, and progression to optimize player experience.
You‚Äôll continuously drive data literacy within the company, helping stakeholders leverage data effectively for decision-making.
What You'll Bring To The Team
At least 2-3 years of experience in data analytics, preferably within a gaming environment.
Proficient in SQL and Python (or R) for data exploration and analysis.
Strong experience with A/B testing and applied statistics (bonus if familiar with Bayesian statistics).
Experience building dashboards using tools like Metabase, Looker, or Tableau.
Strong analytical skills and a proactive mindset.
A fast learner, able to balance immediate needs with long-term projects.
A collaborative team player, comfortable working with cross-functional teams.
Why You'll Love Working With Us
We‚Äôre 100% remote, work wherever you want forever!

We offer unlimited holidays and sick days. Take as much time off as you need, to spend time with your family and friends or just because you feel like playing games all day. We trust our team and want to offer a modern work life balance that allows you to thrive both at work and in your personal life.
You‚Äôll be able to make an impact, to work closely with the rest of the team and its leads to work on one of the most promising upcoming games in the mobile gaming industry and the Web3 space.
You‚Äôll have a comfortable work schedule and stable workload. With a variety of tasks that will allow your constant professional development.
We want our team to grow personally and professionally and support learning opportunities, especially with a focus around new AI tools and methods.
We have a culture that puts our people first. We believe in open communication, creativity and the value of unique contributions from everyone in the team.
We offer a competitive salary in addition to equity option plans.

Department: Data

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote

Description

We are looking for a talented Game Data Analyst to join our dynamic analytics team. You'll work closely with game teams, using data to drive player retention, improve monetization strategies, and optimize user experience. If you‚Äôre excited by data and games, this is the role for you.

All The Responsibilities We'll Trust You With

  • You‚Äôll collaborate with game development teams to analyze player behavior, identify trends, and provide actionable insights to drive game performance and player engagement.
  • You‚Äôll create dashboards and visualizations that support key business decisions by presenting clear and data-driven recommendations to senior stakeholders.
  • You‚Äôll design, implement, and analyze A/B tests to measure the effectiveness of new game features and mechanics.
  • You‚Äôll work on projects related to the blockchain, analyzing how players engage with decentralized features and in-game economies.
  • You‚Äôll contribute to advanced analytics projects, including game economy analysis, to enhance monetization strategies and game progression.
  • You‚Äôll build out new ways to map in-game events, such as stunts, crashes, and progression to optimize player experience.
  • You‚Äôll continuously drive data literacy within the company, helping stakeholders leverage data effectively for decision-making.

What You'll Bring To The Team

  • At least 2-3 years of experience in data analytics, preferably within a gaming environment.
  • Proficient in SQL and Python (or R) for data exploration and analysis.
  • Strong experience with A/B testing and applied statistics (bonus if familiar with Bayesian statistics).
  • Experience building dashboards using tools like Metabase, Looker, or Tableau.
  • Strong analytical skills and a proactive mindset.
  • A fast learner, able to balance immediate needs with long-term projects.
  • A collaborative team player, comfortable working with cross-functional teams.

Why You'll Love Working With Us

  • We‚Äôre 100% remote, work wherever you want forever!
  • We offer unlimited holidays and sick days. Take as much time off as you need, to spend time with your family and friends or just because you feel like playing games all day. We trust our team and want to offer a modern work life balance that allows you to thrive both at work and in your personal life.
  • You‚Äôll be able to make an impact, to work closely with the rest of the team and its leads to work on one of the most promising upcoming games in the mobile gaming industry and the Web3 space.
  • You‚Äôll have a comfortable work schedule and stable workload. With a variety of tasks that will allow your constant professional development.
  • We want our team to grow personally and professionally and support learning opportunities, especially with a focus around new AI tools and methods.
  • We have a culture that puts our people first. We believe in open communication, creativity and the value of unique contributions from everyone in the team.
  • We offer a competitive salary in addition to equity option plans.

A leading automotive company based in Brussels, known for delivering innovative, data-driven solutions in the industry. They are expanding their team and looking for a skilled BI Analyst to join them on a freelance basis.

We are looking for a Freelance BI Analyst to help the automotive company unlock the power of data to support strategic decisions. This role will involve analyzing large datasets, creating dashboards, and collaborating with business stakeholders to drive impactful insights.
Analyze large datasets and generate actionable insights.
Develop reports and dashboards to support decision-making.
Work with business teams to understand their data needs.
Translate business requirements into BI solutions.
Use BI tools (Power BI, Tableau, QlikView) to create user-friendly dashboards and reports.
Design and implement data models and ETL processes for accurate reporting.
BI Tools: Strong experience with BI tools (Power BI, Tableau, QlikView, etc.).
SQL: Advanced SQL skills for querying and manipulating data.
Data Analysis: Strong analytical skills, with the ability to translate complex data into clear insights.
Please forward your CV to Bilal.Tariq@g2recruitment.com

4152730331,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-analyst-at-cream-consulting-4152730331?position=27&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=CW3274vgdC%2BFGcvEz%2B5ngg%3D%3D,Business Intelligence Analyst,Cream Consulting,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Permanent position only

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency‚Ä¶but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.
WHAT IS A BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Jean, Business Analyst Business Intelligence, translate the BI needs of the business teams in specifications for the IT department, for both small demands or as part of larger projects (contributions or BI project).
Act as person of contact between Business Engineering Teams and the Development Team
Define the business specifications for BI needs

Participation in (or management of) BI projects, or on the BI tracks of other projects for the engineering activities (requirement definition, impact analysis, process definition), while representing the BI vision (and BI target architecture) that has been defined
Collaboration with data delivery experts to deliver on projects
Understand business requirements and build a functional analysis which covers needs of the business according to our BI reference architecture
HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?
You have a Master degree in Computer Sciences or equivalent by experience
You have good knowledge in BI techniques and tools (BO, SAS, Cognos...)
You have a cultural openness and adaptability, you are rigorous, customer oriented, and you have high communication skills and analytical skills
You are polyvalent and can adapt easily to quickly changing environment
You are capable to think out of the box and maintain in the meantime a pragmatic approach
You are able to work with autonomy while being also a great team player
You are fluent in French and English
column2: a good knowledge of Dutch is also required

column1: You are committed to travelling abroad occasionally upon the client‚Äôs request

4023511495,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-m-f-at-littlebigcode-4023511495?position=29&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=Hde01jLyhn7UrQjwsBA26Q%3D%3D,Data Analyst M/F,LittleBigCode,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","LittleBigCode is a digital consulting laboratory specializing in Data and Artificial Intelligence. Our mission is to democratize the use of these technologies by co-building useful applications with our customers for the Society of the future, particularly on subjects related to health, mobility or the environment. For this, we deliver turnkey projects and also work on consulting assignments while developing our own solutions. Finally, we combine Cloud technologies, AGILE methods and DevOps culture to facilitate industrialization and scaling up.
A community of more than 50 enthusiasts of Data Science & Data Engineering domains
International presence & missions ‚Äì we are launching our new office in Belgium!
Workshops, Innovation contests, customers challenges taken up
As such, we are looking to build our technical team in Belgium ! Join us !
What will be your tasks with us ?
You will work in Agile mode and you will support our client on their challenges related to Data and analysis. You will be working in the following areas:
Business case study with business teams, understanding of business requirements
Analysis of customer data and processes in order to study their valuation
Support Data Scientists & Data Engineers on deployment of AI applications
Creation of dashboards & visualization solutions in order to bring business teams valuable & dynamic insights
Support your customers in the use of the applications you developed
Ensure a technological watch in order to propose innovations
You have a Master in Engineering (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics‚Ä¶) and you have some experiences as a Data Analyst
You have bases in the realization of dashboards/reporting, the development of Data solutions models and applications starting from-scratch
You are comfortable working with both technical & business stakeholders, thanks to your nice communication skills!
You are fully proficient in Python, SQL and DataViz tools
You have experiences with Data services of at least one the major Cloud Provider (Azure, AWS, GCP)
Note that we are also big devotees of DevOps so the more you are comfortable with it, all the better!
Fluent in English + in Dutch and/or French

4195458275,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-lending-data-analyst-at-ing-belgium-4195458275?position=30&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=1CNeLtgYZp0qkH0tZTtflQ%3D%3D,Business Lending Data Analyst,ING Belgium,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Your role & work environment
As part of the development towards a ‚ÄúMore Digital- and Data driven Bank‚Äù, ING is renewing the data management capabilities globally.

As a data analyst in Business Lending, you work on a daily basis with (cross-border) colleagues having different expertise in self-steering feature teams (squads), contributing to the objectives of the tribe Business Lending which are supporting the business overall. These objectives are challenging, as regulatory and risk requirements are strengthening, client expectations are changing and there is a continuous pressure to increase efficiency. Within this context, you contribute to the design of an efficient and customer-oriented value proposition thanks to an extensive use of data analytics, but also including products and services, harmonized when possible between Belgium and the Netherlands. You will cover several customer segments from self-employed to mid-corporates.

Develop and automate Management Information reports (1) enabling the senior leaders to make appropriate decisions or (2) helping the bank to follow-up it‚Äôs compliancy against regulations or internal policies.
Translating the bank and tribe strategy to concrete initiatives within the scope of your squad
Analyzing the feasibility and the value of opportunities
Evaluating our way of working with the aim to continuously improve
Liaise with Customer Journey Experts to ensure reporting & data quality requirements are covered as from the design of the process.
Actively participating and taking initiative to improve the collaboration between different stakeholders and colleagues in other teams
Understanding and applying business principles and ensure compliancy with external regulation and internal minimum requirements

A colleague with a talent for taking it on and making it happen, enthusiasm for helping others to be successful and a knack for always being a step ahead. In other words, you strive to bring fresh ideas to life and embrace challenges in a fast changing and complex environment. You are a naturally collaborative person who listens and invests in others to achieve common goals. You love to challenge the status quo and are eager to propose creative solutions to problems.
As a Business Lending Data Analyst you will also need:
To be customer driven and focused, loving to collaborate with different people, ready to explore
An entrepreneurial attitude ‚Äì taking initiative and making things happen, manage and solve problems with the support of senior colleague
To act as process owner in the business lending domain with the support of a more senior colleague
To be interested in innovation in the domain, experiment by challenging existing trends, be curious
To manage projects involving one or 2 stakeholders with the support of a more senior colleague
affinity with data and good analytical skills, previous experience with data management/analysis
Knowledge of reporting software such as SAS Enteprise Guide, SAS Visual Analyics, PowerBI, Cognos, ‚Ä¶
Planning & organizational skills and ability to develop them with coaching
Clear communication skills : written and oral, be able to adapt your speech to the audience with the help of a more senior colleague
Previous experience in a (credit) risk oriented role is a plus
Knowledge of business lending products/services is recommended
Fluent in English and Dutch or French
Master degree or Bachelor degree with relevant work experience (e.g. Business Analyst, Data Analyst, .. )

Ever wondered what it feels like to be at the cutting edge of digital innovation? 4195546931,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-quality-expert-at-laco-4195546931?position=33&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=MEiG%2FAm4UHO4XLLoYDhsOQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst - Quality Expert,LACO,"Flemish Region, Belgium","Data Analyst / Data Quality Expert

Do you have the supernatural ability to turn raw data into gold? Are you passionate about data and convinced that data quality is the key enabler for organizations to create value from their data? If so, brace yourself, because LACO has a data-driven adventure tailor-made for you! As our Data Analyst / Data Quality Expert, you'll be the Sherlock Holmes of numbers, deciphering business requirements like clues in a mystery novel. You'll be the architect of insights, sculpting data into strategies that steer the ship.

So step into the world of LACO, because we're not just your average Belgian-based business intelligence and data analytics company. We're the superheroes of many realms including Microsoft, SAS and Data Advisory, which earned us the rank of Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner. With a squad of over 120 consultants, we're on a mission to unravel the secrets of data and lead businesses from all walks of life through the digital wilderness. Join LACO, and you're not just an employee: you're family. We blend dedication with a dash of fun in everything we do, making every day at LACO a thrilling adventure.
As a Data Analyst with focus on Quality at LACO, you‚Äôll be responsible for:
Gather and analyse data from different sources to identify inconsistency and trends.
Identifying data quality issues and clearly communicate their business impact
Clean the data and identify the route causes of data quality issues
Design and build data quality controls to support data stewards and other business stakeholders
Build (Power BI) data quality dashboards to monitor the overall data quality
Working closely with stakeholders to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Working closely with cross-functional teams and leveraging your expertise in Power BI, data quality frameworks and data platforms
Designing, optimizing, and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs and requirements.
Troubleshooting and resolving data quality issues by identifying root causes and implementing solutions.
Staying up to date with the latest technologies and best practices to excel in this role.
You have a Bachelor's and/or Master's degree in computer science or equivalent.
You have good communication skills, used to work with business stakeholders.
You have an analytical mindset for analysing business requirements.
You have proven experience with data quality projects.
You have an extended experience with Business Glossary, Data Catalog, Data Lineage or Reporting Governance
You know all about the SQL
You have experience in Power BI, including DAX, data modeling techniques, minimum Star Schemas (Kimball) and others are nice to have.
You get even more bonus points if ‚Ä¶
You have a good Experience with master data management
You are familiar with data quality tool like Azure Purview (Collibra, Informatica, Soda)
Other Security protocols like CLS (column Level Security, Object Level Security)
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and English.
Receive an attractive salary package, including a company car, along with excellent benefits.
Training opportunities to enhance your knowledge and advance your career in your chosen field.
Get involved in innovative Microsoft tracks that challenge and inspire you.
Guided by our expert LACO coaches, you'll have the support and motivation to grow and build a sustainable career.
We practice participative management, as we extend a warm invitation to you to embrace ownership and play an active role in shaping both your future and that of LACO.
Have a say in which project placement you‚Äôll get, enabling you to work remotely, in the office, in a hybrid fashion, or based on your geographical preferences.
A great company culture with room for fun events such as: family day, yearly ski trip, sports events, game nights, ‚Ä¶

Don't let this opportunity slip through your data fingers! Get in touch with our one and only Talent Acquisition team and embark on your adventure to success. Hurry up and smash that button, before your dream job becomes someone else's journey!

4190417094,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-data-kwaliteit-at-laco-4190417094?position=36&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=qZGDPrfD2E7pAAUp9Oz7Vg%3D%3D,Data Analyst - Data Kwaliteit,LACO,"Flemish Region, Belgium","Wij zoeken een Data Analyst - Data Kwaliteit expert om ons Microsoft-team te versterken!

LACO is een Belgisch bedrijf dat gespecialiseerd is in business intelligence en data-analyse, met meer dan 35 jaar ervaring. Als Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner hebben we uitgebreide expertise op gebieden zoals Microsoft BI en Data Governance. Met meer dan 120 consultants helpen we bedrijven succesvol te zijn met data. Bij LACO combineren we toewijding met een vleugje plezier in alles wat we doen.

Bij ons staan langetermijnrelaties met klanten en collega‚Äôs centraal. Onlangs hebben we enkele grote projecten binnengehaald bij belangrijke klanten, en daarom willen we ons Microsoft-team versterken om samen met het LACO-team end-to-endprojecten te realiseren.

Heb jij de bovennatuurlijke gave om ruwe data om te zetten in goud? Ben je gepassioneerd door data en overtuigd dat datakwaliteit d√© sleutel is om organisaties waarde uit hun data te laten halen? Dan heeft LACO een data-gedreven avontuur op maat voor jou!

Als onze Data Analyst / Data Kwaliteit Expert ben jij de Sherlock Holmes van cijfers: je ontrafelt bedrijfsvereisten alsof het aanwijzingen in een mysterie zijn. Je bouwt niet alleen inzichten op, maar vormt ook strategische data-oplossingen die bedrijven naar succes leiden.
Als Data Analyst / Data Kwaliteit Expert bij LACO ben je verantwoordelijk voor:
Verzamelen en analyseren van data uit verschillende bronnen om inconsistenties en trends te identificeren
Signaleren van datakwaliteitsproblemen en de impact ervan op de business
Schoonmaken van data en het achterhalen van de oorzaken van kwaliteitsproblemen
Opzetten van Power BI dashboards om datakwaliteit te monitoren
Samenwerken met stakeholders en verschillende teams rond data kwaliteit en dataplatformen
Ontwerpen, optimaliseren en ontwikkelen van Power BI rapporten en dashboards volgens de behoeften van de business
Identificeren van oorzaken van datakwaliteitsproblemen en implementeren van oplossingen.
Op de hoogte blijven van de nieuwste technologie√´n en best practices binnen data-analyse en datakwaliteit
Je hebt een bachelor- en/of masterdiploma in computerwetenschappen of een gelijkwaardige opleiding
Je bent communicatief sterk en gewend om met business stakeholders samen te werken
Je hebt een analytische mindset en kan business vereisten vertalen naar data-oplossingen
Je hebt aantoonbare ervaring met datakwaliteit projecten
Je hebt uitgebreide kennis van Business Glossary, Data Catalog, Data Lineage en Reporting Governance
Je hebt een sterke kennis van SQL
Je hebt ervaring met Power BI, inclusief DAX, datamodellering en Star Schemas (Kimball)
Ervaring hebt met Master Data Management.
Bekend bent met datakwaliteitstools zoals Azure Purview, Collibra, Informatica of Soda.
Kennis hebt van Python, Spark, PySpark, Spark SQL.
Ervaring met security protocollen zoals Column Level Security (CLS) en Object Level Security.
We werken graag samen met zowel werknemers als freelancers.
Je ontvangt een aantrekkelijk salarispakket en uitstekende extralegale voordelen.
Je krijgt toegang tot opleidingsmogelijkheden om je kennis te vergroten en je carri√®re verder te ontwikkelen.
Je werkt mee aan innovatieve Microsoft-trajecten die je uitdagen en inspireren.
Geniet van een geweldige bedrijfscultuur met ruimte voor leuke evenementen zoals familiedagen, jaarlijkse skireizen, sportevenementen, spelavonden, ‚Ä¶
Laat deze kans niet aan je datavingers voorbijgaan!
Neem contact op met onze recruiters en begin jouw avontuur naar succes.

Over LACO

LACO is een Belgisch bedrijf dat gespecialiseerd is in business intelligence en data-analyse, met meer dan 35 jaar ervaring. Als Microsoft Data &
column2:
AI Solutions Partner hebben we uitgebreide expertise op gebieden zoals Microsoft BI en Data Governance. Met meer dan 120 consultants helpen we bedrijven succesvol te zijn met data. Bij LACO combineren we toewijding met een vleugje plezier in alles wat we doen.


Bij ons staan langetermijnrelaties met klanten en collega‚Äôs centraal. Onlangs hebben we enkele grote projecten binnengehaald bij belangrijke klanten, en daarom willen we ons Microsoft-team versterken om samen met het LACO-team end-to-endprojecten te realiseren.


Heb jij de bovennatuurlijke gave om ruwe data om te zetten in goud? Ben je gepassioneerd door data en overtuigd dat datakwaliteit d√© sleutel is om organisaties waarde uit hun data te laten halen? Dan heeft LACO een data-gedreven avontuur op maat voor jou!

Als onze Data Analyst / Data Kwaliteit Expert ben jij de Sherlock Holmes van cijfers: je ontrafelt bedrijfsvereisten alsof het aanwijzingen in een mysterie zijn. Je bouwt niet alleen inzichten op, maar vormt ook strategische data-oplossingen die bedrijven naar succes leiden.


Jouw rol

Als Data Analyst / Data Kwaliteit Expert bij LACO ben je verantwoordelijk voor:

  • Verzamelen en analyseren van data uit verschillende bronnen om inconsistenties en trends te identificeren
  • Signaleren van datakwaliteitsproblemen en de impact ervan op de business
  • Schoonmaken van data en het achterhalen van de oorzaken van kwaliteitsproblemen
  • Ontwikkelen en implementeren van datakwaliteitscontroles
  • Opzetten van Power BI dashboards om datakwaliteit te monitoren
  • Samenwerken met stakeholders en verschillende teams rond data kwaliteit en dataplatformen
  • Ontwerpen, optimaliseren en ontwikkelen van Power BI rapporten en dashboards volgens de behoeften van de business
  • Identificeren van oorzaken van datakwaliteitsproblemen en implementeren van oplossingen.
  • Op de hoogte blijven van de nieuwste technologie√´n en best practices binnen data-analyse en datakwaliteit


Jouw vaardigheden

  • Je hebt een bachelor- en/of masterdiploma in computerwetenschappen of een gelijkwaardige opleiding
  • Je bent communicatief sterk en gewend om met business stakeholders samen te werken
  • Je hebt een analytische mindset en kan business vereisten vertalen naar data-oplossingen
  • Je hebt aantoonbare ervaring met datakwaliteit projecten
  • Je hebt uitgebreide kennis van Business Glossary, Data Catalog, Data Lineage en Reporting Governance
  • Je hebt een sterke kennis van SQL
  • Je hebt ervaring met Power BI, inclusief DAX, datamodellering en Star Schemas (Kimball)


Bonuspunten als je ‚Ä¶

  • Ervaring hebt met Master Data Management.
  • Bekend bent met datakwaliteitstools zoals Azure Purview, Collibra, Informatica of Soda.
  • Kennis hebt van Python, Spark, PySpark, Spark SQL.
  • Ervaring met security protocollen zoals Column Level Security (CLS) en Object Level Security.


Ons aanbod

  • We werken graag samen met zowel werknemers als freelancers.
  • Je ontvangt een aantrekkelijk salarispakket en uitstekende extralegale voordelen.
  • Je krijgt toegang tot opleidingsmogelijkheden om je kennis te vergroten en je carri√®re verder te ontwikkelen.
  • Je werkt mee aan innovatieve Microsoft-trajecten die je uitdagen en inspireren.
  • Geniet van een geweldige bedrijfscultuur met ruimte voor leuke evenementen zoals familiedagen, jaarlijkse skireizen, sportevenementen, spelavonden, ‚Ä¶


Laat deze kans niet aan je datavingers voorbijgaan!

Neem contact op met onze recruiters en begin jouw avontuur naar succes.

4197243513,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-fsma-4197243513?position=37&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=C2a3ux4TlIwegIgE0XEDxg%3D%3D,Data Analyst,FSMA,"Brussels Region, Belgium","Would you like to contribute as a data analyst to better consumer protection and to increasing public trust in the financial sector?
Come and join our FSMA team and become a data analyst at the ‚ÄòData analytics expertise centre‚Äô

The ‚ÄòData analytics expertise centre‚Äô occupies a key role in developing and rolling out data-driven supervision at the FSMA. As a data analyst, you will conduct project-based data analyses, provide advice and support for the implementation of innovative projects in various supervisory areas, and search for new data-driven applications that can support supervision.
You will be working on various innovative projects that help the different supervisory areas work in a data-driven manner.
You will be involved in conducting analyses as part of financial supervision, for which you will make use of external or internal data (MiFIR database, EMIR, textual data etc.).
You will assist the operational supervisory services in developing and implementing risk models and will thereby contribute to a risk-based approach to supervision.
You will search for new applications of data-driven supervision at the FSMA, and to this end will be in contact with various supervisory areas.
WHAT KNOWLEDGE, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS DO YOU BRING?
A Master‚Äôs degree in a highly data-driven field (e.g. master in economics, business engineer, actuarial sciences, applied sciences, statistics or a similar discipline)
column2: a doctorate is an asset.

column1: Preferably several years of professional experience as a data analyst or in the academic world.
Strong data processing skills and practical experience with R and/or Python.
Affinity and experience with Natural Language Processing (NLP) is a plus.
An explicit interest in financial markets and products, as well as in the various new developments in those areas.
Strong adaptability and interpersonal skills. Ability to work on a team and to show initiative.
Strong analytical skills and a capacity for synthesis. Ability to communicate in a logical, structured manner both verbally and in writing.
Goal-orientedness, assertiveness and persuasive powers of argumentation.
Affinity with the tasks in the public interest entrusted to the FSMA.
Solid competence in Dutch and a good knowledge of French and English.
A full-time job with a permanent contract.
The chance to do your bit for consumer protection.

A competitive salary package with many fringe benefits (e.g. group and hospitalization insurance, full reimbursement of the cost of commuting to/from work, budget-friendly company dining room, contribution to your mobile phone and internet subscriptions, additional non-statutory holidays, bank holidays, etc.).
A wide range of opportunities for learning and development.
Good work/life balance (teleworking a few days a week).
Offices within easy reach of Brussels city centre.
Please note that each member of the FSMA staff is subject to a strict code of ethics and is bound by the obligation of professional secrecy.
