Devoteam is a leading consulting firm focused on digital transformation. We help our clients leverage technology to achieve their business goals.

Our¬†longstanding partnerships with leaders like AWS, Google Cloud, Microsoft, and ServiceNow¬†amplify our capabilities, allowing us to deliver top-tier expertise and award-winning services. We complement these partnerships with in-depth Cyber, Data & AI, Software development and multi cloud expertise.¬†
For¬†30 years, we have always been guiding our customers on the next tech wave. Devoteam has guided organizations through the Internet and cloud. The next revolution? AI.
With¬†11,000 tech natives working in 25+ countries, we bring you highly skilled IT experts across Europe
At Devoteam,¬†tech is in our DNA, and it‚Äôs the people we empower with tech. Now, with responsible AI, we‚Äôre ready to unlock a future where technology drives positive change.
If you like these keywords, you‚Äôll love this role:

Dreaming about exploring the data understanding how the business works? Do you enjoy telling a story around data? Do you enjoy figuring out how to calculate the needed KPI? We are currently looking for an Azure Data Analyst who can support our customers by telling a story around data by creating reports and dashboards.

Do you have experience with Power BI or with a similar reporting tool? Are you also interested in supporting our Azure Data Engineer team computing the right data set? Are you attracted by new technologies and new methodologies? You‚Äôre a good candidate to be our future colleague!

As an Azure Data Analyst, you will be a crucial part of our key projects for our data solutions. You will be in front of the customer understanding their need, creating the correct report and guiding our Azure Data Engineer to prepare properly the needed data.
For this position, we‚Äôre looking for all seniority levels.¬†
[Must-have] Hands-on experience with Power BI, SQL Server Reporting Services or Tableau
[Must-have] Hands-on experience with MS SQL querying language (T-SQL)
[Must-have] Hands-on experience modeling a datawarehouse/datamart in Star Schema
[Must-have] Knowledge about modeling techniques like data vault, Merise/3NF
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience creating Azure resources for a data cloud solution.
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience building data pipeline with some Azure data tools (Azure Data Factory, Synapse, Azure Data Lake‚Ä¶)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with the DataBricks environment (Delta Live Table, Workflows, SQL Warehouse)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with MS SQL Server suite (SSIS, SSAS)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with Python and PySpark
[Nice-to-have] You‚Äôre ready to drive change and bring creative tech ideas to life.
[Nice-to-have] You‚Äôre either proficient in Dutch or French (or you want to learn) and fluent in English.
[Bonus-points] Azure certified (or willing to obtain). Certifications in scope: PL-300, DP-203

If you do not feel fully confident that you meet the requirements above, please don‚Äôt worry. Just apply. Together we‚Äôll discover what you can bring to the table, in which role you would fit best and how you could potentially grow at Devoteam.
As a digital native you will have a positive impact at top organizations in Belgium.
Direct access to the Microsoft organization and programs thanks to our global partnership.
Prepare to inspire and be inspired by other Devoteamers in tech communities.
We enable local and international collaboration and exchange with other tech leaders and specialists, knowledge sharing, peer-to-peer coaching.
A personalized career plan with training offers in soft- & hard skills and certifications aligned to your needs & expertise.
Our servant leadership supports opportunities to grow your personal brand through blogs, keynote sessions, and more.
#techies in our minds, #creatives in our hearts, #change in our DNA.

Cutting-edge Technology: Embrace the latest advancements in IT and digital technologies as we constantly innovate to stay ahead of the competition. Our commitment to adopting state-of-the-art tools and methodologies ensures that you'll work on projects at the forefront of the industry.

Entrepreneur mindset: We value our people over processes. You will develop and grow in an agile and ambitious company where it‚Äôs okay to take risks, make mistakes and change plans to find transformative solutions. At the same time, you will learn from the best, building relationships and skills that will last your entire career.

Endless Learning Opportunities: We value personal and professional growth. Through workshops, conferences, and certifications, we offer the resources needed to expand your skill set and reach new heights in your career.
Connect with amazing people: You will become part of a network of +10,000 Devoteamers spread over 20 countries.

Collaborative Culture: Teamwork is at the heart of our organisation. You'll be working side by side with a diverse group of IT experts who share your passion for excellence and will inspire you to think outside the box.

Impactful Projects: Tackle real-world challenges that matter! From revolutionising business processes to developing innovative solutions, you'll have the chance to make a genuine and positive impact on our clients and the community.
Work-Life Balance: We believe in a healthy work-life balance, ensuring that you have time to unwind, pursue your hobbies, and spend quality time with loved ones.

Inspiring and eco-friendly workplace: We just moved to an amazing new building. We believe an inspiring workspace fuels creativity and fosters a positive work culture, allowing our employees to reach their full potential. The Wings building is also designed with eco-friendly features and energy-efficient systems. By reducing our ecological footprint, we are contributing to a greener future and aligning our business practices with our environmental values. The building is also very easily accessible by public transportation.¬†

Competitive package: We offer a competitive salary package with additional benefits like a company car, smartphone, medical insurance, pension plan, net allowance, laptop, meal vouchers, etc. We review our salary grid twice a year to ensure we are in line with the market.
At Devoteam, we combine strong values ‚Äì respect, frankness, ambition, entrepreneurship & collaboration - with a fun environment that empowers you to innovate and succeed.
>>> Does all this sound compelling to you? Go for it and click that apply button!

NORRIQ is a leading international consulting firm headquartered in Denmark and Belgium, with 350+ consultants driving business transformation through technology. Our Financial Services practice includes 100+ specialists supporting banks, insurers, and financial institutions in navigating regulatory challenges, embracing emerging technologies, and meeting evolving client demands. We prioritize growth, innovation, and excellence, offering abundant opportunities for professional development and collaboration.

NORRIQ is seeking to grow its Data Analytics and Artificial Intelligence team with additional Data Analyst / Data Visualisation Consultants to improve the business performance of financial institutions. You will help our clients to optimize the value they can get from their internal and external data, through improved business performance monitoring and enhanced reporting quality and readability. Join us to work on impactful projects that shape the future of finance.
Collecting and interpreting internal and external data about customer behaviour via the digital platforms (Web and mobile) and their digital transactions with the bank.
Translate data insight into actionable recommendations in order to coordinate the business needs around data and improve the bank‚Äôs digital and marketing strategy and optimize future campaigns.
Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and correlations
Develop and maintain complex data models, databases, data warehouses and data marts .
Create data visualizations and reports to communicate insights to stakeholders.
Perform data quality checks and ensure data integrity, develop and implement data governance policies and procedures
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies in data analysis and visualization
Master‚Äôs degree (or equivalent work experience) in mathematics or statistics, business intelligence, computer engineering, economy.
1-3 years of experience in data projects, preferably within the financial services industry.
Technical Expertise & Tooling: SQL (mandatory), SAS (nice to have), Python & R (to support our AI team), Reporting & Visualisation tools (Power BI, Tableau, Adobe Analytics, ...),.
ETL Processes: Affinity with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes, including an understanding of data preparation, cleansing, and integration from multiple sources.
Analytical Skills: Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Business Analysis Skills: Experience in requirements gathering, process design and developing action plans.
AI knowledge: AI knowledge & interest to connect easily with our data scientist and machine learning engineers.

column2: ability to work well in cross-functional teams and engage effectively with stakeholders.

We offer a supportive, flexible, and growth-oriented workplace where your contributions make a difference. Here‚Äôs what you can expect:

32 vacation days, plus bank holidays, with options to purchase extra time off.
Opportunities for international exposure and travel to support exciting projects and events.
We'd love to hear from you if you‚Äôre passionate about communication and eager to grow in a fast-paced, innovative, and international company.
Apply today and Get The Future You Want!

Exsolv√¶ is a Brussels-based consultancy at the forefront of Data and Artificial Intelligence innovation. We specialize in providing expert Consultancy, Audit, and Solution Development services to empower our partners in overcoming unique challenges. Our holistic approach fosters collaboration across diverse domains, including Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and AI.
At Exsolv√¶, our ""Solvers"" are passionate professionals equipped with cutting-edge tools, a culture of continuous learning, and an unwavering commitment to delivering high-impact solutions.
We are seeking a Business Intelligence & Advanced Analytics Specialist to join our expert team and help our clients unlock the power of data to drive strategic decision-making and innovation.

As a Business Intelligence & Advanced Analytics Specialist, you will design and implement data-driven solutions that enable organizations to make informed, strategic decisions. You will work alongside multidisciplinary teams, using advanced BI tools and techniques to create insightful dashboards, reports, and analytics workflows.
Educational Background: Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Business Intelligence, or a related field.
Languages: Written & Spoken Fluency in English AND French or Dutch
Technical Expertise: Proficiency in data visualization tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik, and strong SQL skills for querying databases.
Data Integration Skills: Experience with ETL/ELT processes and tools such as Azure Data Factory, SSIS, or Informatica.
Cloud Experience: Hands-on experience with cloud BI platforms like Azure Synapse Analytics, AWS QuickSight, or Google BigQuery.
Programming Skills: Familiarity with Python or R for advanced analytics and statistical modeling.
Soft Skills: Strong analytical thinking, communication, and collaboration skills to work with clients and multidisciplinary teams.
Knowledge of big data tools like Apache Spark or Hadoop.
Experience with predictive analytics and machine learning integration into BI workflows.
Familiarity with KPI frameworks and business acumen to align analytics with strategic goals.
Certifications such as Microsoft Certified: Data Analyst Associate or Tableau Certified Professional.
Client Engagement: Collaborate with clients to assess their analytical needs and recommend BI solutions that align with their strategic goals.
Data Integration and Reporting: Design and implement data visualization solutions using tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik, creating impactful dashboards and reports.
Data Ecosystem Implementation: Build and optimize scalable data pipelines to process and transform data efficiently for BI and analytics purposes.
Data Modeling: Develop and maintain robust, scalable data models to support analytical needs.
ETL/ELT Development: Create efficient data integration workflows using ETL/ELT tools and frameworks.
Advanced Analytics: Apply statistical and predictive modeling techniques to extract actionable insights from complex datasets.
Cloud BI Solutions: Deploy and manage BI workflows on platforms such as Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud to ensure performance and scalability.
Stay updated on advancements in BI and analytics technologies, tools, and methodologies.
Explore innovative ways to integrate advanced analytics techniques, such as predictive analytics and machine learning, into BI solutions.
Lead BI and analytics projects from concept to completion, ensuring timely and high-quality delivery.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver end-to-end solutions that meet client objectives.
Conduct workshops and training sessions to empower client teams with BI and analytics capabilities.
Provide ongoing support to ensure the reliability and scalability of deployed solutions.
Impactful Projects: Contribute to diverse BI and analytics projects across industries like finance, healthcare, retail, and manufacturing.
Continuous Learning: Access the latest BI and analytics tools and training opportunities to stay at the cutting edge.
Collaborative Culture: Be part of a supportive team that values knowledge sharing and mutual growth.
Hybrid Flexibility: Enjoy a balanced work model with opportunities for remote and in-office collaboration.
Competitive Compensation: Benefit from an attractive salary, performance-based bonuses, and comprehensive benefits.

If you are a driven professional with a passion for Business Intelligence and Advanced Analytics, and a proven ability to design and deploy impactful data-driven solutions, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

About Exsolv√¶:

Exsolv√¶ is a Brussels-based consultancy at the forefront of Data and Artificial Intelligence innovation. We specialize in providing expert Consultancy, Audit, and Solution Development services to empower our partners in overcoming unique challenges. Our holistic approach fosters collaboration across diverse domains, including Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and AI.


At Exsolv√¶, our ""Solvers"" are passionate professionals equipped with cutting-edge tools, a culture of continuous learning, and an unwavering commitment to delivering high-impact solutions.


We are seeking a Business Intelligence &
column2:
Advanced Analytics Specialist to join our expert team and help our clients unlock the power of data to drive strategic decision-making and innovation.


Your Role:

As a Business Intelligence &
column3:
Advanced Analytics Specialist, you will design and implement data-driven solutions that enable organizations to make informed, strategic decisions. You will work alongside multidisciplinary teams, using advanced BI tools and techniques to create insightful dashboards, reports, and analytics workflows.


What We‚Äôre Looking For:


Required Skills and Qualifications

  • Educational Background: Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Business Intelligence, or a related field.
  • Languages: Written &
column4:
Spoken Fluency in English AND French or Dutch
  • Seniority: 3-7 years of work experience
  • Technical Expertise: Proficiency in data visualization tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik, and strong SQL skills for querying databases.
  • Data Integration Skills: Experience with ETL/ELT processes and tools such as Azure Data Factory, SSIS, or Informatica.
  • Cloud Experience: Hands-on experience with cloud BI platforms like Azure Synapse Analytics, AWS QuickSight, or Google BigQuery.
  • Programming Skills: Familiarity with Python or R for advanced analytics and statistical modeling.
  • Soft Skills: Strong analytical thinking, communication, and collaboration skills to work with clients and multidisciplinary teams.


    • Preferred Skills

    • Knowledge of big data tools like Apache Spark or Hadoop.
    • Experience with predictive analytics and machine learning integration into BI workflows.
    • Familiarity with KPI frameworks and business acumen to align analytics with strategic goals.
    • Certifications such as Microsoft Certified: Data Analyst Associate or Tableau Certified Professional.


    What You‚Äôll Do:


    Core Expertise

    • Client Engagement: Collaborate with clients to assess their analytical needs and recommend BI solutions that align with their strategic goals.
    • Data Integration and Reporting: Design and implement data visualization solutions using tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik, creating impactful dashboards and reports.
    • Data Ecosystem Implementation: Build and optimize scalable data pipelines to process and transform data efficiently for BI and analytics purposes.


    Technical Implementation

    • Data Modeling: Develop and maintain robust, scalable data models to support analytical needs.
    • ETL/ELT Development: Create efficient data integration workflows using ETL/ELT tools and frameworks.
    • Advanced Analytics: Apply statistical and predictive modeling techniques to extract actionable insights from complex datasets.
    • Cloud BI Solutions: Deploy and manage BI workflows on platforms such as Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud to ensure performance and scalability.


    Research and Innovation

    • Stay updated on advancements in BI and analytics technologies, tools, and methodologies.
    • Explore innovative ways to integrate advanced analytics techniques, such as predictive analytics and machine learning, into BI solutions.


    Project Management

    • Lead BI and analytics projects from concept to completion, ensuring timely and high-quality delivery.
    • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver end-to-end solutions that meet client objectives.


    Training and Support

    • Conduct workshops and training sessions to empower client teams with BI and analytics capabilities.
    • Provide ongoing support to ensure the reliability and scalability of deployed solutions.


    Why Join Us?

    • Impactful Projects: Contribute to diverse BI and analytics projects across industries like finance, healthcare, retail, and manufacturing.
    • Continuous Learning: Access the latest BI and analytics tools and training opportunities to stay at the cutting edge.
    • Collaborative Culture: Be part of a supportive team that values knowledge sharing and mutual growth.
    • Hybrid Flexibility: Enjoy a balanced work model with opportunities for remote and in-office collaboration.
    • Competitive Compensation: Benefit from an attractive salary, performance-based bonuses, and comprehensive benefits.


    If you are a driven professional with a passion for Business Intelligence and Advanced Analytics, and a proven ability to design and deploy impactful data-driven solutions, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

4189730666,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/research-data-intern-at-long-duration-energy-storage-council-ldes-council-4189730666?position=50&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=D7nIn%2BJ54Q2jxIxc6wlUQg%3D%3D,Research & Data Intern,Long Duration Energy Storage Council (LDES Council),"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Research & Data Intern

The Long Duration Energy Storage (LDES) Council is a global non-profit organization with founding members and a Board made up of executives and business leaders from leading energy companies, technology providers, investors and end-users. The LDES Council advances the decarbonisation of our world through the acceleration of long duration energy storage by providing member-driven, fact-based guidance and research on the deployment of long-duration energy storage for society's benefit.

Launched on November 4, 2021 at COP26, the LDES Council is rapidly growing and has established itself as a catalyst in driving global dialogues on long duration storage by providing fact-based guidance and information drawn from members‚Äô expertise.
We are now seeking a Research & Data Intern to support our work tracking LDES projects, analyzing industry trends, and contributing to key research initiatives.
Location: Remote (+/- 3 hours Central European Timezone)
Employment Type: Paid internship (Full-time, 6 months with a possibility to extend)

The Research & Data Intern will play a vital role in managing and updating the LDES Council‚Äôs global project tracker, supporting industry research, and contributing to the development of key Council publications. This internship is an exciting opportunity for an individual passionate about clean energy, data management, and technology research who is looking to gain hands-on experience in the industry.
Maintain and update the global LDES project tracker, ensuring data accuracy and completeness.
Organize and enter project data, identifying and filling gaps
Conduct research to track new projects, funding announcements, and technology deployments.
Work with external partners to innovate on developing a new format for the tracker.
Work with Excel, Google Sheets, and other database tools to manage energy storage project data.
Assist in data gathering, cleaning, and analysis for internal reports and publications.
Support research on energy storage technologies, policies, and industry trends.
Assist in updating and formatting the LDES Technology Lookbook with clear, visually appealing content.
Support the development of research-based materials, including reports, presentations, and white papers.
Monitor and track new energy storage projects, policy developments, and market trends.
Summarize key findings for internal discussions, presentations, and external reports.
Compile industry insights from various sources to inform Council initiatives.
Assist with outreach to industry stakeholders to gather project data and insights.
Support team projects related to energy storage research, data tracking, and member engagement.
Contribute ideas to improve research methodologies, workflows, and Council initiatives.
Gain exposure to industry leaders, emerging technologies, and key policy discussions, providing a valuable opportunity for learning and career development within the organization.
Comfortable working with data management and analysis tools (Excel, Google Sheets, or similar).
Strong research and analytical skills, with the ability to summarize complex information clearly.
Interest in energy, sustainability, and emerging technologies.
High attention to detail and ability to organize large datasets.
Willingness to learn, take initiative, and collaborate in a fast-paced environment.
Educational background or experience in energy, engineering, policy, or data analytics is a plus.

Don‚Äôt meet every single requirement? We are dedicated to building an inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you‚Äôre excited about this role but your experience doesn‚Äôt align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply.
¬∑ Full time, permanent, salaried, benefits-eligible, exempt status
¬∑ Healthcare provided by LDES Council for individual, including medical, dental, vision insurance
column2: family insurance available

column1: ¬∑ 401k contribution with matching contributions (in the US)
¬∑ Flexible paid time off, including your birthday!
A short letter outlining your motivation and how you meet the requirements for the role
Please email your application to careers@ldescouncil.com using the subject line: ‚ÄúRecruiting: Research & Data Intern.""

Can‚Äôt wait to make an impact on the world? You‚Äôre not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.

Your journey with us

Join us and you‚Äôll be immersed in a dynamic company where you‚Äôll work with a diverse group of talented colleagues on a variety of exciting projects.

You‚Äôll be inspired and learn every day, exploring many different industries and collaborating with our clients, ranging from large national to multinational companies to non-profit and public sector organisations.

This is the field of interest for you, if you want to conduct in-depth analyses of business and technology issues, but also make recommendations to improve or transform our clients' businesses.

Depending on the team you join, you will have different kinds of tasks:

  • You'll work on interesting and challenging assignments that inspire you daily with their diversity
  • You‚Äôll assist in analysing data, helping our clients to unlock their data solutions and to drive analytical needs
  • You‚Äôll put your analytical skills into practice, improving your strong analytical mind.
  • You‚Äôll capture and translate requirements from the business as well as new existing environments.
  • You‚Äôll extract, collect, and organise data to find correlations and patterns that produce meaningful conclusions relevant to businesses.
  • You‚Äôll work with different kinds of software, data tools, and ERP systems.
  • You'll structure and leverage our clients‚Äô data to improve their businesses.

The list above is a general overview. You'll receive more information during the interviews.

Let‚Äôs Talk About You

  • You are in the final year of your bachelor or master‚Äôs degree or your pre-final master year.
  • You are highly motivated, and a reliable team player with a sense of initiative.
  • You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and have a good knowledge of English.
  • You have a critical mindset and good analytical skills.
  • You have the ability to conceptualise and articulate ideas and solutions.
  • You are results oriented.
  • You are able to use MS Office tools (Excel, Word and PowerPoint).
  • You work methodically and conscientiously.
  • You are rigorous in your daily routine, but also in your working tools and methods.

Who is Deloitte?

We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.

In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.

Why Deloitte?

Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.

Never stop growing!Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.

We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.

Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:

  • Sustainable transport options offered by Mobility@Deloitte
  • Flexible work arrangements for all and initiatives supported by Parents@Deloitte
  • Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte
  • Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities

Empowering our employees with flexible work arrangementsremains essential in today's reality:

  • Hybrid workplace:combination of home office and on-site (+10 offices in Belgium or client's premises).
  • Part-time employment: all our jobs are open to part-time work under a 90% or 80% regime.

In this role, you will work closely with finance and compliance teams, provide actionable insights, and contribute to reporting processes for country-level operations as we expand into new markets.

pawaTech is a leading iGaming solutions provider, delivering sportsbook, casino, lottery, and player management software as a service. We power betPawa - Africa‚Äôs largest betting brand, operating across multiple markets.

Our platform is designed for scale, handling millions of active users across web and mobile, processing thousands of transactions every second. With nearly a decade of industry expertise, we don‚Äôt just build software - we craft tailored solutions that drive innovation. Our expertise, commitment to quality, and client-focused approach make us a trusted partner in Africa and beyond.
Ensuring accurate and reliable financial reporting
Developing reporting tools for external stakeholders like regulators and tax authorities
Supporting financial audits with accurate data
Collaborating with finance compliance and data warehouse teams
Conducting ad-hoc analyses to support business and financial decisions
Building and maintaining dashboards and data visualisations to communicate insights effectively
Analysing large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies, ensuring data-driven decision-making
Performing quality checks and delivering country-level financial reporting as we expand.
What makes you a great candidate:
At least 5 years of experience working in data analytics, business intelligence, or a related field
Strong proficiency in SQL for data querying and manipulation
Experience with data visualisation tools such as Tableau or Power BI
Knowledge of Python for data manipulation and analysis
Basic understanding of finance or financial reporting (beneficial)
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a relevant field, such as Computer Science, Data Analytics, or a related discipline (Mathematics, Business, Engineering, and any scientific field with data handling)
Excellent communication skills to present findings and collaborate with cross-functional teams
We make an impact and contribute to shaping of the iGaming culture
We offer growth inside dedicated teams of seniors and career prospects
We embrace modern technological stack and innovative approach
We value balance - hybrid environment, wellness-related perks and team events are waiting for you
We play it fair with compensation that recognises and backs your achievements, team budgets and recognition milestone bonuses.
This job is accepting ongoing applications and there is no application deadline.

4192819014,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/freelance-data-specialist-at-vivid-resourcing-4192819014?position=59&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=UR0TH0rg6qbJVP4p7%2FpJdA%3D%3D,Freelance Data Specialist,Vivid Resourcing,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Freelance Data Specilaist

We are seeking a skilled Data Specialist with expertise in Power BI, SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), and SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS) to join our dynamic data team. The ideal candidate will play a crucial role in managing, transforming, and visualizing complex datasets, enabling data-driven decision-making across the organization. You will work closely with business analysts, data engineers, and stakeholders to build robust data solutions.
Design, develop, and maintain Power BI reports and dashboards that provide actionable insights.
Create complex visualizations and metrics that represent data clearly and concisely for business users.
Troubleshoot and optimize Power BI reports for performance and usability.
Develop, implement, and maintain SSIS packages to extract, transform, and load (ETL) data from various sources.
Ensure data quality and integrity by performing necessary data cleansing and transformation tasks.
Optimize and troubleshoot SSIS packages for efficiency and scalability.
Design and maintain OLAP cubes and tabular models using SSAS for advanced data analytics.
Implement and optimize SSAS solutions for high performance and efficient querying.
Develop MDX (Multidimensional Expressions) and DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) queries to support advanced analytics.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand data requirements and build data models to meet those needs.
Implement data pipelines that ensure the seamless integration of multiple data sources into reporting systems.
Develop and manage data warehouses, ensuring optimal performance and scalability
If you are interested or know anyone who could be a good fit please send your CV to matthew.pring@vividresourcing.com or call +32 (0) 331 882 88

Freelance Data Specilaist


We are seeking a skilled Data Specialist with expertise in Power BI, SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), and SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS) to join our dynamic data team. The ideal candidate will play a crucial role in managing, transforming, and visualizing complex datasets, enabling data-driven decision-making across the organization. You will work closely with business analysts, data engineers, and stakeholders to build robust data solutions.


Responsibilities:


  • Design, develop, and maintain Power BI reports and dashboards that provide actionable insights.
  • Create complex visualizations and metrics that represent data clearly and concisely for business users.
  • Troubleshoot and optimize Power BI reports for performance and usability.
  • Develop, implement, and maintain SSIS packages to extract, transform, and load (ETL) data from various sources.
  • Ensure data quality and integrity by performing necessary data cleansing and transformation tasks.
  • Optimize and troubleshoot SSIS packages for efficiency and scalability.
  • Design and maintain OLAP cubes and tabular models using SSAS for advanced data analytics.
  • Implement and optimize SSAS solutions for high performance and efficient querying.
  • Develop MDX (Multidimensional Expressions) and DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) queries to support advanced analytics.
  • Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand data requirements and build data models to meet those needs.
  • Implement data pipelines that ensure the seamless integration of multiple data sources into reporting systems.
  • Develop and manage data warehouses, ensuring optimal performance and scalability


Additional Details:


  • START DATE: Flexible
  • DURATION: Long term
  • CONTRACT: Freelance
  • ONSITE POLICY: Brussels (hybrid)
  • HOURS PER WEEK: 40
  • LANGUAGES: Dutch and English
  • INTERVIEW PROCESS: Two-stage


If you are interested or know anyone who could be a good fit please send your CV to matthew.pring@vividresourcing.com or call +32 (0) 331 882 88

We Are Looking For Someone Who

Has strong knowledge of SQL (this is a must).
Is fluent in Dutch or French and English, but notion of other language and willing to improve.
Is geographically mobile: Although you must be ready to accept assignments anywhere in Belgium, most of your assignments will be Brussels based.
Success In This Role Often Comes Down To
Strong communication skills: You can convey complex ideas clearly and persuasively.
Teamwork: You excel at collaborating and building meaningful relationships.
Organizational talent: You maintain oversight and prioritize effectively in a dynamic environment.
Problem-solving ability: You think creatively and tackle challenges proactively.
We offer a supportive, flexible, and growth-oriented workplace where your contributions make a difference. Here‚Äôs what you can expect:
A hybrid work model with up to 70% remote work.
Access to world-class learning platforms to upskill in marketing, communications, and leadership.

Competitive salary with a flex plan to customize your benefits, including a company car or mobility budget.
Comprehensive health and group insurance, meal & eco vouchers.
32 vacation days, plus bank holidays, with options to purchase extra time off.
Opportunities for international exposure and travel to support exciting projects and events.
We'd love to hear from you if you‚Äôre passionate about communication and eager to grow in a fast-paced, innovative, and international company.
Apply today and Get The Future You Want!

4204097332,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-accountable-4204097332?position=4&pageNum=2&refId=df9LLyVYuiY7jo%2BcedbC1Q%3D%3D&trackingId=aLn4nAgn4PQrcv5WelAm2w%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Accountable,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","About AccountableAccountable is revolutionising financial management for the self-employed. Our platform simplifies taxes, accounting, and financial administration for the self-employed - and we're even expanding into banking. With a proven product and a growing customer base, we are now looking for a Data Analyst to drive data-driven decision making.

As a data analyst, you will play a critical role in optimising conversion to paid, ARPA, and monetisation strategies by running deep analyses, translating complex data into actionable recommendations and driving experimentation. Additionally, you will support our Performance Marketing team by identifying patterns, improving marketing efficiency, and helping optimise our key metrics.
Analyse conversion funnels, pricing models, and customer behaviour to proactively identify revenue growth opportunities.
Identify friction points in the user journey and recommend data-backed optimisations.
Oversee tracking of key revenue metrics, including Conversion to paid, ARPA, cost of acquisition (CAC), lifetime value (LTV), Churn, and Retention in the company.
Build dashboards and visualisations to provide real-time insights to the company.
Take part in the Revenue Growth meeting, to come up with and implement data-driven growth experiments.
Support A/B testing and experimentation within the company, ensuring statistical analysis of results.
Identify patterns in user acquisition that can help optimise performance marketing campaigns.
Analyse and recommend levers to improve LTV & CAC.
Work with the Performance Marketing team to refine audience targeting and budget allocation.
Help the Content Marketing Team with data requests to enrich their content operations.
A quick word about data infrastructure
At Accountable, data is currently hosted in different services:
Our own database & its analytical datalake
It will be expected of you that you can retrieve, combine & analyze data from those different sources to come up with the relevant insights.
We are constantly looking at ways to do things better and will likely, thanks to your help, improve this infrastructure.
Using programs such as Amplitude and Spreadsheets, you can turn raw data into meaningful insights and actionable recommendations.
You understand A/B testing, conversion optimisation, and monetisation strategies.
You have great intuition when it comes to building product & having a meaningful impact for the company/our users.
You take ownership, work independently, and thrive in cross-functional teams.
You understand digital marketing metrics, CAC/LTV, and how to optimise acquisition strategies.
A university degree in Data Analysis or a related field is preferred
Min. 3 years of experience in Data Analytics
üåç Work at a fast-growing fintech that‚Äôs making self-employment easier.
ü•ä Make a direct impact on the growth and profitability of our business.
üéØ Join a data-driven culture that believes in rapid iteration, and making decisions based on data.
üí°You will have the freedom to drive your own projects and influence key business decisions.
ü§ù Work closely with Product, Marketing, and Engineering to bring data to life.

About AccountableAccountable is revolutionising financial management for the self-employed. Our platform simplifies taxes, accounting, and financial administration for the self-employed - and we're even expanding into banking. With a proven product and a growing customer base, we are now looking for a Data Analyst to drive data-driven decision making.


About the role


As a data analyst, you will play a critical role in optimising conversion to paid, ARPA, and monetisation strategies by running deep analyses, translating complex data into actionable recommendations and driving experimentation. Additionally, you will support our Performance Marketing team by identifying patterns, improving marketing efficiency, and helping optimise our key metrics.


Tasks

Key Responsibilities
Revenue Growth &
column2:
Experimentation (80%)



  • Analyse conversion funnels, pricing models, and customer behaviour to proactively identify revenue growth opportunities.

  • Identify friction points in the user journey and recommend data-backed optimisations.

  • Oversee tracking of key revenue metrics, including Conversion to paid, ARPA, cost of acquisition (CAC), lifetime value (LTV), Churn, and Retention in the company.

  • Build dashboards and visualisations to provide real-time insights to the company.

  • Take part in the Revenue Growth meeting, to come up with and implement data-driven growth experiments.

  • Support A/B testing and experimentation within the company, ensuring statistical analysis of results.


Performance Marketing Support (20%)



  • Identify patterns in user acquisition that can help optimise performance marketing campaigns.

  • Analyse and recommend levers to improve LTV &
column3:
CAC.
  • Work with the Performance Marketing team to refine audience targeting and budget allocation.

  • Help the Content Marketing Team with data requests to enrich their content operations.

    • Our own database &
column4:
its analytical datalake

column5:
visualization)

column7:
analyze data from those different sources to come up with the relevant insights.

Using programs such as Amplitude and Spreadsheets, you can turn raw data into meaningful insights and actionable recommendations.

product sense

  • Proactive &
column11:
collaborative

You take ownership, work independently, and thrive in cross-functional teams.

You understand digital marketing metrics, CAC/LTV, and how to optimise acquisition strategies.


Requirements



  • Based in Berlin

  • Fluent in German

  • A university degree in Data Analysis or a related field is preferred

Benefits

Why join Accountable?


üåç Work at a fast-growing fintech that‚Äôs making self-employment easier.

column1: <icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

4198440376,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/crm-data-analyst-at-nestl%C3%A9-nespresso-sa-4198440376?position=6&pageNum=2&refId=df9LLyVYuiY7jo%2BcedbC1Q%3D%3D&trackingId=F3l0eQDDUgd7cai5kuOzUA%3D%3D,CRM Data Analyst,Nestl√© Nespresso SA,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","CRM Data Analyst, this is your challenge

Do you have a passion for data, insights, and coffee? Do you want to work together with energized teams towards the most performing plans for the Belux market? By joining our CX&I team, you will be in charge of customers insights, be the database guardian and also further optimize our analytics corner.
A day in the life of a CRM Data Analyst:
In charge of monthly B2C & B2B CRM reporting from basic KPIs to forecasting net acquisition.
Perform statistical analysis through different tools (Nespresso is working with Adobe, Knime, Snowflake, PowerBI) and present recommendations to the business.
Optimize analytical worklfows through automation and forecasting with pre-built data science tools.
Maintain DataHub knowledge & documentation, share best pratices and be the first point of contact locally.
Lead & implement the new Martech solution followed by continuous improvement in usage & roll-out.
Lead yearly deep dives across departments (collect requests, time & build & deliver analytics to stakeholders).
Adhoc analysis for internal departments (boutique, e-sales, trade, B2B), both re-actively and pro-actively.

The Nespresso Marketing team consists of 17 persons operating in 4 distinct teams: Brand, Product, B2B and Customer experience & insights. You would be part of the later one which is a dynamic analytical team of 5 persons. The CX&I team collaborates with all the departments (Channels, Demand & supply, B2C,..) to nurture the company with insights thanks to Nespresso‚Äôs direct to consumer model. Our team is also the guardian of net acquisition and subscription on top of insights.
Degree in mathematics/statistics, or economic studies with large quantitative component.
More than 3 years of experience in data / analytics related activities in a business-oriented environment.
Understand SQL language & Snowflake (or having experience in coding).
Master OS office (Excel, Powerpoint, Word) and Power BI.
You have an open mindset and enjoy discovering new tools & approaches.
Knowledge about Adobe campaign and Adobe experience platform is a plus.
Fluent in Dutch and/or French AND English is mandatory.
A full-time position located in Brussels.
Excellent benefits, including an annual target bonus.
A variety of professional trainings and development programs.
Various career opportunities, both in Benelux and internationally.
Professional working environment, team spirit, company pride and passionate colleagues.
You will contribute to make Belux a better coffee place
Our recruiters would be glad to ask any pending questions. Feel free to send your questions to careers@be.nestle.com and you will receive an answer within 3 working days.
Applying for the role of CRM Data Analyst?
Great! If you see a match with the description as described above, we will gladly receive your cv and motivation. You can upload these via the link.

We use an Artificial Intelligence (AI) Tool to schedule interviews with our candidates. So keep an eye on your email for the interview invitation! When registering your application, you will be asked if we may send you whatsapp messages
column2: if you answer 'yes' to this, you will receive communication via whatsapp in addition to messages via email. Communication through our AI tool is in English, but our recruiters speak Dutch, English, and French.

4195458275,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-lending-data-analyst-at-ing-belgium-4195458275?position=7&pageNum=2&refId=df9LLyVYuiY7jo%2BcedbC1Q%3D%3D&trackingId=IlFgkFl6zJ73ix8JF8IXWA%3D%3D,Business Lending Data Analyst,ING Belgium,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Your role & work environment
As part of the development towards a ‚ÄúMore Digital- and Data driven Bank‚Äù, ING is renewing the data management capabilities globally.

As a data analyst in Business Lending, you work on a daily basis with (cross-border) colleagues having different expertise in self-steering feature teams (squads), contributing to the objectives of the tribe Business Lending which are supporting the business overall. These objectives are challenging, as regulatory and risk requirements are strengthening, client expectations are changing and there is a continuous pressure to increase efficiency. Within this context, you contribute to the design of an efficient and customer-oriented value proposition thanks to an extensive use of data analytics, but also including products and services, harmonized when possible between Belgium and the Netherlands. You will cover several customer segments from self-employed to mid-corporates.

Develop and automate Management Information reports (1) enabling the senior leaders to make appropriate decisions or (2) helping the bank to follow-up it‚Äôs compliancy against regulations or internal policies.
Translating the bank and tribe strategy to concrete initiatives within the scope of your squad
Analyzing the feasibility and the value of opportunities
Evaluating our way of working with the aim to continuously improve
Liaise with Customer Journey Experts to ensure reporting & data quality requirements are covered as from the design of the process.
Actively participating and taking initiative to improve the collaboration between different stakeholders and colleagues in other teams
Understanding and applying business principles and ensure compliancy with external regulation and internal minimum requirements

A colleague with a talent for taking it on and making it happen, enthusiasm for helping others to be successful and a knack for always being a step ahead. In other words, you strive to bring fresh ideas to life and embrace challenges in a fast changing and complex environment. You are a naturally collaborative person who listens and invests in others to achieve common goals. You love to challenge the status quo and are eager to propose creative solutions to problems.
As a Business Lending Data Analyst you will also need:
To be customer driven and focused, loving to collaborate with different people, ready to explore
An entrepreneurial attitude ‚Äì taking initiative and making things happen, manage and solve problems with the support of senior colleague
To act as process owner in the business lending domain with the support of a more senior colleague
To be interested in innovation in the domain, experiment by challenging existing trends, be curious
To manage projects involving one or 2 stakeholders with the support of a more senior colleague
affinity with data and good analytical skills, previous experience with data management/analysis
Knowledge of reporting software such as SAS Enteprise Guide, SAS Visual Analyics, PowerBI, Cognos, ‚Ä¶
Planning & organizational skills and ability to develop them with coaching
Clear communication skills : written and oral, be able to adapt your speech to the audience with the help of a more senior colleague
Previous experience in a (credit) risk oriented role is a plus
Knowledge of business lending products/services is recommended
Fluent in English and Dutch or French
Master degree or Bachelor degree with relevant work experience (e.g. Business Analyst, Data Analyst, .. )

4189730666,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/research-data-intern-at-long-duration-energy-storage-council-ldes-council-4189730666?position=8&pageNum=2&refId=df9LLyVYuiY7jo%2BcedbC1Q%3D%3D&trackingId=HH3VfbVHTDEPN98vOTwktA%3D%3D,Research & Data Intern,Long Duration Energy Storage Council (LDES Council),"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Research & Data Intern

The Long Duration Energy Storage (LDES) Council is a global non-profit organization with founding members and a Board made up of executives and business leaders from leading energy companies, technology providers, investors and end-users. The LDES Council advances the decarbonisation of our world through the acceleration of long duration energy storage by providing member-driven, fact-based guidance and research on the deployment of long-duration energy storage for society's benefit.

Launched on November 4, 2021 at COP26, the LDES Council is rapidly growing and has established itself as a catalyst in driving global dialogues on long duration storage by providing fact-based guidance and information drawn from members‚Äô expertise.
We are now seeking a Research & Data Intern to support our work tracking LDES projects, analyzing industry trends, and contributing to key research initiatives.
Location: Remote (+/- 3 hours Central European Timezone)
Employment Type: Paid internship (Full-time, 6 months with a possibility to extend)

The Research & Data Intern will play a vital role in managing and updating the LDES Council‚Äôs global project tracker, supporting industry research, and contributing to the development of key Council publications. This internship is an exciting opportunity for an individual passionate about clean energy, data management, and technology research who is looking to gain hands-on experience in the industry.
Maintain and update the global LDES project tracker, ensuring data accuracy and completeness.
Organize and enter project data, identifying and filling gaps
Conduct research to track new projects, funding announcements, and technology deployments.
Work with external partners to innovate on developing a new format for the tracker.
Work with Excel, Google Sheets, and other database tools to manage energy storage project data.
Assist in data gathering, cleaning, and analysis for internal reports and publications.
Support research on energy storage technologies, policies, and industry trends.
Assist in updating and formatting the LDES Technology Lookbook with clear, visually appealing content.
Support the development of research-based materials, including reports, presentations, and white papers.
Monitor and track new energy storage projects, policy developments, and market trends.
Summarize key findings for internal discussions, presentations, and external reports.
Compile industry insights from various sources to inform Council initiatives.
Assist with outreach to industry stakeholders to gather project data and insights.
Support team projects related to energy storage research, data tracking, and member engagement.
Contribute ideas to improve research methodologies, workflows, and Council initiatives.
Gain exposure to industry leaders, emerging technologies, and key policy discussions, providing a valuable opportunity for learning and career development within the organization.
Comfortable working with data management and analysis tools (Excel, Google Sheets, or similar).
Strong research and analytical skills, with the ability to summarize complex information clearly.
Interest in energy, sustainability, and emerging technologies.
High attention to detail and ability to organize large datasets.
Willingness to learn, take initiative, and collaborate in a fast-paced environment.
Educational background or experience in energy, engineering, policy, or data analytics is a plus.

Don‚Äôt meet every single requirement? We are dedicated to building an inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you‚Äôre excited about this role but your experience doesn‚Äôt align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply.
¬∑ Full time, permanent, salaried, benefits-eligible, exempt status
¬∑ Healthcare provided by LDES Council for individual, including medical, dental, vision insurance
column2: family insurance available

column1: ¬∑ 401k contribution with matching contributions (in the US)
¬∑ Flexible paid time off, including your birthday!
A short letter outlining your motivation and how you meet the requirements for the role
Please email your application to careers@ldescouncil.com using the subject line: ‚ÄúRecruiting: Research & Data Intern.""

NORRIQ is seeking to grow its Data Analytics and Artificial Intelligence team with additional¬†Data Analyst / Data Visualisation Consultants¬†to improve the business performance of financial institutions. You will help our clients to optimize the value they can get from their internal and external data, through improved business performance monitoring and enhanced reporting quality and readability. Join us to work on impactful projects that shape the future of finance.
Collecting and interpreting internal and external data¬†about customer behaviour via the digital platforms (Web and mobile) and their digital transactions with the bank.
Translate data insight into actionable recommendations¬†in order to coordinate the business needs around data and improve the bank‚Äôs digital and marketing strategy and optimize future campaigns.
Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to¬†identify trends, patterns, and correlations
Develop and maintain complex data models, databases, data warehouses and data marts .
Create data visualizations and reports¬†to communicate insights to stakeholders.
Perform data quality checks and ensure data integrity, develop and implement data governance policies and procedures
Stay up-to-date¬†with industry trends and emerging technologies¬†in data analysis and visualization

1-3 years of experience¬†in¬†data¬†projects, preferably within the¬†financial services¬†industry.
Technical Expertise & Tooling: SQL (mandatory), SAS¬†(nice to have),¬†Python & R¬†(to support our AI team), Reporting & Visualisation tools¬†(Power BI, Tableau, Adobe Analytics, ...),.
ETL Processes:¬†Affinity with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes, including an understanding of data preparation, cleansing, and integration from multiple sources.
Analytical Skills:¬†Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Business Analysis Skills:¬†Experience in requirements gathering, process design and developing action plans.
AI knowledge:¬†AI knowledge & interest to connect easily with our data scientist and machine learning engineers.

column2: ability to work well in cross-functional teams and engage effectively with stakeholders.

column1: Dynamic Work Environment:¬†High-impact projects with leading financial institutions in a fast-growing consulting firm.

As a Junior Digital Customer Journey Analyst, your role is to capture and understand the end-to-end customer journey across all digital touchpoints. Your insights will help improve the customer experience and enhance the performance of the digital business.

4195908192,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-communication-specialist-at-entso-e-4195908192?position=1&pageNum=5&refId=iQhVyhnFweAV%2BJBc2jRgJw%3D%3D&trackingId=%2BDZ9m9j2eLeoyfuX844Phg%3D%3D,Data & Communication Specialist,ENTSO-E,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","About ENTSO-E

ENTSO-E is the European Network of Transmission System Operators for Electricity. We coordinate the cross-border system operations, system development and electricity market activities of the 40 electricity transmission system operators (TSOs) which cover 36 countries. The ENTSO-E Secretariat in Brussels provides support on technical, market and policy developments for all European TSOs in their cooperation with each other, in their joint fulfilment of their legal mandates, and in the intensive interactions with EU decision-makers, regulatory agencies, associations representing network users and other stakeholders.

If you are interested in having an active role in the energy transition, you should consider joining ENTSO-E. We are a dynamic European association working on important and exciting projects of the electricity sector with the commitment to support the efforts towards a carbon-neutral power system. At ENTSO-E, you will contribute to building the world‚Äôs largest integrated electricity market ‚Äì impacting not only those in the energy sector but also Europe‚Äôs overall economy, today and in the future!
We are seeking a highly professional Data & Communication Specialist, with a passion for data-based storytelling and excellent visualisation skills, and an interest in the energy sector!

The Data & Communication Specialist is part of the Programme Management team who oversees the project coordination of ENTSO-E‚Äôs System Development studies, internal communications and external communication and stakeholder engagement. Studies within the scope of work include long-term planning studies (the Ten-Year Network Development Plan and its scenarios), as well as mid-term and seasonal adequacy studies (European Resource Adequacy Assessment and Seasonal Outlook).

As the Data & Communication Specialist, you will develop and deliver data-driven communication materials and visualisations that enhance understanding of System Development products. Furthermore, ensure effective project coordination, internal and external communication to support strategic goals and stakeholder engagement. In addition, you will take the lead on specific tasks and projects, provide support and actively contribute to various tasks of the team.
In this role, you will work full time in the System Development section, reporting directly to the System Development Programme Manager.
The position is based in the ENTSO-E Secretariat in Brussels. Travelling limited to 2-5 times per year (approximately 2 days each) may be required.
The tasks can evolve, depending on the priorities in the team and in the section. Key tasks and responsibilities will include:
Analyse large data sets and study outputs, pre-process data for automation, and create visualisations for internal and external use.
Collaborate with data management and study teams to identify opportunities for improved internal and external communication on System Development data and products.
Steer projects aiming at improving the communication, transparency and accessibility of ENTSO-E‚Äôs system development studies data, for example the conception and development of a data platform.
Coordinate with ENTSO-E communication specialists, policy experts and project editors to develop data-driven messages for reports, web pages, and communication material.
Contribute to ENTSO-E grid map development and support the drafting and reviewing of study communication materials for other projects.
Support the SD Committee‚Äôs Programme Manager, Head of Section, and other managers in the Section in information exchange, identify issues and suggest solutions.
Supporting internal communications within expert level groups at ENTSO-E
Preparing and moderating ENTSO-E meetings, incl. preparing agendas, session files, presentations, and decisions, drafting minutes, tracking actions and following up to closeout actions.
We are seeking someone with the following skills and abilities:
Master level or equivalent by experience
5-8 years of experience in communication or data visualisation.
Knowledge of at least one data visualisation tool. Mastery of PowerBi is considered a strong advantage.
Passion for data-based storytelling, compelling visualisations and interactive maps, with various experiences.
Experience or strong willingness to learn GIS based platforms for grid maps.
Experience in the energy sector, in a European association, or with a TSO all are strong assets.
Team player with ability to self-prioritise and adapt to new priorities.
Fast learner and able to adapt easily to a continuously changing work environment. Eager to take coordination initiative and facilitate consensus.
Excellent writing and oral communication skills in English
Ability to work independently and team setting with competing deadlines.
Motivation to work in a multi-cultural environment and to contribute to the European energy transition.
Positive mindset aligned with the values of ENTSO-E: Team, Trust, Future-thinking, Integrity and Excellence.

Our people are truly at the heart of our association. You will be part of a multinational and multi-cultural environment, with colleagues from over 30 different nationalities. We believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce which allows us to create an environment where we learn from each other and develop together. We strongly believe in continuous learning and offer a broad range of training and development opportunities to our employees. We are a hybrid workplace and offer a maximum of flexibility enabling to have a good balance between remote working (from Belgium) and engaging physically with colleagues.

We offer market competitive compensation and an extensive benefit package, with excellent insurance coverage for you and direct family members (such as hospitalization, supplemental medical plan). You will benefit from group insurance and travel insurance. You will have the opportunity to participate in a Flexible Benefits Plan to choose for those benefits that create the best value for you.
Additionally, we offer employees from our TSO Members the chance to apply for secondment opportunities, further enriching your experience and expanding your horizons.
Please submit your application no later than 20th of April, consisting of a curriculum vitae and a motivational letter on the ENTSO-E career site. Replies will be handled in strictest confidence.
ENTSO-E is an equal opportunities employer and does not discriminate on the grounds of age, disability, marital status, gender, sexual orientation, race, religion or political beliefs.

About ENTSO-E

ENTSO-E is the European Network of Transmission System Operators for Electricity. We coordinate the cross-border system operations, system development and electricity market activities of the 40 electricity transmission system operators (TSOs) which cover 36 countries. The ENTSO-E Secretariat in Brussels provides support on technical, market and policy developments for all European TSOs in their cooperation with each other, in their joint fulfilment of their legal mandates, and in the intensive interactions with EU decision-makers, regulatory agencies, associations representing network users and other stakeholders.


If you are interested in having an active role in the energy transition, you should consider joining ENTSO-E. We are a dynamic European association working on important and exciting projects of the electricity sector with the commitment to support the efforts towards a carbon-neutral power system. At ENTSO-E, you will contribute to building the world‚Äôs largest integrated electricity market ‚Äì impacting not only those in the energy sector but also Europe‚Äôs overall economy, today and in the future!


Job description

We are seeking a highly professional Data &
column2:
Communication Specialist, with a passion for data-based storytelling and excellent visualisation skills, and an interest in the energy sector!


The Data &
column3:
Communication Specialist is part of the Programme Management team who oversees the project coordination of ENTSO-E‚Äôs System Development studies, internal communications and external communication and stakeholder engagement. Studies within the scope of work include long-term planning studies (the Ten-Year Network Development Plan and its scenarios), as well as mid-term and seasonal adequacy studies (European Resource Adequacy Assessment and Seasonal Outlook).


As the Data &
column4:
Communication Specialist, you will develop and deliver data-driven communication materials and visualisations that enhance understanding of System Development products. Furthermore, ensure effective project coordination, internal and external communication to support strategic goals and stakeholder engagement. In addition, you will take the lead on specific tasks and projects, provide support and actively contribute to various tasks of the team.


In this role, you will work full time in the System Development section, reporting directly to the System Development Programme Manager.


The position is based in the ENTSO-E Secretariat in Brussels. Travelling limited to 2-5 times per year (approximately 2 days each) may be required.


Your responsibilities

The tasks can evolve, depending on the priorities in the team and in the section. Key tasks and responsibilities will include:

  • Analyse large data sets and study outputs, pre-process data for automation, and create visualisations for internal and external use.
  • Collaborate with data management and study teams to identify opportunities for improved internal and external communication on System Development data and products.
  • Steer projects aiming at improving the communication, transparency and accessibility of ENTSO-E‚Äôs system development studies data, for example the conception and development of a data platform.
  • Coordinate with ENTSO-E communication specialists, policy experts and project editors to develop data-driven messages for reports, web pages, and communication material.
  • Contribute to ENTSO-E grid map development and support the drafting and reviewing of study communication materials for other projects.
  • Support the SD Committee‚Äôs Programme Manager, Head of Section, and other managers in the Section in information exchange, identify issues and suggest solutions.
  • Supporting internal communications within expert level groups at ENTSO-E
  • Preparing and moderating ENTSO-E meetings, incl. preparing agendas, session files, presentations, and decisions, drafting minutes, tracking actions and following up to closeout actions.


Your profile

We are seeking someone with the following skills and abilities:

  • Master level or equivalent by experience
  • 5-8 years of experience in communication or data visualisation.
  • Knowledge of at least one data visualisation tool. Mastery of PowerBi is considered a strong advantage.
  • Passion for data-based storytelling, compelling visualisations and interactive maps, with various experiences.
  • Experience or strong willingness to learn GIS based platforms for grid maps.
  • Experience in the energy sector, in a European association, or with a TSO all are strong assets.
  • Team player with ability to self-prioritise and adapt to new priorities.
  • Fast learner and able to adapt easily to a continuously changing work environment. Eager to take coordination initiative and facilitate consensus.
  • Excellent writing and oral communication skills in English
  • Ability to work independently and team setting with competing deadlines.
  • Motivation to work in a multi-cultural environment and to contribute to the European energy transition.
  • Positive mindset aligned with the values of ENTSO-E: Team, Trust, Future-thinking, Integrity and Excellence.


Our offer

Our people are truly at the heart of our association. You will be part of a multinational and multi-cultural environment, with colleagues from over 30 different nationalities. We believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce which allows us to create an environment where we learn from each other and develop together. We strongly believe in continuous learning and offer a broad range of training and development opportunities to our employees. We are a hybrid workplace and offer a maximum of flexibility enabling to have a good balance between remote working (from Belgium) and engaging physically with colleagues.


We offer market competitive compensation and an extensive benefit package, with excellent insurance coverage for you and direct family members (such as hospitalization, supplemental medical plan). You will benefit from group insurance and travel insurance. You will have the opportunity to participate in a Flexible Benefits Plan to choose for those benefits that create the best value for you.


Additionally, we offer employees from our TSO Members the chance to apply for secondment opportunities, further enriching your experience and expanding your horizons.


Interested?

Please submit your application no later than 20th of April, consisting of a curriculum vitae and a motivational letter on the ENTSO-E career site. Replies will be handled in strictest confidence.


ENTSO-E is an equal opportunities employer and does not discriminate on the grounds of age, disability, marital status, gender, sexual orientation, race, religion or political beliefs.

4204016097,https://br.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-intern-at-99-4204016097?position=29&pageNum=0&refId=qd1GKI22Q0P2kdyOkiGehg%3D%3D&trackingId=qkA6P25Y7pyvQlIN3sw8fQ%3D%3D,Business Intelligence Intern,99,"S√£o Paulo, S√£o Paulo, Brazil","About the company

We believe in technology that connects talented people who embrace diversity to create and share paths we don't even know about (yet!). We work to generate value not only for our users but, above all, for the communities we serve and for society as a whole, making every day better for everyone with mobility and delivery services (99) or digital payments (99Pay).

To make life easier for millions of people every day, since 2018, we have been part of DiDi DiDi Global Inc., the world‚Äôs leading mobility technology platform. We are pioneers in creating innovative solutions that start in Brazil and scale up to make a positive impact in more than 12 countries where DiDi operates. This innovation encompasses sustainability, safety, artificial intelligence, financial markets, and much more.
The Customer Experience (CX) team plays a strategic role in delivering outstanding service and driving data-informed improvements that put our users at the center of every decision.

As a Business Intelligence Intern, you will support data analysis initiatives that help the business understand user behavior, monitor service quality, and identify key improvement opportunities. This internship is ideal for someone passionate about analytics and eager to learn how data can influence strategy and customer satisfaction across a fast-paced, high-impact environment.
Support the analysis of datasets to identify patterns and provide actionable insights for the CX team.
Assist in building dashboards, visualizations, and recurring reports for monitoring customer-centric KPIs.
Help organize and interpret data related to customer experience, operational efficiency, and user feedback.
Work with team members and internal stakeholders to gather requirements and help translate business challenges into data tasks.
Participate in team discussions and help prepare insights to guide strategic decisions.
Contribute to the development of automations to streamline recurring tasks and reporting routines.
Help maintain and improve existing data workflows and documentation.
Gain exposure to advanced analytical tools such as SQL and Python.
Learn how to communicate data findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Participate in knowledge-sharing sessions and mentorship opportunities within the CX and Analytics teams.
Currently pursuing a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Economics, Business, or related fields.
Strong interest in data analysis, customer experience, and business strategy.
Basic knowledge of Excel and SQL (Python is a plus).
Analytical mindset and curiosity for solving problems using data.
Excellent communication skills and eagerness to learn from a multidisciplinary team.
Advanced English is mandatory (spoken and written).
Detail-oriented, proactive, and capable of working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
We are committed to building inclusive and diverse teams

At 99, we believe that our differences are our biggest source of strength. That‚Äôs why we are committed to promoting equal opportunities to all candidates and employees as an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Employment and advancement decisions at 99 are always made based on the needs of the position and the qualifications of the candidate. We do not discriminate against any employee or applicant based on their gender, age, sexual orientation, nationality, marital status, pregnancy/maternity, disability, race, religion and beliefs, or any other status protected by applicable laws wherever we operate.

We are committed to building inclusive and diverse teams, and a workplace that is free from discrimination and harassment, because that‚Äôs how we create better products and services, make better decisions and better serve the communities we‚Äôre a part of.

AB InBev is the leading global brewer and one of the world‚Äôs top 5 consumer product companies. With over 500 beer brands, we‚Äôre number one or two in many of the world‚Äôs top beer markets, including North America, Latin America, Europe, Asia, and Africa.

By bringing together global tech and commercial functions, the Growth Group allows us to fully leverage data and drive digital transformation and organic growth for AB InBev around the world.

In addition to supporting well known global beer brands like Corona, Budweiser and Michelob Ultra, the Growth Group is home to a robust suite of digital products including our B2B digital commerce platform BEES, on-demand delivery services Ze Delivery and TaDa Delivery, and table top beer keg PerfectDraft.
We are an exceptional team, focused on understanding and supporting consumer and customer needs, harnessing new technology, and scaling growth opportunities.
