4204016097,https://br.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-intern-at-99-4204016097?position=5&pageNum=2&refId=KY18%2F2Ag0SeOOjAoCOlh1A%3D%3D&trackingId=SaxDxXfAE6SkVgEfm4yYSA%3D%3D,Business Intelligence Intern,99,"S√£o Paulo, S√£o Paulo, Brazil","About the company

We believe in technology that connects talented people who embrace diversity to create and share paths we don't even know about (yet!). We work to generate value not only for our users but, above all, for the communities we serve and for society as a whole, making every day better for everyone with mobility and delivery services (99) or digital payments (99Pay).

To make life easier for millions of people every day, since 2018, we have been part of DiDi DiDi Global Inc., the world‚Äôs leading mobility technology platform. We are pioneers in creating innovative solutions that start in Brazil and scale up to make a positive impact in more than 12 countries where DiDi operates. This innovation encompasses sustainability, safety, artificial intelligence, financial markets, and much more.
The Customer Experience (CX) team plays a strategic role in delivering outstanding service and driving data-informed improvements that put our users at the center of every decision.

As a Business Intelligence Intern, you will support data analysis initiatives that help the business understand user behavior, monitor service quality, and identify key improvement opportunities. This internship is ideal for someone passionate about analytics and eager to learn how data can influence strategy and customer satisfaction across a fast-paced, high-impact environment.
Support the analysis of datasets to identify patterns and provide actionable insights for the CX team.
Assist in building dashboards, visualizations, and recurring reports for monitoring customer-centric KPIs.
Help organize and interpret data related to customer experience, operational efficiency, and user feedback.
Work with team members and internal stakeholders to gather requirements and help translate business challenges into data tasks.
Participate in team discussions and help prepare insights to guide strategic decisions.
Contribute to the development of automations to streamline recurring tasks and reporting routines.
Help maintain and improve existing data workflows and documentation.
Gain exposure to advanced analytical tools such as SQL and Python.
Learn how to communicate data findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Participate in knowledge-sharing sessions and mentorship opportunities within the CX and Analytics teams.
Currently pursuing a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Economics, Business, or related fields.
Strong interest in data analysis, customer experience, and business strategy.
Basic knowledge of Excel and SQL (Python is a plus).
Analytical mindset and curiosity for solving problems using data.
Excellent communication skills and eagerness to learn from a multidisciplinary team.
Advanced English is mandatory (spoken and written).
Detail-oriented, proactive, and capable of working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
We are committed to building inclusive and diverse teams

At 99, we believe that our differences are our biggest source of strength. That‚Äôs why we are committed to promoting equal opportunities to all candidates and employees as an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Employment and advancement decisions at 99 are always made based on the needs of the position and the qualifications of the candidate. We do not discriminate against any employee or applicant based on their gender, age, sexual orientation, nationality, marital status, pregnancy/maternity, disability, race, religion and beliefs, or any other status protected by applicable laws wherever we operate.

We are committed to building inclusive and diverse teams, and a workplace that is free from discrimination and harassment, because that‚Äôs how we create better products and services, make better decisions and better serve the communities we‚Äôre a part of.

conoscenza e l'utilizzo dell'ERP aziendale SAP, nonch√© una spiccata facilit√† di apprendimento per l'utilizzo degli altri strumenti a supporto delle attivit√† aziendali.
Capacit√† di analisi dei dati e delle informazioni, conoscenza della normativa generale di rischi reputazionali (anti-corruzione, riciclaggio, 231, ecc..), capacit√† di reporting

4204356691,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-consultant-data-analytics-intern-at-kpmg-italy-4204356691?position=14&pageNum=0&refId=up0NnzPToC6bMNV9F32jKw%3D%3D&trackingId=x1840mS0v91Vt5cB0YIIRA%3D%3D,Junior Consultant - Data Analytics (intern),KPMG Italy,"Rome, Latium, Italy","We let the future guide us. Join our next generation

Vuoi fare un lavoro che sia davvero significativo e di impatto? In KPMG avrai l‚Äôopportunit√† di aiutare i clienti, la societ√†, le colleghe e i colleghi ad affrontare e risolvere le sfide pi√π attuali e complesse. KPMG Advisory offre servizi di consulenza alle imprese per affiancarle nella trasformazione del business model, nel miglioramento e nella digitalizzazione dei processi, nell'analisi e nella gestione dei rischi, nonch√© supporto nelle operazioni di finanza straordinaria.
Nel particolare, entrerai a far parte del Team di Lighthouse di Roma.
La Lighthouse √® il centro di eccellenza di KPMG Advisory che offre soluzioni di Data & Analytics sul mercato.

Unendoti al team, svilupperai soluzioni innovative attingendo dalle nostre competenze globali. Combinerai informatica, matematica, statistica e business per creare analisi predittive, presentandole e comunicandole con professionalit√† e competenza. Opererai in un ambiente orientato all'innovazione tecnologica, occupandoti di Data Science, Advanced Analytics, Predictive Maintenance, Natural Language Processing, Econometrics e molto altro! Abbiamo ricevuto riconoscimenti internazionali per quanto riguarda la nostra capacit√† di interpretare e gestire i dati.
Integrazione dei dati: capire quali fonti di dati sono importanti e come devono essere trattate al fine di potenziare nuovi strumenti e metodologie Data Driven
Modellazione: sviluppo di nuovi modelli Statistici e di Machine Learning ad hoc per soddisfare le richieste e i requisiti aziendali
Piattaforme di analisi avanzate: Sviluppo di pipeline ML complete, dall'ingestione dei dati alle applicazioni frontend

Incontri ed eventi orientati al business: concentrandosi fortemente sulla condivisione con gli utenti aziendali dei dettagli del progetto, si costruisce la fiducia nello strumento e nella metodologia utilizzata per svilupparlo.
Come As You Are - Le tue competenze e caratteristiche
Questa opportunit√† √® perfetta per te se:
Possiedi una Laurea in Data Science, Statistica, Matematica/Ingegneria Matematica, o altra ritenuta attinente
Hai una buona conoscenza dei principali linguaggi di programmazione come Python, R, SAS

Hai competenze nella comprensione del ciclo di vita dei modelli: preparazione dei dati dell'ultimo miglio, sviluppo di modelli statistici e di intelligenza artificiale e distribuzione in un'infrastruttura cloud
Hai una buona conoscenza di: Data Warehouse, estrazione, manipolazione e preparazione dei dati

Hai competenze di base di Data Visualization, con soluzioni Enterprise (es. PowerBI) o soluzioni open-source come ggplot o plotly, e magari anche di visualizzazione di dati geografici tramite sistemi GIS e/o librerie geografiche (geopandas)
Hai conoscenze generali di statistica economica (grandezze macroeconomiche, contabilit√† Istat, numeri indice, serie storiche economiche e finanziarie, statistica territoriale) e di econometria
Sai consultare le fonti statistiche ufficiali (Istat, Eurostat, Banca d‚ÄôItalia, Fondo Monetario Internazionale, Banca Mondiale, OCSE, ecc.)
Hai competenze di base con le principali piattaforme cloud (Azure, AWS)
Hai una buona padronanza della lingua inglese, preferibilmente con esperienze di studio e/o lavoro all'estero.
Your Future With Us - Cosa troverai in KPMG
Un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, equo e che rispetta, incoraggia e valorizza le diversit√†
Un contesto stimolante e dinamico che incentiva la creativit√† e il lavoro di squadra
Modalit√† di lavoro ibrida, per promuovere un sano equilibrio tra vita lavorativa e personale
Programmi di formazione e sviluppo avanzati per rimanere sempre aggiornati
Together for Better ‚Äì I nostri valori e il nostro impegno

Leadership, lavoro in team, rispetto di ogni individualit√†, approfondimento continuo, trasparenza, impegno verso la comunit√†, integrit√†: questi sono i Valori di KPMG che danno vita a un ambiente aperto allo scambio di idee e di conoscenza, che permette ai nostri professionisti di esprimere tutto il loro potenziale.

Grazie all‚Äôimpegno nel favorire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, il nostro Network ha ottenuto le certificazioni ISO 30415, che attesta la conformit√† del Sistema di Gestione per la Diversit√† e l‚ÄôInclusione, e UNI PdR 125, che certifica la parit√† di genere. All‚Äôinterno del nostro Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - trovi riassunte tutte le azioni concrete che stiamo portando avanti su tematiche ambientali, sociali e di governance (ESG).

I tuoi dati saranno trattati nel pieno rispetto delle disposizioni del Regolamento (UE) n. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ""GDPR"") e successive modifiche. Per ulteriori informazioni, consultare l'informativa sulla privacy di KPMG.
KPMG Advisory S.p.A. garantisce le pari opportunit√†.

Flutter, the world‚Äôs largest online sports betting and iGaming group listed on the London and New York stock exchanges, is home to the Southern Europe & Africa (SEA) region, featuring iconic brands like Sisal and PokerStars, a globally loved brand that embodies innovation and ambition, with significant growth potential in a dynamic market.
Support the analysis of business performance, identifying trends and opportunities across Casino, Poker, and Sports Betting.

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

DataCamp's mission is to empower everyone with the data and AI skills essential for 21st-century success. By providing practical, engaging learning experiences, DataCamp equips learners and organizations of all sizes to harness the power of data and AI. As a trusted partner to over 14 million learners and 5,000+ companies, including 80% of the Fortune 1000, DataCamp is leading the charge in addressing the critical data and AI skills shortage.

As a (Senior) Product Data Analyst at DataCamp, you will play a pivotal role in building and maintaining world-class client reporting capabilities. Reporting to the Director of Analytics, you will ensure that our customers understand the value of our platform by making it easy for them to accurately track how their users are leveraging and improving their skills using DataCamp. You'll be deeply involved in working with the product and customer success teams to optimize our client reporting portal, data connectors (APIs), and internal dashboards.

You will influence changes by bringing data to the table and promoting data-driven development and decision-making. To be successful, you will need to collaborate with a strong team of software engineers, data scientists, data engineers, product managers, and customer success leaders. You will get to do all of this while leveraging DataCamp's rich data and state-of-the-art data science infrastructure.

At DataCamp, we seek individuals who embody our core values of data-driven decision-making, action, transparency, ownership, and customer focus. You thrive in a fast-paced, high-performing environment and are driven by a passion for making a meaningful impact. You're adaptable, embracing change and ambiguity with enthusiasm. Your initiative and entrepreneurial spirit push you beyond just meeting targets‚Äîyou aim to understand the ""why"" behind our goals and take ownership to drive the business forward. You're a collaborative team player who values transparency and always seeks to improve and innovate. If this sounds like you, we encourage you to apply!
Perform analyses on how our external and internal B2B clients use our reporting tools and services, providing improvement recommendations to the product management team.
Generate and maintain comprehensive internal reports and dashboards for the customer success team to monitor and identify opportunities for our clients.
Ensure high data quality standards by maintaining accuracy and consistency across internal dashboards and client product reporting tools.

Keep our internal documentation, like data dictionaries, up to date and continuously provide recommendations on existing and new metric definitions to ensure our customers can easily use and find value in the data we provide.
Partner with the customer success and learning solutions teams to work on key accounts by attending meetings to help gather requirements, explain our data and present insights to customers.
Mentor and support team members in analytics best practices, raising the analytics IQ of the customer success and product teams.
Has 3+ years of experience in product, client reporting analytics or a related field.
Has strong storytelling skills with a track record of presenting to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Is highly skilled in SQL and has 2+ years of experience using BI Tools (Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, etc.).
Can easily connect analytics solutions to business outcomes.
Has strong problem-solving skills, with an ability to come to rigorous and defensible solutions to complex and open-ended problems.
Has a passion for DataCamp's mission of data and AI literacy.
Joining DataCamp means becoming part of a dynamic, creative, and international start-up. Here are just a few of the reasons why you'll love being on our team:
Exciting challenges: Face new technical challenges daily, keeping your work engaging and rewarding.
Competitive compensation: We offer a competitive salary with attractive benefits.
Flexibility: Benefit from flexible working hours because the future is flexible!
Continuous learning: Access a yearly learning budget for conferences & training to support your professional growth.
Global retreats: Participate in international company retreats, fostering a global team spirit.
Equipment: Yearly refreshment of your IT Equipment budget for your home working setup.
Amazing team: Collaborate with a truly exceptional team‚Äîseriously, we're awesome!

Our competitive compensation package offers additional benefits. On top of your salary you will also receive extra legal benefits such as best-in-class medical insurance including dental and vision. Depending on your location additional benefits might be available to you.

At DataCamp, we value diverse experiences and perspectives. If you're excited about this role but don't meet every qualification, we still encourage you to apply. We believe skills can be developed and are committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive. Your unique talents and perspectives are what make our team great!

About DataCamp

DataCamp's mission is to empower everyone with the data and AI skills essential for 21st-century success. By providing practical, engaging learning experiences, DataCamp equips learners and organizations of all sizes to harness the power of data and AI. As a (Senior) Product Data Analyst at DataCamp, you will play a pivotal role in building and maintaining world-class client reporting capabilities. Reporting to the Director of Analytics, you will ensure that our customers understand the value of our platform by making it easy for them to accurately track how their users are leveraging and improving their skills using DataCamp. You'll be deeply involved in working with the product and customer success teams to optimize our client reporting portal, data connectors (APIs), and internal dashboards.

To be successful, you will need to collaborate with a strong team of software engineers, data scientists, data engineers, product managers, and customer success leaders. You will get to do all of this while leveraging DataCamp's rich data and state-of-the-art data science infrastructure.

About you

At DataCamp, we seek individuals who embody our core values of data-driven decision-making, action, transparency, ownership, and customer focus. You thrive in a fast-paced, high-performing environment and are driven by a passion for making a meaningful impact. You're adaptable, embracing change and ambiguity with enthusiasm. Your initiative and entrepreneurial spirit push you beyond just meeting targets‚Äîyou aim to understand the ""why"" behind our goals and take ownership to drive the business forward. You're a collaborative team player who values transparency and always seeks to improve and innovate. If this sounds like you, we encourage you to apply!

Responsibilities

  • Perform analyses on how our external and internal B2B clients use our reporting tools and services, providing improvement recommendations to the product management team.

Qualifications

  • Has strong problem-solving skills, with an ability to come to rigorous and defensible solutions to complex and open-ended problems.
  • Strong interpersonal and relationship-building skills.
  • Has a passion for DataCamp's mission of data and AI literacy.

Why Datacamp?

Joining DataCamp means becoming part of a dynamic, creative, and international start-up. Here are just a few of the reasons why you'll love being on our team:

  • Exciting challenges: Face new technical challenges daily, keeping your work engaging and rewarding.
  • Competitive compensation: We offer a competitive salary with attractive benefits.
  • Flexibility: Benefit from flexible working hours because the future is flexible!
  • Continuous learning: Access a yearly learning budget for conferences &

training to support your professional growth.

  • Equipment: Yearly refreshment of your IT Equipment budget for your home working setup.
  • Amazing team: Collaborate with a truly exceptional team‚Äîseriously, we're awesome!

Vuoi fare un lavoro che sia davvero significativo e di impatto? In KPMG avrai l‚Äôopportunit√† di aiutare i clienti, la societ√†, le colleghe e i colleghi ad affrontare e risolvere le sfide pi√π attuali e complesse. KPMG Advisory offre servizi di consulenza alle imprese per affiancarle nella trasformazione del business model, nel miglioramento e nella digitalizzazione dei processi, nell'analisi e nella gestione dei rischi, nonch√© supporto nelle operazioni di finanza straordinaria.
Nel particolare, entrerai a far parte del Team di Lighthouse di Roma.
La Lighthouse √® il centro di eccellenza di KPMG Advisory che offre soluzioni di Data & Analytics sul mercato.

Unendoti al team, svilupperai soluzioni innovative attingendo dalle nostre competenze globali. Combinerai informatica, matematica, statistica e business per creare analisi predittive, presentandole e comunicandole con professionalit√† e competenza. Opererai in un ambiente orientato all'innovazione tecnologica, occupandoti di Data Science, Advanced Analytics, Predictive Maintenance, Natural Language Processing e molto altro! Abbiamo ricevuto riconoscimenti internazionali per quanto riguarda la nostra capacit√† di interpretare e gestire i dati.
Integrazione dei dati: capire quali fonti di dati sono importanti e come devono essere trattate al fine di potenziare nuovi strumenti e metodologie Data Driven
Modellazione: sviluppo di nuovi modelli di Machine Learning ad hoc per soddisfare le richieste e i requisiti aziendali
Piattaforme di analisi avanzate: Sviluppo di pipeline ML complete, dall'ingestione dei dati alle applicazioni frontend.

Incontri ed eventi orientati al business: concentrandosi fortemente sulla condivisione con gli utenti aziendali dei dettagli del progetto, si costruisce la fiducia nello strumento e nella metodologia utilizzata per svilupparlo
Come As You Are - Le tue competenze e caratteristiche
Questa opportunit√† √® perfetta per te se:
Possiedi una Laurea in Data Science, Informatica, Ingegneria Informatica, Ingegneria Matematica, Statistica o altra ritenuta attinente
Hai una buona conoscenza dei principali linguaggi di programmazione come Python e SAS
Hai competenze nella comprensione del ciclo di vita dei modelli: preparazione dei dati dell'ultimo miglio, sviluppo di modelli di intelligenza artificiale e distribuzione in un'infrastruttura cloud
Hai una buona conoscenza di: Data Warehouse, estrazione, manipolazione e preparazione dei dati
Hai competenze di base di Data Visualization, con soluzioni Enterprise (es. PowerBI) o soluzioni open-source come ggplot o plotly
Hai competenze di base con le principali piattaforme cloud (Azure, AWS)
Hai una buona padronanza della lingua inglese, preferibilmente con esperienze di studio e/o lavoro all'estero
Your Future With Us - Cosa troverai in KPMG
Un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, equo e che rispetta, incoraggia e valorizza le diversit√†
Un contesto stimolante e dinamico che incentiva la creativit√† e il lavoro di squadra
Modalit√† di lavoro ibrida, per promuovere un sano equilibrio tra vita lavorativa e personale
Programmi di formazione e sviluppo avanzati per rimanere sempre aggiornati
Together for Better ‚Äì I nostri valori e il nostro impegno

Leadership, lavoro in team, rispetto di ogni individualit√†, approfondimento continuo, trasparenza, impegno verso la comunit√†, integrit√†: questi sono i Valori di KPMG che danno vita a un ambiente aperto allo scambio di idee e di conoscenza, che permette ai nostri professionisti di esprimere tutto il loro potenziale.

Grazie all‚Äôimpegno nel favorire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, il nostro Network ha ottenuto le certificazioni ISO 30415, che attesta la conformit√† del Sistema di Gestione per la Diversit√† e l‚ÄôInclusione, e UNI PdR 125, che certifica la parit√† di genere. All‚Äôinterno del nostro Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - trovi riassunte tutte le azioni concrete che stiamo portando avanti su tematiche ambientali, sociali e di governance (ESG).

I tuoi dati saranno trattati nel pieno rispetto delle disposizioni del Regolamento (UE) n. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ""GDPR"") e successive modifiche. Per ulteriori informazioni, consultare l'informativa sulla privacy di KPMG.
KPMG Advisory S.p.A. garantisce le pari opportunit√†.

column7: • Hai competenze nella comprensione del ciclo di vita dei modelli: preparazione dei dati dell'ultimo miglio, sviluppo di modelli di intelligenza artificiale e distribuzione in un'infrastruttura cloud
column8: • Hai una buona conoscenza di: Data Warehouse, estrazione, manipolazione e preparazione dei dati
column9: • Hai competenze di base di Data Visualization, con soluzioni Enterprise (es. PowerBI) o soluzioni open-source come ggplot o plotly
column10: • Hai competenze di base con le principali piattaforme cloud (Azure, AWS)
column11: • Hai una buona padronanza della lingua inglese, preferibilmente con esperienze di studio e/o lavoro all'estero
column12:
Your Future With Us - Cosa troverai in KPMG

  • Un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, equo e che rispetta, incoraggia e valorizza le diversit√†
  • Un contesto stimolante e dinamico che incentiva la creativit√† e il lavoro di squadra
  • Modalit√† di lavoro ibrida, per promuovere un sano equilibrio tra vita lavorativa e personale
  • Programmi di formazione e sviluppo avanzati per rimanere sempre aggiornati
  • Mindset internazionale e progettualit√† innovative
  • Iniziative incentrate sul benessere psicofisico

Together for Better ‚Äì I nostri valori e il nostro impegno

Leadership, lavoro in team, rispetto di ogni individualit√†, approfondimento continuo, trasparenza, impegno verso la comunit√†, integrit√†: questi sono i Valori di KPMG che danno vita a un ambiente aperto allo scambio di idee e di conoscenza, che permette ai nostri professionisti di esprimere tutto il loro potenziale.

Grazie all‚Äôimpegno nel favorire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, il nostro Network ha ottenuto le certificazioni ISO 30415, che attesta la conformit√† del Sistema di Gestione per la Diversit√† e l‚ÄôInclusione, e UNI PdR 125, che certifica la parit√† di genere. All‚Äôinterno del nostro Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - trovi riassunte tutte le azioni concrete che stiamo portando avanti su tematiche ambientali, sociali e di governance (ESG).

Unisciti a noi!

I tuoi dati saranno trattati nel pieno rispetto delle disposizioni del Regolamento (UE) n. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ""GDPR"") e successive modifiche. Per ulteriori informazioni, consultare l'informativa sulla privacy di KPMG.

KPMG Advisory S.p.A. garantisce le pari opportunit√†.

4203798215,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-0-experience-required-at-peroptyx-4203798215?position=25&pageNum=0&refId=up0NnzPToC6bMNV9F32jKw%3D%3D&trackingId=aLwEeQuGTSCdbneHQDX2wQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst (0 Experience Required),Peroptyx,"Rome, Latium, Italy","For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.

At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.

As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.

With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.
So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!
Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Italy.
Must be living in Italy for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.

For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.


At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.


As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.


With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.


So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!


Benefits

  • Work up to 20 hours per week.
  • Earn a competitive rate of pay.
  • Develop your research skills.
  • Avoid the long commute.
  • Work from the comfort of your home office.
  • Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!


Ideal Candidate

  • Fluent in English and Italian.
  • Excellent research skills.
  • Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
  • Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Italy.
  • Analytical mindset.


Job Requirements

  • Must be living in Italy for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
  • Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
  • Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
  • Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
  • Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
  • All work must be of an independent nature.

Siamo un‚Äôazienda dinamica, con un Dna che si √® plasmato in questi anni grazie al fatto di aver coltivato oltre l‚Äô80% delle nostre risorse dall‚Äôuniversit√†, e in continua trasformazione cos√¨ come il mercato in cui operiamo e del quale siamo fra i player pi√π riconosciuti e grandi del panorama italiano.

Entrando a far parte della nostra squadra, avrai l'opportunit√† di lavorare a stretto contatto con un team di esperti su progetti innovativi e tecnicamente avanzati nell'ambito dati, con l‚Äôobiettivo di aiutare i clienti a sviluppare le loro strategie IT.

Al tuo ingresso in Azienda riceverai una formazione strutturata e sarai supportato da un tutor dedicato che ti guider√† nell'apprendimento delle principali tecnologie di mercato e ti aiuter√† a sviluppare le competenze necessarie.
Laurea Magistrale in Ingegneria Informatica o Informatica
Esperienza pratica con database relazionali e competenza nell'utilizzo di SQL
Una buona conoscenza dei linguaggi Python e Java
Conoscenza preferenziale in ambito Data integration e Database (Relazionali es. MySql)
Interesse per le tecnologie NoSQL e Big Data
Preferibile familiarit√† con strumenti di Data Visualization come Tableau, Power BI o Qlik
Curiosit√†, voglia di imparare, proattivit√† e interesse per i principali trend tecnologici del momento
Ai candidati selezionati verr√† offerto un percorso di sviluppo di carriera e crescita strutturato per obiettivi, con processi formativi sia in ambito tech sia in ambito soft skills.

Nel pacchetto retributivo sono compresi assicurazione medica integrativa, buoni pasto, welfare e convenzioni dipendenti usufruibili su tutto il territorio nazionale, dotazioni integrative per lo smart working.

We are the Lottomatica Group, leader in regulated gaming in Italy and one of the largest European operators, in all areas of activity: sports betting, online gaming and amusement machines. We offer our customers safe and quality gaming experiences, through all channels, putting responsibility and sustainability at the core of the business. Being in Lottomatica is much more than being part of a company: it means contributing to a great and responsible entrepreneurial project.

We are looking for a Data Engineer to join the Advanced Analytics Data Platform team for the development of data flows within the company's Data Platform and the distribution of integrated Artificial Intelligence solutions across all business areas.
At least 2 years of experience in the role
Familiarity with Apache Spark and the Hadoop ecosystem
Depending on seniority, the candidate will be responsible for one or more of the following activities:
Implementation of data consumption pipelines (export pipelines, APIs)
Basic knowledge of Bash and Unix operating systems
Familiarity with MongoDB and NoSQL databases
Experience with SQL Server and Integration Services (SSIS)
Experience in designing cloud-on-premise integration architectures
Expertise in database design, data access strategies and mechanisms, data security and integrity control, engineering services, and distributed systems
What you will find in Lottomatica:
Opportunity to work in the largest betting and gaming company in Italy and one of the largest in the world
Work in a dynamic environment and improve your skills while acquiring new ones
Being challenged to provide impactful solutions for large organisations and have a direct impact on their employees
Opportunity to participate in charity, legality and responsibility projects through engagement in Fondazione Lottomatica
A defined corporate DNA model in which Inclusion, Value of Diversity, Excellence and Collaboration are the pillars
Being part of the world's number one company in the industry for ESG commitment
Permanent contract and hybrid work opportunities
Continuous training on hard and soft skills
Annual gross salary commensurate with experience (40-45K)

Lottomatica implements a policy that guarantees equal opportunities and promotes diversity and inclusion, against all forms of discrimination. At Lottomatica we believe that each person is unique and we consider diversity as a source of personal and organizational enrichment. We strive every day for ours to be an open, safe and inclusive environment, where each person can be fully himself or herself regardless of gender, religion, sex, age, ethnicity, nationality, disability, marital status or sexual orientation.

Scopri di pi√π sulle nostre strategie di Corporate Sustainability, tra cui Well-being, la strategia volta a migliorare il benessere fisico, mentale e sociale delle nostre persone, affinch√© siano felici e piene di energia in tutti gli ambiti della loro vita e WorldClimate, la strategia globale di Deloitte per diventare un‚Äôorganizzazione Net Zero e per guidare scelte responsabili all‚Äôinterno e all‚Äôesterno dell‚Äôorganizzazione.

Sei pront* a #MakeAnImpactThatMatter insieme? Candidati ora!

Le persone interessate possono inviare la propria candidatura con autorizzazione ai sensi del dlgs. 196/2003. La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006, il D.lgs. 215/03 e il D.lgs. 216/03 ed √® aperta a candidat* di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, et√†, etnia e credo religioso. Il presente annuncio √® stato ideato nel rispetto della diversity e dell‚Äôinclusivit√†.

Having delivered over 100 successful Elite Data Engineering initiatives, we have used this experience to create Witboost: a modular, technology-agnostic platform that enables modern organisations to discover, value and produce their data in both traditional environments and fully compliant Data Mesh architectures.
With a highly skilled team of over 160 data engineers based in Europe, Agile Lab helps organisations with their data-driven transformation.
Take a look at our handbook to discover our core values and processes.

We are looking to recruit a talented Rookie Data Engineer to join our team. In this role you will be required to implement data intensive applications. To be successful as an Engineer Rookie, you should have a good knowledge of computer science concepts. You should also have excellent problem solving skills.
Takes well-defined tasks and completing them with a growing autonomy
Understands and adopts our internal SDLC.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Engineering or Computer Science
No previous experience as a Data Engineer
Broad knowledge of computer science concepts
Understand what a development workflow is
Focus on growing as an engineer, learning existing tools, resource and processes
Ability to solve networking, data, and software issues
Full Remote or hybrid working in our offices: Milan, Turin, Padua, Bologna, Catania and Rende
A structured career path with clear expectations and salary for each level
Support of a buddy in the first week of work
A coach as a guide in choosing the most suitable experiences for your ambitions
Benefits and corporate welfare programs: company prizes and welcome pack with all the equipment you need to work
Agile Nomads Experience: opportunity to work for 2 weeks abroad
Referral bonus, if you bring people as talented as you
The opportunity to attend one conference per year
A company rated 4.8 out of 5 for employee satisfaction on Glassdoor and certified as a Great Place to Work
Inclusive environment where you can be who you really are
Stimulating environment oriented to growth, both professional and personal.
We don't like hierarchies: we work as a team
We don't like bureaucracies, we prefer sense of responsibility
We like data, certainly, so anything that is measurable
We want to make a positive change in our industry
Empathy, humility, collaboration, and willingness to challenge ourselves are the basis of our work.
Please note: only candidates based in European time zones (CEST or similar) will be considered for this position

4195481260,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/director-analyst-master-data-management-mdm-remote-at-gartner-4195481260?position=38&pageNum=0&refId=up0NnzPToC6bMNV9F32jKw%3D%3D&trackingId=YYzzkVjzwIWOOZgornQy%2Fw%3D%3D,"Director Analyst, Master Data Management (MDM), Remote",Gartner,"Rome, Latium, Italy","About the role:

Gartner Analysts are industry thought leaders who create must-have research, market predictions and best practices for a broad range of world-leading organizations. A Senior Director serves as a leader within Gartner‚Äôs Research and Advisory sector, establishing oneself as a credible voice within their designated market at local, regional and global levels.

Utilizing exceptional research and analytical skills, a Senior Director plays a significant role in producing pragmatic and provocative research which Gartner clients consume and apply to propel their business toward key objectives. They are a trusted source of advice for clients, reinforcing Gartner‚Äôs value every day by engaging them via in-person meetings, virtual meetings, sales support visits and Gartner conferences to discuss complex client challenges and offer appropriate recommendations.

The successful candidate is a subject matter expert in Master Data Management (MDM) and understands its application across people, processes, and technologies. The candidate will focus on written and customer-facing deliverables to support Data & Analytics Leaders who face the challenges of improving/establishing/reviving MDM initiatives. This role will require in depth knowledge of the MDM Market in addition to a strategic level understanding of the topic.
Create innovative, thought provoking, and highly leveraged ‚Äúmust-have research‚Äù content
Develop new research and ideas through thought leadership and offer compelling, actionable approaches to client's needs and requests that accelerate the client's ability to act
Develop in-depth analysis to identify the root cause of a client‚Äôs barriers or overall needs and reframe thinking to drive strategy forward

Bring provocative, independent insights to Gartner leaders that can evolve the course of a research agenda

About the role:

Gartner Analysts are industry thought leaders who create must-have research, market predictions and best practices for a broad range of world-leading organizations. A Senior Director serves as a leader within Gartner‚Äôs Research and Advisory sector, establishing oneself as a credible voice within their designated market at local, regional and global levels.

Utilizing exceptional research and analytical skills, a Senior Director plays a significant role in producing pragmatic and provocative research which Gartner clients consume and apply to propel their business toward key objectives. They are a trusted source of advice for clients, reinforcing Gartner‚Äôs value every day by engaging them via in-person meetings, virtual meetings, sales support visits and Gartner conferences to discuss complex client challenges and offer appropriate recommendations.

Crediamo nel
valore dell‚Äôeccellenza, che √® la bussola su cui orientiamo il nostro agire, e adottiamo un approccio etico e leale nei confronti di quante e quanti scelgono di

4157911762,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/associate-it-officer-and-business-analyst-based-at-our-luxembourg-at-european-investment-bank-eib-4157911762?position=49&pageNum=0&refId=up0NnzPToC6bMNV9F32jKw%3D%3D&trackingId=W%2B%2BONgnBLgnlBkMcMz3ShA%3D%3D,(Associate) IT Officer and Business Analyst - based at our Luxembourg,European Investment Bank (EIB),"Rome, Latium, Italy","This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence. The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.

The EIB, the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Legal Directorate (JU) ‚Äì Coordination Division (COORD) ‚Äì at its headquarters in Luxembourg, an (Associate) IT Officer and Business Analyst* - This is a full time position at grade 4/5 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.
internal benchmark (Associate) Officer Business Support for IT Applications
Panel interviews are forseen as of March 2025.

This role is based in the Coordination Division of the Legal Directorate. As an (Associate) IT Officer and Business Analyst, you will work in coordination with a Senior Legal Engineering and Innovation Officer to: (i) co-ordinate the prospecting of new applications suitable for the Legal Directorate, (ii) ensure maintenance, assistance, development and deployment of IT applications for the Legal Directorate, (iii) liaise with stakeholders in the Legal Directorate to ensure close alignment with business needs, and (iv) contribute to successful IT project delivery and change management. You will also contribute to the development and maintenance of the Legal Directorate‚Äôs intranet presence and to compliance with the Bank‚Äôs data governance and data quality frameworks.

You will report to and work under the supervision of the Head of Division of JU Coordination. You will work closely with the senior management team of the Legal Directorate, JU divisions and various other counterparts. You will cooperate with central IT Services with other Data Officers and with external consultants.
Contribute to the development and deployment of new IT applications in the Legal Directorate to ensure broad-based, timely and efficient take up of new technologies
Provide support to internal clients concerning existing IT applications used by the Legal Directorate
Develop, deploy and provide ongoing support for the intranet presence of the Legal Directorate
Find new use cases for existing or new IT applications, taking into account the needs of the Legal Directorate relative to the overall IT environment of the Bank

Perform the role of JU Data Officer by: (i) taking the lead in matters related to compliance with EIBG‚Äôs data governance, data management and data quality framework, (ii) identifying and remedying data governance issues adversely affecting the functioning of the Legal Directorate
column2: and (iii) participating in meetings of the Information Governance Steering Committee and analogous bodies to represent the interests of the Legal Directorate

column1: Contribute to streamlining of JU internal processes and map, standardize, control, and automate legal workflows, documents, templates, and electronic records
Provide change management support to IT, Legal Tech & Innovation projects in the Legal Directorate
University degree, preferably in Business Administration, Computer Science/Engineering and / or in another area relevant to the job
At least 3 years of relevant professional experience in a role related to IT engineering and/or innovation
Familiarity with the SDLC (software development lifecycle), ideally at the EIBG or other relevant organization, is required
Business analysis and change management experience would be a strong asset
Knowledge of all or most of the following: Microsoft Sharepoint online, Business Object, Microsoft 365, OpenText Livelink, Smart-IT is required
Excellent organisational skills and ability to prioritise and meet deadlines, with strong result and customer orientation
Understanding of the EIB ‚Äôs mission, organisation and activities
Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (*) with a good command of the other. Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage
Find out more about EIB core competencies here
To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here

(*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.

We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.

We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.

By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
Deadline for applications: This is an open campaign to consecutively fill open positions. The campaign will remain open until position is filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.

This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence. The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.

The EIB, the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Legal Directorate (JU) ‚Äì Coordination Division (COORD) ‚Äì at its headquarters in Luxembourg, an (Associate) IT Officer and Business Analyst* - This is a full time position at grade 4/5 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.

  • internal benchmark (Associate) Officer Business Support for IT Applications

Panel interviews are forseen as of March 2025.

Purpose

This role is based in the Coordination Division of the Legal Directorate. As an (Associate) IT Officer and Business Analyst, you will work in coordination with a Senior Legal Engineering and Innovation Officer to: (i) co-ordinate the prospecting of new applications suitable for the Legal Directorate, (ii) ensure maintenance, assistance, development and deployment of IT applications for the Legal Directorate, (iii) liaise with stakeholders in the Legal Directorate to ensure close alignment with business needs, and (iv) contribute to successful IT project delivery and change management. You will also contribute to the development and maintenance of the Legal Directorate‚Äôs intranet presence and to compliance with the Bank‚Äôs data governance and data quality frameworks.

Operating Network

You will report to and work under the supervision of the Head of Division of JU Coordination. You will work closely with the senior management team of the Legal Directorate, JU divisions and various other counterparts. You will cooperate with central IT Services with other Data Officers and with external consultants.

Accountabilities

  • Contribute to the development and deployment of new IT applications in the Legal Directorate to ensure broad-based, timely and efficient take up of new technologies
  • Provide support to internal clients concerning existing IT applications used by the Legal Directorate
  • Develop, deploy and provide ongoing support for the intranet presence of the Legal Directorate
  • Find new use cases for existing or new IT applications, taking into account the needs of the Legal Directorate relative to the overall IT environment of the Bank
  • Perform the role of JU Data Officer by: (i) taking the lead in matters related to compliance with EIBG‚Äôs data governance, data management and data quality framework, (ii) identifying and remedying data governance issues adversely affecting the functioning of the Legal Directorate
column2:
and (iii) participating in meetings of the Information Governance Steering Committee and analogous bodies to represent the interests of the Legal Directorate
  • Contribute to streamlining of JU internal processes and map, standardize, control, and automate legal workflows, documents, templates, and electronic records
  • Provide change management support to IT, Legal Tech &
column3:
Innovation projects in the Legal Directorate

Qualifications

  • University degree, preferably in Business Administration, Computer Science/Engineering and / or in another area relevant to the job
  • At least 3 years of relevant professional experience in a role related to IT engineering and/or innovation
  • Familiarity with the SDLC (software development lifecycle), ideally at the EIBG or other relevant organization, is required
  • Business analysis and change management experience would be a strong asset
  • Knowledge of all or most of the following: Microsoft Sharepoint online, Business Object, Microsoft 365, OpenText Livelink, Smart-IT is required
  • Excellent organisational skills and ability to prioritise and meet deadlines, with strong result and customer orientation
  • Understanding of the EIB ‚Äôs mission, organisation and activities
  • Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (*) with a good command of the other. Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage

Competencies

Find out more about EIB core competencies here

To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here

(*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.

We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.

We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.

By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.

Deadline for applications: This is an open campaign to consecutively fill open positions. The campaign will remain open until position is filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.

Con sedi a Roma, Napoli e Milano, operiamo in settori come Finance, Insurance, Telco, Energy e Pubblica Amministrazione, collaborando con aziende di primaria importanza ed i principali System Integrator.

4194675434,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-centers-expert-gartner-analyst-remote-emea-at-gartner-4194675434?position=53&pageNum=0&refId=up0NnzPToC6bMNV9F32jKw%3D%3D&trackingId=N52Z%2FFGQ%2Fn3o8us2xgutYw%3D%3D,"Data Centers Expert, Gartner Analyst, Remote EMEA",Gartner,"Rome, Latium, Italy","As a Director Analyst specializing in Cloud and Data Centers at Gartner, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of digital infrastructure by providing strategic advice to CIOs and IT leaders on infrastructure, operations, and cloud strategies. With a focus on emerging technologies and trends, you will deliver actionable insights and thought leadership to our clients. Your expertise will be sought after for keynote speaking engagements and advisory roles across various sectors, including enterprises, governments, and technology providers.
Research and Analysis: Conduct comprehensive research on data center trends, technologies, and strategies. Key areas of focus can include:
Colocation and Datacenters: Explore trends and strategies in colocation services and data center management.
Hybrid Cloud and Multicloud Strategies: Provide insights into hybrid and multicloud environments, including cloud lock-in, portability, and cloud operating models.
Cloud Hyperscalers and Specialty Providers: Analyze the offerings and strategies of major cloud hyperscalers and specialty cloud providers.
Data Center Transformation and Consolidation: Offer strategies for transforming and consolidating data center operations to enhance efficiency and sustainability.
Edge Computing and Future Data Infrastructure: Examine the role of edge computing in modern data infrastructure and its integration with cloud services.
Resilience and Disaster Recovery: Develop strategies for cloud resilience, disaster recovery, and backup solutions, including hyperconverged and integrated systems.
Industry Insight: Offer expert guidance on cloud strategies and the future of data centers, advising executives in large and small enterprises, investors, and service providers.
Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams to develop in-depth research and analysis that addresses the needs of IT leaders and decision-makers.
Client Advisory: Act as a trusted advisor, delivering actionable insights and recommendations to clients across various sectors, including government and technology providers.
Publishing: Author and contribute to research papers, articles, and publications, enhancing Gartner's visibility as a thought leader in data center management and IT infrastructure trends.

Presentations and Conferences: Serve as a keynote speaker at industry events, webinars, and client meetings, engaging with key stakeholders and leading projects such as conference chair for Gartner I&O events.
Bachelor‚Äôs or advanced degree preferably in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
10 years of experience, with significant expertise in data center industry standards, design, operations, trends and strategies, cloud strategies, and IT infrastructure.
Strong blend of technical and business skills, with a track record of advising executives and leading strategic projects.
Excellent analytical and research skills, with the ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
Strong communication and presentation skills, with experience as a keynote speaker.
Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in cross-functional teams.
Track record of thought leadership through publications, presentations, and contributions to the data center and IT infrastructure community.

Relevant certifications, such as Certified Data Center Professional (CDCP), Certified Data Center Management Professional (CDCMP), or others that validate expertise in data center technologies and practices are an asset.
Competitive salary, generous paid time off policy, charity match program, and more!
Group Medical Insurance, Parental Leave, Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
Collaborative, team-oriented culture that embraces diversity.
Professional development and unlimited growth opportunities
At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.
Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.

Since our founding in 1979, we‚Äôve grown to more than 20,000 associates globally who support ~15,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That‚Äôs why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.
What makes Gartner a great place to work?

Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.
We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.
Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.

We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.
Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.

In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive ‚Äî working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.
Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.

The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.

Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company‚Äôs career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.
By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.
For efficient navigation through the application, please only use the back button within the application, not the back arrow within your browser.

As a Director Analyst specializing in Cloud and Data Centers at Gartner, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of digital infrastructure by providing strategic advice to CIOs and IT leaders on infrastructure, operations, and cloud strategies. With a focus on emerging technologies and trends, you will deliver actionable insights and thought leadership to our clients. Your expertise will be sought after for keynote speaking engagements and advisory roles across various sectors, including enterprises, governments, and technology providers.

Location: United Kingdom

Position Type: Full-time

What You Will Do:

  • Research and Analysis: Conduct comprehensive research on data center trends, technologies, and strategies. Key areas of focus can include:
  • Colocation and Datacenters: Explore trends and strategies in colocation services and data center management.
  • Hybrid Cloud and Multicloud Strategies: Provide insights into hybrid and multicloud environments, including cloud lock-in, portability, and cloud operating models.
  • Cloud Hyperscalers and Specialty Providers: Analyze the offerings and strategies of major cloud hyperscalers and specialty cloud providers.
  • Data Center Transformation and Consolidation: Offer strategies for transforming and consolidating data center operations to enhance efficiency and sustainability.
  • Edge Computing and Future Data Infrastructure: Examine the role of edge computing in modern data infrastructure and its integration with cloud services.
  • Resilience and Disaster Recovery: Develop strategies for cloud resilience, disaster recovery, and backup solutions, including hyperconverged and integrated systems.
  • Industry Insight: Offer expert guidance on cloud strategies and the future of data centers, advising executives in large and small enterprises, investors, and service providers.
  • Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams to develop in-depth research and analysis that addresses the needs of IT leaders and decision-makers.
  • Client Advisory: Act as a trusted advisor, delivering actionable insights and recommendations to clients across various sectors, including government and technology providers.
  • Publishing: Author and contribute to research papers, articles, and publications, enhancing Gartner's visibility as a thought leader in data center management and IT infrastructure trends.
  • Presentations and Conferences: Serve as a keynote speaker at industry events, webinars, and client meetings, engaging with key stakeholders and leading projects such as conference chair for Gartner I&
column2:
O events.

What You Will Need:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs or advanced degree preferably in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
  • 10 years of experience, with significant expertise in data center industry standards, design, operations, trends and strategies, cloud strategies, and IT infrastructure.
  • Strong blend of technical and business skills, with a track record of advising executives and leading strategic projects.
  • Excellent analytical and research skills, with the ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
  • Strong communication and presentation skills, with experience as a keynote speaker.
  • Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in cross-functional teams.
  • Track record of thought leadership through publications, presentations, and contributions to the data center and IT infrastructure community.

Certifications:

  • Relevant certifications, such as Certified Data Center Professional (CDCP), Certified Data Center Management Professional (CDCMP), or others that validate expertise in data center technologies and practices are an asset.

What You Will Get:

  • Competitive salary, generous paid time off policy, charity match program, and more!
  • Group Medical Insurance, Parental Leave, Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
  • Collaborative, team-oriented culture that embraces diversity.
  • Professional development and unlimited growth opportunities

Who are we?

At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.

Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.

Since our founding in 1979, we‚Äôve grown to more than 20,000 associates globally who support ~15,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That‚Äôs why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.

What makes Gartner a great place to work?

Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.

We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.

Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.

We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.

What do we offer?

Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.

In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive ‚Äî working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.

Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.

The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.

Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company‚Äôs career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.

4185628252,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-system-engineer-defence-sector-at-rina-4185628252?position=59&pageNum=0&refId=up0NnzPToC6bMNV9F32jKw%3D%3D&trackingId=ppam32FlD%2BWc4UwzHYmRYw%3D%3D,Junior System Engineer (Defence Sector),RINA,"Rome, Latium, Italy","RINA is currently recruiting for a Junior System Engineer (Defence Sector) to join its office in ROME within the Electronics and Systems Engineering Division.

The system engineer consultant support the client to develop tailor-made system solutions that meet specific requirements and provide added value through design and process optimization and efficiency. System Specification activities through the definition and allocation of clear and comprehensive requirements, collaborating with both client stakeholders and end-users to understand system needs.
Requirement Analysis: Collaborate with client development team to specify system requirements, including functional, non-functional, and interface requirements.
System Functionality Definition: Identify and describe the key functionalities of the system, considering requirements and final user needs.
System Specification Development: Organize and structure the System Specification clearly and coherently.
Review and Approval: Conduct periodic reviews of the System Specification with key client stakeholders to ensure the accuracy and completeness of requirements and obtain formal approval.
Change Management: Manage changes in system requirements during the development process, ensuring they are evaluated, documented, and implemented appropriately
Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Aerospace Engineering or Electronics
Technical Knowledge: basic knowledge in front-edge technologies and Space & Defence systems: experience in drafting system requirements for an air/naval defense system
column2: experience in verifying system requirements for an air/naval defense system.

column1: Programming Skills: basic knowledge of at least one programming language.
Knowledge of Best Practices: knowledge of international standards (eg. ISO 15288, ECSS-E-ST-10, MIL-STD-498, DO-254, DO-178, etc.),
knowledge of SW modelling tools (eg. Matlab / Simulink)..
Reporting: Ability to analyze and process data and represent them synthetically (reports, metrics, graphs).
Use of Engineering tools: e.g. IBM DOORS, Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
ADDRESS THE WAY - Have a big picture of different situations and reinterpret it in a perspective way
BUILD NETWORK - Forge trust relationships, across departments, and outside the organization
CLIENT INTIMACY - Embrace internal and external client needs, expectations, and requirements to ensure maximum satisfaction
EARN TRUST - Take everyone's opinion into account and remain open to diversity
MAKE EFFECTIVE DECISIONS - Structure activities according to priorities, actions, resources and constraint
MANAGE EMOTIONS - Recognise one's and other's emotions and express and regulate one's reactions
PIONEER CHANGE - Actively embrace change and benefit from the new circumstances
PROMOTE SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT - Promote commitment by keeping promises as a Role Model
THINK FORWARD - Capitalise on experiences and translate them into action plans for the future

With over 5,800 employees and 200 offices in 70 countries worldwide, RINA is a multinational player which provides certification, marine classification, product testing, site supervision and vendor inspection, training and engineering consultancy services across a wide range of sectors. Our business model covers the full process of project development, from concept to completion. The aim is to guarantee a project‚Äôs technical, environmental and safety - and sometimes also economic and financial - sustainability.

At RINA, we endeavor to create a work environment where every single person is valued and encouraged to develop new ideas. We provide equal employment opportunities and are committed to creating a workplace where everyone feels respected and safe from discrimination or harassment of any kind. We are also compliant to the Italian Law n. 68/99.

RINA is currently recruiting for a Junior System Engineer (Defence Sector) to join its office in ROME within the Electronics and Systems Engineering Division.

Mission

The system engineer consultant support the client to develop tailor-made system solutions that meet specific requirements and provide added value through design and process optimization and efficiency. System Specification activities through the definition and allocation of clear and comprehensive requirements, collaborating with both client stakeholders and end-users to understand system needs.

Key Accountabilities

  • Requirement Analysis: Collaborate with client development team to specify system requirements, including functional, non-functional, and interface requirements.
  • System Functionality Definition: Identify and describe the key functionalities of the system, considering requirements and final user needs.
  • System Specification Development: Organize and structure the System Specification clearly and coherently.
  • Review and Approval: Conduct periodic reviews of the System Specification with key client stakeholders to ensure the accuracy and completeness of requirements and obtain formal approval.
  • Change Management: Manage changes in system requirements during the development process, ensuring they are evaluated, documented, and implemented appropriately

Education

Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Aerospace Engineering or Electronics

Qualifications

Technical Knowledge: basic knowledge in front-edge technologies and Space &
column2: Defence systems: experience in drafting system requirements for an air/naval defense system
column3:
experience in verifying system requirements for an air/naval defense system.

Programming Skills: basic knowledge of at least one programming language.

Knowledge of Best Practices: knowledge of international standards (eg. ISO 15288, ECSS-E-ST-10, MIL-STD-498, DO-254, DO-178, etc.),

knowledge of SW modelling tools (eg. Matlab / Simulink)..

Reporting: Ability to analyze and process data and represent them synthetically (reports, metrics, graphs).

Use of Engineering tools: e.g. IBM DOORS, Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).

Competencies

  • ADDRESS THE WAY - Have a big picture of different situations and reinterpret it in a perspective way
  • BUILD NETWORK - Forge trust relationships, across departments, and outside the organization
  • CLIENT INTIMACY - Embrace internal and external client needs, expectations, and requirements to ensure maximum satisfaction
  • EARN TRUST - Take everyone's opinion into account and remain open to diversity
  • MAKE EFFECTIVE DECISIONS - Structure activities according to priorities, actions, resources and constraint
  • MANAGE EMOTIONS - Recognise one's and other's emotions and express and regulate one's reactions
  • PIONEER CHANGE - Actively embrace change and benefit from the new circumstances
  • PROMOTE SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT - Promote commitment by keeping promises as a Role Model
  • THINK FORWARD - Capitalise on experiences and translate them into action plans for the future

With over 5,800 employees and 200 offices in 70 countries worldwide, RINA is a multinational player which provides certification, marine classification, product testing, site supervision and vendor inspection, training and engineering consultancy services across a wide range of sectors. Our business model covers the full process of project development, from concept to completion. The aim is to guarantee a project‚Äôs technical, environmental and safety - and sometimes also economic and financial - sustainability.

At RINA, we endeavor to create a work environment where every single person is valued and encouraged to develop new ideas. Al tuo ingresso in Azienda riceverai una formazione strutturata e sarai supportato da un tutor dedicato che ti guider√† nell'apprendimento delle principali tecnologie di mercato e ti aiuter√† a sviluppare le competenze necessarie.
Laurea Magistrale in Ingegneria Informatica o Informatica

4201266999,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-experis-italia-4201266999?position=2&pageNum=2&refId=2MLIlXP4%2BULem4TjVIx08A%3D%3D&trackingId=FXrrWujLU7fXAqMKPM3xLQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Experis Italia,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Experis ricerca un Data Analyst per potenziare la nostra divisione Aerospace & Defence nella sede di Roma.

Come Data Analyst, ti occuperai di supportare la definizione dell'architettura dei sistemi AI per l‚Äôanalisi di dati provenienti da sensori, piattaforme e sistemi embedded della nave militare e definire strategie per la gestione e la qualit√† dei dati operativi, la progettazione e l‚Äôestrazione di dati rilevanti in ogni fase del ciclo di vita del prodotto.
Le caratteristiche della persona che si unir√† al Team Experis
‚Ä¢Laurea magistrale in Ingegneria dei Sistemi, Informatica, Ingegneria Elettronica o discipline affini.
‚Ä¢ Esperienza di almeno 2 anni nel supporto a progetti di trasformazione digitale preferibilmente in ambito aerospaziale, navale o della difesa.
‚Ä¢ Conoscenza di base delle architetture AI distribuite e delle infrastrutture di elaborazione dati applicate a sistemi complessi.
‚Ä¢ Esperienza nell‚Äôanalisi di dati provenienti da sensori e sistemi (big- DATA).
‚Ä¢ Competenze in raccolta dei requisiti, validazione e verifica di sistemi AI.
‚Ä¢ Conoscenza dei principali standard e normative di sicurezza informatica applicabili ai sistemi di difesa.

Personal and professional development - being part of one of the main VET players

At Zoetis, our purpose is to nurture the world and humankind by advancing care for animals. As a Fortune 500 company and the world leader in animal health, we discover, develop, manufacture and commercialize vaccines, medicines, diagnostics and other technologies for companion animals and livestock. We know our people drive our success. Our award-winning culture, built around our Core Beliefs, focuses on our colleagues' careers, connection and support. We offer competitive healthcare and retirement savings benefits, along with an array of benefits, policies and programs to support employee well-being in every sense, from health and financial wellness to family and lifestyle resources.

Connected to our purpose and Core Beliefs, at Zoetis, we lead with inclusion. Our Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DE&I) focus helps create an environment where each colleague can thrive. Our commitment to DE&I begins with our leadership team of diverse backgrounds, experiences and ethnicities, and it is demonstrated in our support of our colleagues and the animal health industry. We have nine colleague resources groups whose members spread awareness, foster inclusivity and make a positive impact on our business and communities.

Our commitment to advancing Diversity, Equity and Inclusion has earned us recognitions as a 2024 Catalyst Award recipient and a Top 50 Company for Workplace Fairness by Fair360 (formerly DiversityInc). Zoetis has also been named a Best Place to Work for LGBTQ+ Equality, a Best Company for Working Parents, a Top Company for Executive Women, among many others. Learn more here.

We are the Lottomatica Group, leader in regulated gaming in Italy and one of the largest European operators, in all areas of activity: sports betting, online gaming and amusement machines. We offer our customers safe and quality gaming experiences, through all channels, putting responsibility and sustainability at the core of the business. Being in Lottomatica is much more than being part of a company: it means contributing to a great and responsible entrepreneurial project.

We are looking for a Data Engineer to join the Advanced Analytics Data Platform team for the development of data flows within the company's Data Platform and the distribution of integrated Artificial Intelligence solutions across all business areas.
At least 2 years of experience in the role
Familiarity with Apache Spark and the Hadoop ecosystem
